She simply doesn’t hear and light up. I’m excited for it’s potential not it’s current state as it currently isn’t much more than a speaker and light switch for me

Works fine, sounds good. It left a mark on my tabletop. The rubber seemed to erase oil stain. Not happy about that. Sadly, we made 2 marks because we didn’t realize what was doing it. Damage in less than 24 hours.

This product is fantastic. It was as easy as downloading the app, plugging up the Echo, setting up in the app and away we went. Recognises both mine and my wife's voices. Working on a smart home setup and started with a 4 pack of ETEKCITY Wi-Fi outlets and used the app for them. In a matter of 15 mins I had Alexa up and running and 3 devices connected to her as well. I will be adding wall switches as well as a thermostat down the road. The ease of setup was astounding and finding a central location in a 2 story house was tough. I chose the living room because the sound quality is superb and could not believe the music coming out of the device. Now my wife can turn on her bedside lamp before going upstairs and the lamp by her chair in the living room. I also have an outlet in the kitchen for a fan to help circulate air. THE main incecntive to purchase was the $20 discount and got a great deal on the outlets. I know I will have to purchase another Echo or Echo and place upstairs.

I like the echo, but its not without its flaws. First of all the sound is very loud, surprisingly so actually, but at max volume there is quite a bit of distortion so I would recommend keeping it a notch or so below max. Second, the bass is very nice for some songs, but for others its incredibly overdone and lacking in the mids/highs. Alexa is fairly responsive and so far responds correctly to most commands. It supports multiple music platforms such as Pandora, Prime Music Unlimited and others, but notably absent is support for Apple music. You can work around this by using the it as a bluetooth speaker, but that takes a big part of the functionality away so this is a workaround at best. It was very easy to setup, even for someone who may not be very technical. The third party "skills" have a lot to be desired in my opinion, most are so full of ads they are unusable, Id like to see this improved. I'd rather see the option to pay a few bucks to "buy" the skill vs a subscription or tons of ads even if they are just ads for their own product.

OH MY GOODNESS! Warning I'm a HUGE Alexa / Echo fan lol. I have been since the first one came out and it just gets better and better. This one looks amazing and sounds amazing. The only thing I miss is the turn top for the volume. I really love that on the Plus but it's just beautiful. It was so easy to setup and going. Found all my lights fast and boom it's a new addition to the family haha. The material is really great. I do hope they make the 3rd gen where you can swap the fabric as needed like the dots but it's so stylish. The blue ring is in full glory as well ;) hey I warned you I'm a huge fan haha. Look on YouTube under Zachus, there's a video where you can see the size. It's about half the size of the original. I do a side by side comparison and show you what's in the box.

I love the echo that we purchased a few months ago. For years we've been using a boombox (from the 90s) since our cell phones were not good enough to use as a radio in our house. We saw Alexa as a way to have music in the house, which she does, but she does so much more too. My favorite functions are playing music, setting a timer, adding things to my shopping list, and calling my kids at home through Alexa. I had no idea when I bought it that my husband would take to it so well. We were all stuck listening to David Bowe at high volumes for a few days after it arrived. :) The one we got is charcoal gray, and while it is not an object d'art, it is really useful and not offensive to my decor. I can easily move it from one room to another without losing settings or anything if I need to. I'm considering getting an additional dot for another part of the house. It was easy to set up. I'm ok with technology, but really it only took me like, 10 minutes to set everything up, so it is not hard. I was at a furniture store the other day when my kids called me through Alexa. Our furniture store associate thought that was so cool he had me help him connect to his Echo so he could call his kid and it took about 1 minute to set up. I do find the calling to be echo-y though--it's not crystal clear sound for the calling in my experience. I had read some of the reviews about the music speaker sound not being that great, and I found that it is perfectly fine for our family. I love that I can play pandora and I heart radio on it. One thing I wish it could do is play library-rented audio books. It will only play audio books from audible currently. You can have Alexa read books to you but I find that her automated voice is really annoying for book reading--inflections are all wrong. So, it is not perfected, but it is a great purchase none the less.

I have only had my echo a few days and am still figuring it all out, but I'm pleased with what i've seen so far. I'm not extremely technologically advanced, but have been using it to play music. It is set up in my bedroom, which is a larger than average master bedroom. The sound quality is extremely impressive. I can easily hear it even outside of the bedroom in another room. Whether the volume is low or high, the sound quality is not compromised and the bass is excellent. It's much better than playing music from my smart TV, laptop or phone. I also like telling Alexa what genre to play and letting her do the work to decide what song comes next. She keeps streaming great songs, some I haven't heard in a long time and had forgotten about. I also use it for an alarm in the morning. I will try out the reminders and other features in the future. I am still figuring out how to sync it with my phone's bluetooth so I can stream Youtube sometimes. My only complaint is it started talking in the middle of the night last night when I had already put it on 'do not disturb' mode. It scared me right out of the bed! Hope that doesn't keep happening. I am happy with it overall and excited to see what else it can do. But even if you are only using it for music - it's excellent. No need for a fancy home surround system, just a few of these (depending on size of home) should do the trick.

You have to download a lot of "SKILLS" for Alexa to work properly. Wish there was a way to recommend a skill so it could be added to Alexa. Most skills I could care less about. It does work great for turning on and off things, but you need to buy the correct product that is compatible with it. The TV commercials are deceiving. They don't say you need to buy extra items. Wish there was also a way that you could play your music through Alexa from your PC. I wont pay 9.99 a month to get amazon unlimited music. Alexa does work great with IHeart radio app. Sometimes Alexa will "ding" as if someone asked a question but then it will not do anything. Kind of creepy when you hear it and you're just watching TV or reading a book.

I am such a fan, I've caught myself missing her while running errands and almost talked to her the other day in the Doctors office! I wish I had had this when my kids were in the "But Why?" phase, it's so nice to ask them if they asked Alexa and this isn't about putting off my kids - we talk A LOT, but this is about when they have a ton of questions and I am not Google, I admit it is interesting to hear the answers she gives. Also I would like to note that my two youngest have begun to speak much more clearly, the peer pressure of getting snickered at because you aren't understood does wonders and we are a loving family so there are no bad feelings just rueful exasperation from the mush-mouthed questioner. I will say I wish Alexa interacted better with manners, it might sound ridiculous to some people but manners matter and it's a social habit that should be maintained at all times. The sound quality is really good, though I wish for better bass.. a future add on feature perhaps? I am a little sad the wake word is so limited, I would like to name this new family member like I did the others both kids and fur-kids. I also wish the timer sounds were different, they blend into a busy household - last I checked between the alarm and timer sounds one was customizable and the other was not and yes this makes a big difference when using Alexa on the fly. Perhaps some meme-ish sounds from pop culture and movies as an alert?

I bought the full-size Echo instead of the Dot because I wanted good sound. All the songs I tried sounded great, and even AM radio! But for a real test I asked Alexa to play the "Grand Canyon Suite" and to increase the volume. I was blown away by the deep bass without distortion from such a small device. This would also be a great gift for anyone who lives alone. It's like having a friend right there to talk to.

So I’m 19 and I have horrible memory problems from trauma, etc etc. and I got this hoping to help me keep track of things and start working on automating parts of my house. I was originally gonna get an iPad or something, but I already have an iPhone and I wanted something a bit different. I was worried that only using the voice control with no screen would be confusing, but this thing has been working SEAMLESSLY. First of all, the sound is GREAT. It’ll play my Spotify songs easily and it sounds amazing with adjustable equalizer in the Alexa app. Second, it’s easy to set alarms, look things up, get news, make lists or reminders, and a LOT more. For someone that has a hard time with day to day things because of my memory, the echo is like the personal assistant I could never afford to hire. Except I can afford this!! Okay I know this all sounds cliche but for real, this thing is legit. Before I got it I thought that it was a bit silly to buy an echo dot and stuff for every room in the house, but now that I have it, I want one for every room in the house. Long story short, it helps out people like me that have a hard time keeping their brain in order.

Really loving this Amazon Echo 2nd Generation so far. I have the original Echo and it having a hard time hearing me most of the time, it was really big as well, though the speaker was loud it feels like it has no bass at all at high volume. I decided to give the Amazon Echo 2nd Generation it a try when it was finally marked down to $79.99, and what a difference it has made. The design is small and compact that it fits better anywhere you place it. I was worried that the sound quality would be bad since it is so much smaller, but the volume is really loud at max and it has more bass then the original. I'm really impressed with the built-in Mic, it now has 7 mic built-in pointing in all direction of the speaker. It can hear me much further and understand me much better now. I also bought a smart power strip with this and plug in many of my electronic devices and it has made my life a lot better and I feel like living in the future. I can now just say "Alexa turn TV On" "Alexa Turn Printer On." I can also use it as a blue tooth speaker to play my music when I go to sleep. Overall, it was worth it and definitely recommended it. Be even better when you can get it while it is on sale, then it is a definite steal!

My brother got me an Echo Dot for Christmas a few days ago. I wasn't sure what I was going to use it for, after all I have a great smart phone and laptops/devices galore in the house. But after playing with it awhile I was smitten and had to try out the larger Echo Revision 2 for the bedroom because of sound quality. I'm not disappointed. I'm still not sure what I'm going to do for sound in the living room, I'll probably get the Dot it's own speaker and subwoofer unless I can find an elegant way to integrate it. For now I'm sold. Love this device.

I just got this today and if I only used it to listen to music I would have been beyond impressed.. the sound is awesome and the response is so fast from Alexa it is almost scary.. Love love love it... I have tried a few games and it was also fun, asked a few questions and got good answers, not all the time but pretty darn good results considering I have been using it less than 12 hours.. can not wait to show this off to family and friends.. will really be great when when I can control my directv with it.. soon I am sure. best $80 I spent this year.

First of all; I've never used any of the other devices made by other companies such as the Google Home, but Amazon Echo has been a joy to use and easy to set up. Her skills are pretty great, I've only got a few that I use everyday. It's nice to know that she's programed to answer questions as though she were a person. I think the only major downside is that I live in a rural area, so some of Alexa's skills like Uber and Dominos are not something I can use to my advantage. One of my wife and I's favorite features is the 'drop in' ability. As long as you have wifi and are using the Alexa App, you can drop in from anywhere. It's so nice to not have to wait to dial one of our cell phones if we know one of us is home. One of the only other things I'll mention in the way of a complaint, is that sometimes you have to be over specific when making a music request. Alexa doesn't default to my purchased music library, but it could be a setting I'm missing. In the end, we'll be planning on getting at least one more Echo and a Show. Alexa is a wonderful addition to any home.

I did NOT buy this to listen to ** music **, but rather for news and spoken word. I find that the speakers are acceptable for that use, I cannot vouch for how you might experience your music on this device. I regret that this model has only wired power (whereas you can buy a battery for the echo Dot, and make the Dot portable and not have to rely on wired power for the Dot). ON my first attempt, setup was slow and I wasn't always sure if setup was working, stalled or crashed. I simply aborted that attempt to set up. However, on the second attempt to setup, days later, it progressed without me having to attempt more than once and without me having to consult online support or user forums.

Yes, I do like the new unit ... sound is good, price is much better than Original ... but performance is no better than the Original. I currently have an Original Echo, 2 Echo Dots, an Echo Tap, and the "new" Echo. I have a Dot in Master Bedroom with a split pair of Bose Speakers wired, a Dot in my Office connected (wired) to a Sony Sound System, The Original and New Echos in Living Room and Kitchen/Dining Room (open floor plan) ... Tap is in my Garage and is often taken out to Patio in good weather. Frustrating to me is using Music Group ... which now appears to work well on Amazon Music, but not when requesting SiriusXM (which will only work on an individual unit). Tech Support swore the problem would be fixed about a month ago in two days. If this is a SiriusXM Licensing limitation ... say so!

Ok, I'm hooked on Alexa. After all the stupid commercials, half of which I never really understood why anyone would that the product, I got an Echo Dot for the reminder feature. Within two weeks, my entire house is populated and I have these versions too. Alexa, who we call Abooboo in order not to set her off when talking about her (she arrived right after a screening of Aladdin, lol) , can do so little and yet so much. I just love having music everywhere in the house, whatever kind just pops in my mind. I even got Amazon music (who knew it was so cheap?) so I had even more music to choose from. I get the weather, the traffic, trivia, jokes, reminders (omg, how did I live without the reminders?), and no more both of you staring blankly because neither can remember the important thing we needed which is not on the grocery or shopping lists. I threw over our Google overlords for Alexa. Abooboo is our new leader, and we welcome her domination! However, Abooboo is not for the feint of heart, as she comes with little or no instructions. I had to google (ironic, right?) how to do things. Why can't I just ask her how to set up this feature or that? She says she doesn't know. I realize the days of instruction manuals are gone, but this gadget really needs one. More than once when working things out I almost threw her back in the box to Amazon. Heads up, guys. Not everyone out there wants to be wedded to their computer to figure out a product. Give us a freakin' booklet! Now if you will excuse me, Abooboo has just informed me I have to call my Dad. ;-)

Let me start by saying that this is my first echo device. I got it because i know a few people who have them and they've recommended me to it. To make this review easy and to the point i have listed it's core aspects below and i'll say what i like about them and what i don't like about them. 1. Design - The design of this device is quite stylish. It sports a black leather casing that can be swapped out at any time for a new case. If it happens to get dirty, just put a new one on and it's like new again! 2. Sound - With this being a speaker, you can't review it without talking about its sound quality. The sound quality on this is quite excellent for it's size and is able to be quite loud in a decent sized room. The highs are crisp and the bass is enough to make my desk rattle. 3. Alexa - Alexa works okay on here. However, there are times (more often then not) where she can't hear me and i have to talk pretty loud. Other times, she do a command that is the exact opposite of what i wanted her to do in the first place. This happens all the time and gets pretty annoying to the point where i just stop using it for a while. Verdict - This speaker is small, stylish, and packs great sound into an inexpensive smart speaker.

It is as the title says, Alexa just can't grasp Spanish at an acceptable level. When it does understand a single request like turn on the lights or play XY song, you have to say it very slowly to the point when it's annoying. Then there is finding Spanish music, just as much as a pain if you're using Amazon unlimited music, but there are other streaming sites to use that are better. It also does not help that the Alexa AI isn't optimized for the different types of Spanish. The way a central American speaks Spanish has some differences from how Mexicans or Spaniards speak it. Of course there isn't a huge difference but you will run into those problems on occasion. It is a good little speaker and it works great when using it on English instead of Spanish. But I bought this product instead of the Google home because I was told that the echo now fully supported Spanish which made it more tempting after considering that amazon Alexa's work more flawlessly than the Google homes for ever day task. In the end that was just a sales pitch and the Spanish mode is not on the level it should be for every day family use. Just a heads up; you also need to have a subscription for Amazon music unlimited (not included with prime), Spotify premium, or one of the other stated music streaming sites to actually use the echo to it's full potential. There are still people out there who don't pay to stream music, but rather own the music instead, and they should know before buying.

I got it for the speaker. HUGE sound! My parents got an Echo and gave me an Echo Dot, but dang, the huge sound coming from the Echo! Had to get one on Black Friday, and I’m able to do monthly payments! I can intercom between the Echo Dot upstairs in my bedroom to my Echo downstairs in the living room and kitchen. Super fun. With all the Alexa functionality it makes me want to get more Echos for around my house. It even convinced me to buy a Fire stick. I’m a total sucker and really like Amazon’s product line now.

Absolutely love myAlexa! I, in fact, have 5 of them. Started off with the dot, and very quickly decided I wanted a better one. So I bought the tall one (dont know what generation, but the best at the time) the sound is AMAZING, its in my bedroom, upstairs. Then bought the Alexa Show, sound and all graphics, its on the kitchen. AMAZING!! Then I bought the generation 2 in walnut for lower level family room. So convenient and AMAZING, closely matches my cherry wood funishings in that room. Then I opened up my sunroom (its a 3 -4 season, depending on how cold it gets in winter, sometimes use a heater). Furnishings in there are light oak, so I bought the light oak for that room. Was worried about the shade of oak while waiting for it. I was pleasantly surprised to see that iy matches perfectly! Again the sound is AMAZING!!! So much fun to have and versatile. It is everything Amazon promised and more! I love them all and when i play music I can sync them all together to play same music at same time, thru out the whole house!!

Can't remember life without this, and I've only had it a week! First one did not connect properly but Amazon sent me a new one immediately before I even returned the first. Second one connected seamlessly to my internet. Absolutely love that I can set timers, alarms, get the weather, news and play games all just by speaking in my room. Buying another for my office at work. 1 * off because the build of this is not what it could be. The sides are soft and could easily be torn or bent if it fell over. I brought a great stand to go with it but a case or stand should come with it because of the speaker material on the sides of it. Since I order from Amazon four or five times a week, I love to be able to ask where my order is get updates Etc. My daughter has a Dot and the quality and sound between the Dot and Echo is vastly different and worth the difference in price. I only wish it would connect to more music apps. I use slacker and would like that to connect as well as the music that is stored on my phone. It would be nice if it could play the playlist I have already built on my device. Hopefully that will be added. Also would like different name options. It's petty, but I don't like Alexa so I call mine Echo but would like more than three choices to wake it up

My husband & I kicked off our Alexa experience with a 2nd gen Dot in mid-December. It was fun learning the various things we can do with Alexa (note: we did not purchase the Dot specifically as a speaker). We also purchased a few companion products (Wemo plugs, Philips Hue bulbs, Vivint Home security, Firesticks) and enabled the corresponding smart home skills. We’ve also enabled quite a few additional skills over the last 2+ months. About the time that we started listening to music on our Dot, we decided that we liked the idea and were having fun with Alexa, enough that it would be worth it to purchase another device so we could have one on each of the upper 2 floors of our house. We purchased the Echo (sandstone fabric) in early January. The first thing we noticed is that the sound quality with music on the Echo is significantly better than the Dot. We’ve had no issues with either device not registering our commands, in fact, both devices routinely pick up our commands from one room away. That said, our house is fairly quiet, not much competing noise. These days, in addition to the smart home skills, we frequently stream a local radio station or Pandora on our Echo and find the sound quite acceptable! We’re not musicians but we do enjoy having music on, in the background, throughout the day. Overall, we continue to find new, sometimes interesting and helpful uses for Alexa & our Alexa devices. Also, we are very happy with the sandstone fabric, it has a nice, clean, neutral look.

I do enjoy using Alexa. One of m favorite features is you can make calls from it. We had debated getting an additional cell phone juat to leave at home on those rare occasions when my kids needed to call me. This has done the trick! If I have to run a quick errand I know my older kids can still reach me! That being said its not quite as user friendly as I would like. Some of its features it seems you have to ask the question in just the right way to work (this seems more so with prime music). However I am very happy with the product! We use it as a sort of intercom to call our kids in the basement.

I have a family of 5 including 3 children under 11. Alexa has been a great addition to our family! From impromptu dance offs to family game night, kids court for discussions and disagreements, timers and reminders, updates on package tracking, and making calls, sending texts, and more while hands free —we love it! The drop in feature comes in handy when trying to call the kids down from upstairs for dinner too! Highly recommended!

Alexa is great, I think the speaker sound is very good and I love playing trivia games with my friends and calling out and having her play music on my whim, but Alexa also has some listening problems. To give some context I was raised in the midwest and have virtually no accent, and a very clear and loud voice, however sometimes Alexa has difficulty understanding or hearing my voice. This isnt a constant issue, but still an occasional nuisance. Amazon music also isnt free, even if you already have Amazon prime, ALOT of music is included with Amazon Prime, but alot also isnt, which is disappointing considering it is the most convienient way to listen to specific music with Alex using voice commands. Overall, I would probably rate Alexa at 3.5 stars because I love talking to it and the convienience factor it offers, but it definitely could be better.

Good for the price. This is a unit that probably would be normally about $150 if it were another brand. It’s an Amazon product so that means value, not necessarily a great quality product, but nevertheless a decent product for the cost of it. The sound is above average until you go up to about 75-80% and then the bass diminishes. The sound is at its best around half way up or around 60% volume. Alexa doesn’t get what I ask her but that could be my accent so I cannot blame her for that. The phone answer did not work for me while the music was playing so I returned the echo connect device. It basically answered the phone while it was playing the music so you and the person on the phone could hear the music and did not carry the conversation because of it. I still have not used a smart device with it so cannot comment on it. Overall I give this product a 4 stars for it’s sound quality and the product looks and the material used to make it. Perhaps I should have purchased the Echo Plus, I don’t know? Compared to Apple HomePod it is inferior but so is the price as Apple’s product costs 5 times more than Echo and almost 3 times more than Echo Plus.

Like everyone else, I almost placed it right back in the box to return it. I decided to hold on to it for a couple of weeks since I had till Nov 30 to get my money back. The update that everyone is referencing really did improve the sound exponentially. Is the sound better than a Gen 1 Echo? No. Is it close? Yes. Close enough to convince me to keep it and hope they can keep tweaking the audio a little bit more instead of the rushed fix to prevent everyone from returning their new Echos. Overall I'm happy with the purchase now instead of the immediate regret in the purchase.

Compared to the prior version it's both easier on the eyes and the sound quality is far better to the point that it's better than other BT speakers in the same price range, however, I didn't need a BT speaker. The issue son this one remain the same as the issues on the old versions: If you don't mind them it's a good product. - Problems recovering from whole home audio: If I play a song through this while connected to my soundbar in whole home audio, when it's done, it won't connect back to my soundbar again unless I do a hard reboot (unplug/plug it back in). - It randomly talks to itself. Occasionally in a completely quiet room, this or any of my others will randomly reply to unasked questions. It also can be triggered by noise from the TV other than the trigger word. - Although the unit closes to the speaker is supposed to activate on keyword, that isn't the case. I've had units 40' further away respond. When I called Amazon Tech support I was told that you fix this was to change the trigger words (which isn't a fix, it's a workaround). One of the reasons I replaced an old one with this was to see if that was fixed.... it wasn't. Overall I still "like' the product and would probably "love" it if they fixed the quirks, but I'm not holding my breath. It still plays all my music, wakes me up and puts me to sleep with my news feeds and answers the occasional question for me. If it didn't interface so effortlessly into prime music I probably would have gone with a Google.

Edited to add: problem solved by unplugging the device, and plugging it back in. After that I had to walk back through the setup, but that's quite easy to do. Now working flawlessly. Possible cause? I added a wireless extender not too long ago, and this device is pretty close to the extender, so maybe there was some issue with trying to use the extended Wi-Fi Channel? Not sure . By the way, Amazon gets kudos for customer service, they actually called me to find out what the problem was and see if they could help me with it, although by then I'd already fixed it. Bravo, Amazon! Previous entry: delivered today, first Echo device to not work flawlessly. Briefly worked as intended, sounded great, but now doesnt appear on my list of devices in the app (this is my fifth one, so pls dont tell me how it should be set up) and is flashing a red light at me. Annoying. I'm sure i can get this straightened out, but there's no reason for it not to work right away.

SO much better than the first gen. I had to make it as a single room as the mic's were picking me up in the back of the house and I have the first gen there. People complain about the sound I find no problems with it only that the base may not be as deep as the first gen. Update: I had to drop a star. After having the Echo a little over a month now. My Alexa needs a hearing aide. I have it about 15 feet away from me and she has problems hearing. Infact my 1st gen Echo is in the back of the house and she ends up answering me I have to scream so loud. She could hear great when I got her but now, like I said, she needs a hearing aide.

As this is my first Echo, the sound output is far superior to the Echo Dot devices I had purchased in the past. I read many reviews that stated the sound was sub standard to the original Echo, that may be true, but not for a first time purchaser of this product. The sound is great and fills the room. Base is good, mids fine and the high notes are decent. There is a fine line between good and tin-ee (like a tin can speaker) sounding highs, the Echo is not tin-ee sounding at all. I do like the option to play music that is synced up with my other Dots, this must be a fairly new function I was unaware of. I love the ability to walk for room to room with my music playing "Everywhere". Everything else works as you would expect. Good product and will buy another.

After using the Echo for about a month, I can say it is at best "entertaining" at trying to make it understand what you want. It's search for trivia is lacking. If you expect results like you would get with a google search, you will be very disappointed. A lot of times my wife and I are watching TV and we ask Alexa about an actor or actress, and many times we come up short and resort to google on our tablet. Adding skills can add to the functionality, but many of the skills are more for marketing purposes rather than providing useful functionality to you. There is a "DeWalt Tools" skill that will let you ask: "Alexa, ask DeWalt Tools what is your history"... I'd like to meet any person who would find this skill useful... just so I could ask "WHY? Why would you enable such a useless skill?" I can see Alexa being much more useful if you have smart devices in your home, such as a connected thermostat, roomba, garage door opener, etc. as asking Alexa to change the thermostat setting, or asking if the garage door is open, would be very useful. Using Alexa to add events to my google calendar is also not quite ready for prime-time. You would think this would be relatively easy, however, how Alexa and Google handle timezones creates a problem. (Alexa does not send timezone information with the request, so google assumes the time is GMT when storing the event, however, since google has my timezone set as PST - it converts the GMT time to PST when displaying it.) Personally - IMO Google has this correct, and Alexa should send my timezone with the request to create the event. After all, she knows my timezone. On the brighter side - Alexa does have an opinion - albeit clinical - to the question "Alexa - does size really matter?"

I have had this for about a month. Almost every app that I have tried either doesn't work or requires too much time trying to get it to work. I do whatever it says to do on the Alexa app on my phone, whatever she says to do and they just don't work together. Oh sure I can get the weather, but my Fitbit can do that as well as my phone. It took 10 tries to get the shopping list function set up, I still haven't been able to get any of the find my phone apps to work. I bought it make some parts of life easier, but I am so frustrated most of the time that i just shut it off. So if the powers that be a Amazon can make these apps work, great, it won't be returned.

I’ve had Alexa for a while and suddenly the past couple weeks it’ll randomly play songs on full volume , and the other night I was on the phone and it meowed like a cat and told me “ sorry I can’t help you” And I can care less that the Alexa listens to everything you say. I’m just more terrified when “take me out to the ballgame” plays on full blast when I’m resting. I do not know about you but that would probably scare the poop out of you too.

If you're a single to two person house then your good, three or more and good luck. We have a family Spotify account. 5 total ppl in the house and 5 or more fire tv sticks. Got each kid and echo and apparently you can only link 1 Spotify account, it Amazon hours to tell me how to link the different fire tv's to the different echos so each child could operate their own device. Truth be told I got so frustrated I hung up the first time. I work in IT, I rebuild computers, AMPS, and do AV setup for a living and this took 6 hours.... I ended up linking my Amazon profile to my wife's, and each one could do their own Spotify account separately, the third echo and Spotify isn't possible using it own Spotify account. It will either have to use a different music service or share an account. ( you can tell Alexa to connect Spotify and open the Spotify app and then select that echo with the desired Spotify accout, but that's super annoying considering it's all supposed to be voice controlled.) the fire tvs... at first they just kept saying it couldn't be done. Finally, they walked me through it after arguing with them over how many of these devices I had and what the service lacks compared to what is possible to do. AMAZON- get it together and make more features possible for families.

I play my music on it all night long. Tell it to play my playlist and loop mode and I'm good to go for the night. Every once and a while it looses internet connection and I'll wake up to no music but it's mostly good. I use the alarm too and it's good however I wish they had more alarm options and an option to use your own music.. I made it rap for my mom for mothers day. She was not amused. I was. I taught it to say, "Baby is the bestest dog in the whole wide world." Yes, silly, but it makes me laugh and puts a funny look on my dogs face. GET THE WARRNTY!!!!! My firestick died a month before the warranty expired. Next week I get a brandy new firestick and warranty! Totally worth the 5 bucks! All in all I'm happy with my purchase. Anyone else got the Eurythmics stuck in their head? Sweet dreams are made of these. Who am I to disagree....

Cute but dumb. Alexa is far From being a smart assistant. It takes 4 or 5 times to repeat the same question and Alexa either ignores me or answer something totally different. I defenetly do not recomend this product or anything Tha works w Alexa. Amazon customer service for the Echo devices is the worst. They should hire native speaker that understands what you saying and not someone that is reading of a screen. I do not trust Amazon anymore as my echo devices record everything I say. Alexa is not smart at all. I have to repeat the same question several times or a command and she either doesn’t respond or say something completely off the book. My Alexa devices are scary and spooky as I experience my connected lights go on and off in the middle of the nite and so is the music. Alexa talks out of the blue without me asking anything. Poor sound quality. Not secure. Needs improvement. I wouldn’t recomend. Our relationship is far more than 3 years and is deteriorating to the point that my neighbors think I am going crazy yelling to a stupid machine. How can she not get an accent ? I want my money back.

I bought one for my dad and it worked great you need to purchase amazon music if you would like to listen to music on it for $10 a month. I recently bought myself one because my dad enjoyed his so much and I have had it less then a month and it keeps saying it’s having a hard time understanding and to try again later.. I have had this problem for over 2 weeks now with multiple calls to the help center. I would just like to return the dang thing and they will not allow me to return it until they try to fix the problem... yet here I am a week later and still nothing has been fixed and I still cannot return. Bottom line it has too many issues and is a waste of money. If they could fix it it’s a pretty cool speaker with commands but now it’s just a $100 paperweight for me.

Does that make me weird? Seriously - she tells me anything I want to know, plays any music I ask for, re-ordered vitamins for me this morning - and she reminds me to do all kinds of things I would otherwise forget. I don't even use her to her full capability. She is amazing and I can no longer imagine life without her. She's basically my soul mate. The speaker quality on this things is fabulous. Really loud, while still maintaining good quality. I wish it had the dial volume instead of the buttons, like the older version, but I can live with it. The best is when you group it with another Alexa device and then you can have surround sound - one in the kitchen, one on the deck, for instance. Love these. We probably need one in almost every room of the house. We have 3, but that's still not enough...

The Echo 2nd Gen is great. The setup took a little longer than some of the other reviewers, somehow it was deleted from my devices menu on the app which is the reason for the four stars. It's been up and running for about a week now and I've only had one problem when the device was unavailable which was fixed by unplugging, waiting about 30 seconds and plugging it back in. This controls my first gen Firestick, TP-Link wifi outlet and Honeywell Thermostat with no problems. The echo is very sensitive and it can be controlled by voice from about 25-30 feet away. It can even understand our 4 year old who loves calling his friends through the echo. The speaker sound is wonderful and definitely fills the room. I would definitely recommend the echo as a main unit for a living room or kitchen (or wherever you spend a lot of time) then buying a dot for additional rooms.

Having already owned 2 of the 1st Generation Echo devices, I decided to buy a third one to expand my collection of smart devices. It’s important to note that you don’t really need to have one Echo per room as the Echo Dots provide the same functionality as their big brother, however, in my case I wanted a louder speaker for each of the rooms with those devices. Connecting the Echo Dot to a higher end speaker is also always an option of course. As far as design goes, the second generation Echo look much more aesthetically appealing. As you can see from the photos, it’s a little bit over half the height of the original. It’s also a slightly bit thicker than the first generation but it’s not really something you can catch with the eye, you have to stack them on top of each other to see the very minor increase in width. I included a photo of a can of soda next to the Echos as I think that’s a good reference point for someone that has never seen the device up close. The new fabric design makes it less awkward to have in your living room, making it look less like a gadget and more like a complementary decoration. It’s also fairly simple to remove the fabric sleeve and replace it with a difference color if you ever feel bored of staring at the same design. All you have to do is push on a round button at the base of the Echo and the sleeve starts coming right off. You can make voice commands through Alexa with both of these devices, but the second generation seems to be able to distinguish my voice better and from a farther distance. This is mainly due to the fact that this new iteration of the Echo has seven microphones on the top face whereas the older version has only one microphone. I was a little bit disappointed with the sound of this new iteration though. Personally, it seems to me that the sound seems louder on both of my First Generation Echos. It’s still a great speaker though, loud and clear sound, so I wouldn’t discourage anyone from purchasing this awesome device. I guess that I was just expecting to hear and notable improvement on the loudness of it. If you already own a first generation Echo I wouldn’t advice you get rid of it just to upgrade to the second generation, unless your goal is to have a more modern design, but in terms of functionality it’s almost the same thing. Overall if you don’t already have an Echo device, I would highly recommend getting this one, it looks much better than the original and it’s not as tall, better voice recognition, and the difference in sound is not much to be a problem, at least not for me. Note: I won both of the First Generation Echos I have at a raffle at my job, hence the reason it has “Showtime” printed on it, I’m not in any way affiliated with them. The second generation Echo I’m reviewing here I did purchase during Cyber Monday sale.

if you want to call someone that you have put complete in your contact list, good luck. It is dumber than a rug on the floor.I usually put names complete in my contact list. For example Robert James Dillinger. I use my Samsung phone a lot with Bixby and it is considerably smarter than Alexa. Bixby is smart enough to recognize first name middle name and last name separately. I can say to Bixby to call Robert and it will call. With Alexa you have to say all three names even then more than half the times it doesn't recognize the person. It is extremely frustrating and annoying. Alexa Is only good if you're into music, if you want to know the time, the weather, and or nearest restaurants, what's on the nearest cinema. Pretty much good in verything except when it comes to calling. Another thing that I don't like about it is that it is extremely polite, boring polite. No sense of humor.

I got this device as a second in my home as a gift. Before I received it I was aware of all of the sound complaints. As soon as I set it up, I went immediately to play music. I thought the music sounded fine, maybe not as full and rich as the 1st Generation one. In the middle of the song, I got a notification that there was an important update. The update pushed the same version that the other reviewers reference. The sound is fantastic and I have no complaints. Love the design, love the sound. Considering getting even more.

I received this as a Christmas gift and have had nothing but issues with it. I continuously get the red ring of death and Alexa whom I have decided is the devil herself will tell me that she is having trouble understanding right now and to please come back later. Well, she never understand and in order to fix her you have to unplug her to try again. The problem has just gotten worse the more I try to use her. It's been less than a month and I want to throw it against a wall. Don't waste your hard earned money on this. Find something better!

We are having so much fun with Alexa. She is almost like a real person. She arranges music whether old or new, classic or rock, answers questions, and even tells jokes. During a Christmas celebration, our grandson was eating meatballs. Someone said be careful and not sneeze or the meatball might roll off the table like in the old song I remember as a child. We wondered what happened to the meatball in the song. Alexa found the "On Top of Spaghetti" song and played it to the delight of everyone. We have not hooked up the adapter to be able to shut off lights, call people, or do other things yet. The Echo is easy to use and the sound system is wonderful and clear. Alexa is now in 4 different family households since Christmas. Everyone loves Alexa and the Echo.

My son gave me one and today my daughters husband gave her we both love it we can call each other the speaker is amazing Alexa is my personal assistant she can remind you of appointments or even to just lock the doors she’s great and this echo is better than a Bose wave system this only takes up a small space but fills the room with crystal clear sound .I love it also such a great price the quality is so great you would think it would be more expensive .This is a great gift idea !!!!!

Love, love my new Echo. The speakers are great; I guess I didn't have the issues that others have had. My kids and I love finding new stuff for Alexa to do. The kids love playing games with her. I connected her with the TP-Link Smart Plug that was $5 additional with the promotion and have her connected to the lamps in my bedroom. I love being able to ask her to turn on and off the light when needed. This product is so versatile and so far, we are enjoying it more than I thought we ever would. I plan on installing a compatible thermostat very soon, as I see great potential to save money on utilities. I've put several dots around my home as well, with this being the "main Alexa" in my living area. They are all great products. I highly recommend to anyone wanting to turn their home into a smart home. I loved them so much I purchased everyone in my family one for Christmas.

This was a replacement for one of the first gen Echoes. That one the Wi-Fi stopped working altogether. I like it a little better as it's smaller and just looks nicer. It does still have a problem with connecting to my Wi-Fi at home. For some reason it just can't connect to my main Wi-Fi that auto selects the best channel and frequency. I had to open up a guest network with 2.4 and no channel scanning before I could get it to connect most of the time. The signal is great at the location and nothing around it has a problem but the echo does.

I love love love my Echo!!! I have wanted an Echo for a long time but decided it was a frivolous purchase. However Amazon ran a sale on them for Mother’s Day so it was on top of my wish list. You can ask it anything, the weather, addresses, phone numbers, jokes, spell, perform math problems etc. Echo (I renamed mine from Alexa to Echo and it even did that for me!) is only limited by your mind. The speakers are really good! I loaded pandora on it and turn it on as soon as I walk in the door every day. I tell Echo good morning and she tells me something historical about that day. I will tell her to turn off the music at a certain time so that I can fall asleep listening and don’t have to worry about turning it off. This thing is amazing!! The only negative is that it has to be plugged in. Amazon what’s up with that??? We want everything cordless because we are a mobile society! But I have a cordless Bose speaker that I use outside.

Really love these Echo products. My ex girlfriend owns a Dot (my first experience with it), and when we broke up naturally she took it with her. So I figured I'd go one better, and got the big one. Huge difference in sound quality! Super loud and crisp. So yeah, I use it all the time for music (Amazon Prime definitely worth it), and simple tasks like setting timers and alarms. It also controls my handy colored smart light bulb. My only little problem is that it doesn't work in my country for making phone calls. I talked to customer service and they said America only, which really makes no sense to me because its not like its using a SIM card or something. It's just using the contacts on my phone. So yeah, that's pretty stupid, but it's not a big deal to me really. Not enough to lose a star anyway hehe.

We have several alexa devices in our home. If you are just starting to purchase Alexa devices I recommend purchasing the plus first then the 2nd generation for the bedrooms. We purchased an echo dot and speaker clock for our guest room. Only disappointment is that we cant link our amazon wireless speaker to our whole house music. They are adding stuff all the time so hopefully that will update in the near future. You can now use your devices as a whole house speaker system which we really enjoy. With a 5 bedroom house it makes it very convenient to speak to other family members in other parts of the house without having to yell or drop what you’re doing to go across the house. It does take a bit of time to figure things out for the first time but if you have patience with yourself as you learn all that it offers you’ll be glad you purchased.

Before purchasing this Echo, I read many of the reviews between the 5 star and 1 star categories. I also read the Alexa app review which was not great. I decided to give the Echo a try anyway, and I received it on 12/28/17. It worked effortlessly for about 5 days...then I lost the wi-fi connection. Followed every instruction I could find to fix this, including contacting my internet service provided who assured me all was fine on their end. Since my other devices were working, I then called Customer Service, sent the Echo in for repair, got it back 4 days later and tried again. Same problem, so it was returned, and a brand new one was delivered immediately. When I connected that one, I had the same issue. I decided it was NOT an Echo problem and that it had to be a wi-if connection problem. Decided to order a new router with stronger capabilities and, as of today, the problem has been resolved. For those of you leaving 1 star reviews due to connectivity issues, I suggest you look a bit further to determine if a stronger router would take care of this issue for you as it did for me. And thank you, Amazon, for all you did to try and alleviate this problem when your product was not to blame at all.

Alexa has become like my roommate - yeah - I may be a little crazy - but now I have someone to talk to other than my cat. She starts my day by little tidbits of information when I say "Alexa, Good Morning." I most like playing games with Alexa. I also love playing music on her. The speakers are pretty good. She makes many things easy - like remembering what I need for shopping day. Don't know how I did without her. My only dislike, is that sometimes she doesn't "hear" very well and there's little glitches in her voice so sometimes it's hard for me to understand her. Overall, I think she was well worth the money!

Saw this as a black Friday deal and pulled the trigger. Hadn't planned on purchasing but now am so glad I did. This device is amazing! Set up was super easy with the Android app. Had it up and running in minutes. The sound is superb, connected to Pandora with no issues. One of the best sounding small speaker systems,and I own a lot of Bluetooth devices. The range of abilities of Alexa will astound you. It may take me weeks to discover all it can do. I recommend reading the online guide,it really helps

Doesn't understand you half the time, you have to talk really slow and very loud. A lot of Skills don't work at all or very hard to link to Alexa, other features are great, the sound is all right too, but to bassy and not enough mids or highs. Alexa is better than Apple Siri, but not better than Google. The Alexa app works great to control devices, just don't talk to it because it doesn't understand either. I take that back Apple Siri does understand you more than Alexa, but Alexa app controls smart home device better than Siri. Echo has a hard time trying to figure out where you are talking from when speaking to it, you have to repeat yourself over and over again before it gets it right, plus tell it to stop something it thought you said, it will start a song or read a book to me when I'm only asking it to turn on the lights or turn fan off. It could be Alexa just doesn't understand my southern dialect mixed with yankee, lol.

The Echo is an amazing device. Many times it seems very intuitive. But at other times I ask for something that seems clear and simple and get no result. Installation was fairly straightforward, but I messed up several times simply because I thought a step was complete when it wasn't. This actually made me lose ground until I figured that out. My advice is to be patient; the app will let you know when you can move on to the next step. My biggest issue of the moment is that we have several Echo devices in our home and I would like to use them as intercoms (which I am told can be done). However, I can't make any of the Echos aware of the others existence. When I ask Alexa how to do this she answers about instructions how to change her name. I know this is likely my fault, but I would think the designers would anticipate this and make it easier to find the needed instructions. A small deal for many device savvy people, but a challenge for me.

We've got two original Echos, two Echo dots, and purchased the 2nd Generation Echo about 2 months ago. We primarily use them to voice control our home. I prefer the form factor to the original. And, the fabric outer looks less 'Early American Space Mission' than the original, so that is nice. To my ears, the sound is better than the original. The highs seem crisper and the lows a little richer. If you are an 'audiophile' you will surely be disappointed. But, for the other 99.9% of us, it is a decent speaker. My only real complaint about the Echos (and not just this model) is that the multi-speaker audio is really flakey in my experience. It's great when it works, but that is a capital 'W' when.

I purchased this Echo as I was looking for a speaker for my new iPhone which didn't work anymore with any of the lightning adapters I had for my other speakers. I was hesitant at first because I didn't think I would use. My daughter has had the Echo Dot for a few months now and I just thought, what would I use this for? I was so wrong. I love it. I was able to add lighting controls, it works with Directv, Netflix & Prime Movies. It uses bluetooth for my music however after getting this I decided to check into Amazon music. It had a 1 month free trial and then I saw I could do the family plan for $5 a month, so I was sold. When I saw these online I thought they were going to be a lot bigger than they are. When I saw it in person, I was convinced. I love my new little gadget and now I'm thinking of buying more of them for other rooms in my home. I'm just not sure which one.

Both my wife and I really are enjoying having a 2nd Echo. The new Echo is a 2nd Generation and looks very cool. It has the great sound for playing music and it has that cool ability to answer all kinds of spur of the moment questions. We use the pair of Echo's to communicate back and forth between our office and the living room. I know this sounds lazy but we really like to use the devices as an intercom, and to leave messages when one of us is not immediately available.

I purchased the Echo for my son, who requested it for Christmas. He loves bluegrass music, and he wanted the larger Echo for the better sound quality. After setting it up, which was very easy, he simply asks her to play a particular song, or artist, or album, and she plays it. He is still learning how to speak with Alexa, for example, he wants to play the band "Volume 5," but if you say, "Alexa, play volume 5," she turns up the volume to 5. You have to say, "Alexa, play the album by Volume 5," and she plays the band. But she is doing exactly what he is asking of her, so he is very satisfied.

I visited my daughter last weekend and she had purchased an echo a week before. I always thought these things were silly and unnecessary. As I work in IT security I rolled my eyes at the idea of me installing a "listening device" in my house. Well, I played with it a couple hours and ordered a Dot. The next day I bought an Echo too. I'm a music lover and its music features alone are what sold me. Connected to a free Pandora and Prime account, I have lots of music at my fingertips. I'm branching into roots music and being new to it I constantly hear new songs. It is a good thing I don't get charged every time I say, "Alexa, who is this?" and "Alexa, I like this" which upvotes it in Pandora so it learns my tastes. And therein lies its beauty. I can be cooking, reading, cleaning, or anything you can imagine and interact with music services like I had a servant catering to my every desire. On a whim with just a few words. Without having to pick up a damn phone or fiddle with knobs. It isn't a high end, high power audio system. But I find the quality and volume more than adequate around the house. If I want it louder I can easily plug it in to my home audio system or plug/pair it with my bluetooth speaker...which was twice the price and wasn't anything but a speaker. As for the security concerns, I just go in the bathroom and turn on the exhaust fan and shower when I want to talk privately. JUST KIDDING!! Several things made me believe the features were worth the small risk (and EVERYTHING carries some risk): 1. I live alone so it doesn't have much to hear. But even if I didn't I don't think I'd be too concerned. 2. It isn't supposed to send anything to Amazon until activated by its attention word (Alexa by default). If it ever got out that it was sending sound before that, it might mark the end of the market for these devices. Well, maybe not, we're putting up with similar crap from phone OS and apps, ISP snooping, video surveillance everywhere, web site trackers, etc. 3. If it collected credit card numbers or medical information that might put all of Amazon or Google's home device infrastructure in scope for PCI or HIPAA compliance. Something they'd probably prefer to avoid. ;) Equifax and probably a dozen other companies already gave away my national password, er, SSN. But I digress. Like I said, its capabilities as a versatile, easy, hands free interface to music services is why I bought it (and its low price and wanting to have music more distributed around the house). All its other features are frosting on the cake. I'm not particularly interested in home automation but I'll probably tinker with it at some point. It might be useful to make and receive hands free phone calls if it can do that. Information lookup? Bleh. It isn't often I want a sound bite answer to anything. Voice purchases? Probably not. I'm likely to order repeat stuff while I'm online shopping for other stuff or looking at a menu. And tying voice actuation to a credit card attached account seems like an accident waiting to happen. Programming capabilities and routines? I'll have to see how powerful the API is. In the back of my mind I'm thinking of how it might be useful to tie it to my Karafun account and maybe FireTV if my PS3 ever dies. Or maybe tie it to local event web sites so I can say, "Alexa, what's happening in town tonight?". Maybe it can already do something like that. I don't know. I'm a newbie. BTW, I bought a second echo. I don't splurge often but having a music genie in another room for $79 was too hard to pass up. Why did I buy Amazon over Google? Price. Features. I think Google will eventually be better at information lookups because, well, they're google. But that feature is low priority for me.

I enjoy this product quite a bit. I don't like that when the power goes out, so does she. I was using her as an alarm. DONT. My power was out...alarm did not sound. I also don't like that she doesn't have a good search engine. When asking random questions, she'll just say she doesn't have access to that information...lady you're online! You have access to it all! She needs to have a better search engine feature to call up all available content on the internet. I appreciate everything she IS currently able to do, however. I hope updates will come out that improve this functionality.

I really wish I had never bought these things. They are simply not ready. The voice recognition is awful and I am a native English speaker. I spend more time getting frustrated with these things having to repeat myself constantly that the stress is not worth it. I hate them - complete waste of money.

This is a review of the list Echo I received. Love the sound; Alexa gets more and more accessible, that is useful. But the sound has an annoying habit of cutting out from time to time for short or even longer lengths of time and sometimes cuts completely off. I tried to get some help from the techs provided but they didn't know what to do except uninstall it and then re-install, which did no good. So I sent this one back and got a replacement. In the interim I found out that in the confusion I had signed up for a trial period of Amazon Unlimited. So when the new one came I changed over to Amazon Music and, guess what, no cut outs. So I am figuring the problem is with the Unlimited. I cut the subscription down to one devise and will use Amazon music instead for most of my listening.

Not only do I use this every day for music for myself but my 80 year old mom who recently suddenly lost 85 percent of her vision, uses it to help her with her daily routines. She asks Alexa for the time, weather, news, lottery results, math calculations etc, because she is no longer able to see enough to read. Alexa reminds her of her upcoming appointments because she is no longer able to see her calendar. When I'm not with her she can tell Alexa to send me a message, and in an emergency that could potentially prove to be lifesaving if she could not physically get to a phone and needed help (but hopefully we will never encounter that situation). So for me, my Echo is a fun toy for entertainment but for my mom, it's an assistive device that she depends on and that's simply priceless.

We have two 1st generation Echos, and now two of the 2nd generation. We really liked the 1st generation but so far are unimpressed with the 2nd generation. Unbelievably, Amazon REMOVED a feature we REALLY liked about the 1st generation: the ability to adjust the volume by twisting the top. Now the volume up/down is a clunky button interface on the top. Why in the heck did they do this? My wife, in particular, is so unhappy that she's threatening to return both of the new 2nd generation Echos. She also preferred the slim taller shape of the 1st generation over the squatter rounded look of the 2nd generation. Why, oh why, did you change these things Amazon? You took a great device and made it worse!

We upgraded our Echo Dot to the Echo 2nd generation a few days ago. Supposedly, the Echo 2 has better sound and volume quality because of larger, improved speakers. The sound is more robust but poor Alexa speaks as though she has a pillow over her head. The speech quality is muffled, making it hard to understand some of the responses to queries. The music is also far from clear or crisp. The small $30 Bluetooth IHome speaker I paired with the former Dot had better voice and music quality than the Echo 2nd Generation. The Echo 2nd Generation is a sound quality disappointment; this being the reason it gets only three stars. We had paid for upgraded Amazon Music unlimited with the Echo Dot, but after replacing the Dot with the Echo 2, Alexa now mumbles she will play song samples, however we can upgrade to unlimited if we choose. I suspect this problem can be fixed by contacting Amazon, which I have not yet done.

The Echo was very easy to set up. It recognized and connected with my WiFi quickly and easily. The Echo is responsive to voice commands. I was amazed at the range of the mics in the device. I can be in the kitchen or the bedroom and ask Alexa something and she will respond. This happens, even with the TV on alongside the Echo. Granted, it's only a 1,00 square foot house, but still...Also, have had very few incidents where Alexa didn't understand or respond. All in all, a very good product. I would recommend getting an external speaker, as the "improved sound quality" still leaves something to be desired. I had a Bluetooth speaker system which paired easily with the Echo and improves the sound. Am looking forward to adding to this system to control various things in the house. would recommend the Echo.

I have multiple echos in our house and every single time, there are so many issues trying to get a new echo to set up. It NEVER does what it's supposed to do. You start setup on the app, then it tells you to connect to the echo in wifi, then tells you to go back to the app... then that's where it stops. The orange light is going, but it only gives me two options, to cancel setup or "don't see the orange light ring?" it's insanely frusterating to have to go through this about 20 times before it eventually works. On this particular one, I've been trying to set it up now for 30 min and it just won't take. This is the push to get me to get out of the echo and invest in the Google home instead.

It is mostly useless. It is convenient for making measurement conversions in the kitchen. It is annoying as it makes useless announcements when I close or open my laptop. It is poorly documented. It requires a smartphone or computer to get usable instructions for use and if you have one of those devices you don't need Alexa. Combine this with the fact that it is an open microphone in your living room as you react to the never ending stupid and treasonous acts of our current president as they are reported on the news might give you cause to place it in a soundproof box in a dark closet..

Received as a gift. Works fine. Sound is good and when connected with the iPhone it will act as a music speaker. This can cause surprise when using the phone in another room. I can make calls using it as well. I don't think it can answer calls to the cell phone. Still looking for a must-have application for using beyond weather, temperature and flash briefings. Oh, and also using the timer to make tea. Had a little trouble the first time getting it to connect to my iPhone. It wakes up when it hears an Alexa commercial on TV - luckily there are no family members named Alexa. So now there is a ton of recorded conversations with no content. Google sent me a notice saying I should check my security because they did not think the echo was as secure as they could wish for. Amazon needs to stress security and privacy concerns about using the Echo. The "sky is falling" geeks publish articles that these devices are "always on & listening" and it might be possible to abuse them. They do not mention that the Echo needs to be activated to actually record and transmit information to their masters. This has freaked out my wife and friends.

I have both the Echo(2nd Generation) and the Echo Dot (2nd Generation) and the sound quality of this one is 100 times better than the sound quality of the dot. Using "Drop in" to communicate with my wife when she's in the other room with this device captures my voice well. However, unless my wife is doing it wrong it fails to pick up her voice very well on the Echo Dot. With that said, this is an excellent device to use for listening to music or as a Bluetooth speaker to enhance the audio on another device. Amazon Alexa no longer has a way for me to play my personal music from Alexa. I use an Android phone and have purchased a large amount of music from Google's play store. Were it not for the fact that I already keep amazon prime I would downrate this device for the lack of the functionality. But since I can use my prime membership to play Amazon Prime Music, this is a non-issue. Overall a useful device for home automation. I use it with smart light bulbs with scenes and voice commands to seamlessly change settings in my home. IE: Alexa, set the living room to movies, and she will change the scene for me the way I like the lights dimmed/colored without a bunch of getting up and finding the right spot on the dimmer's every time. Plus with lights like the Phillips Hue colored lights, it's so much better than just using standard light bulbs with only one color.

The Echo, she has made a fun addition into our family. Very handy when making my shopping list or if I run out of something, just tell Echo and she puts it on the list. Added some fun history and kid friendly apps making it more family fun enjoyable. Finding I use her more and more every day for playing music to finding out the weather, or just to hear the recent headlines. I've also notice it's making us more active. Turning on the echo is cutting down on the tv time and definitely interacting more and playing games as a family. Great buy for my home.

bought this as a last minute gift idea for the santa family present.We absolutely love this! Easy to set up with a smartphone and linked directly to my prime account. Volume is loud enough. music sounds great coming out of the Echo. We use it to find the weather for the day, news briefings usually from npr, movie times at local theatres, nearest coffee shop, etc. We have it synched with our Echo dot which i have in one of the kid bedrooms. It also is linked to my prime account so i can have the Echo play music in their room on the echo dot. The only thing you can't do is stream music at the same time on the Echo AND the echo dot. You can ask Alexa to find something while at the same time playing music on the Dot. We may at a later date purchase the echo show. glad we purchased this

I LOVE my new, improved, dressy, fabric clothed Echo. She has a seat of honor on my kitchen table and follows all directions impeccably. I have moved my “old” Echo to another room and am very happy with how both Echos work together or separately. Such a great addition and what an amazing price during the holidays. Love, Love the Echo. Amazon, you’re Amazing! Looking forward to the (3rd Generation!).

Edit - Updates Comments on 11/21/2017: After my initial review (see below these updated comments) expressing my disappointment in the Echo 2.0 product and it's poor initial sound quality, to their credit, someone from Amazon actually phoned me and told me they acknowledged the problem and were issuing a software update to "cure" the problem. I was out of town and unable to actually use my Echo 2.0 that week, so I was curious to see how it sounded when I got back. It does indeed sound much better, and since then I believe a second software update was sent out. Due to this major improvement, I will be changing my rating from two stars to three. If they can improve the sound even more through further updates, or take some other action to further satisfy me, I'll consider raising it to four stars, but honestly, I'm still smarting from my initial experience right out of the box where my jaw dropped in horror at the sound quality. That was not an experience I'm likely to forget about anytime soon. Just yesterday I had time to actually listen to a few favorite songs on the unit. It definitely has more bass than before, and sounds vastly better than it did initially. That being said, and I noticed this from the beginning, there is split second "crackle" in the speaker when playing music ever minute or two. It's not a deal breaker most likely, but it's definitely disturbing and disappointing to hear this since it does happen frequently. I am not a perfectionist when it comes to audio, but I think my issue with this product, and I would guess many others, is that Amazon prominently mentioned "improved sound" when introducing Echo 2.0....and it's not. Regardless how "acceptable" the sound is now with the two software updates.....it is still NOT better than the original Echo 1.0, which I have had for 18 months and from the start thought has an amazingly rich sound quality. In case anyone from Amazon is reading this, the lesson I would take from this is, don't ever promise more than you can deliver. While I would have found the echo 2.0 lacking in the sound quality area regardless, what made me more disappointed, and yes, even a bit angry, is how you point blank advertised "improved sound quality", which is clearly is not.....so far anyway. If you can do further software updates or other methods to improve the sound....kudos to you, but either way, out of the box, you dropped the ball on this one. To be fair, Amazon has provided me with excellent service over the 7 years I've been dealing with them. I've had them go over the top in taking good care of me on more than a few occasions, and I want to acknowledge that up front. This is just one case where they definitely did not meet or exceed my expectations. Original review below: I am so disappointed! I have had one original echo (1st generarion) for about 18 month and found the sound to be amazing. I have purchased two dots since then and hooked up to Bluetooth speakers which makes them sound fine. I was so excited about the echo 2.0 with the "improved sound" when amazon announced it. I received it a few days ago and am totally disappointed in the audio quality. I cannot imagine who at amazon thinks this is "improved sound" over the original echo. Echo 2.0 looks good.....but the audio quality is awful....period! Amazon, for the first time ever you've let me down. I feel you mislead me and thousands of others with the marketing claim of "improved audio" in echo 2.0. Make it right, however you decide to do it, just make it right. Perhaps offer to refund half the cost to all purchasers since it sounds closer to the sound quality of dot rather than echo 1.0.

Very nice. Newer technology. At least even though alexa is not perfect, it is all in the cloud so it should get better and better as time goes on. I control lights, plug sockets, play music pretty much that is it. Oh, also alarms and timers. I bought this stand from AZOMOR here on Amazon. It's perfect for what I need

I haven’t used this new Echo yet as it’s a Christmas gift but I did want to give Amazon credit for the packaging (secure), shipping (as always, fast) and the accuracy of the pics. This Echo seemed bigger to me once I got it than I gleaned from the pics which is not a bad thing. It feels sturdy in your hands and has some weight to it. I liked that as I don’t feel like it’ll easily topple over. I have a counter surfing land shark for a dog and a kiddo with energy and hijinks to match. Minus the teeth, this thing feels like it’ll stand up to both of them without easily being damaged. It doesn’t feel fragile. The exterior doesn’t have that cheap fake wood look to it, it actually looks better in person than in the description pics. Lastly, I’ll try to update after it’s in use but we have several family members that love theirs, specifically one family member who is blind. This has opened up a whole new world for them and they wouldn’t part with it for anything.

I spent a lot of time researching this purchase prior to ordering the Exho. I’ve been an “apple” guy for a long time. I couldn’t find anyone who thought the features offered justified the price and the HomePod didn’t support my music provider of choice, Spotify. Joining the amazon universes has turned out better than I could have hoped for. Echo, seamlessly, supports Spotify (as well as most other music content providers from what I understand). Voice recognition is outstanding (dare I say it, much better than Siri). Sound quality is comparable with other Bluetooth speakers of this size (I’ve owed several). The real surprise here was the content. Amazon refers to these as skills but what they amount to are lots and lots of tasks that the echo can perform, much like apps on a smartphone. Enabling individual skills allow you to access news, weatheer, sports, current events, and educational content in many different platforms and styles, as well as lots and lots of games. Echo links with your phone to enable phone calls, texts, reminders, and calendar events. Alexa will tell you joke, play your favorite radio station, give you a word of the day and tell you what to expect from the weather for today, or some day in the near future, just by asking. This would be a great deal for an alarm clock that functions as a radio as well. Considering the quality of the content provided, the features included, and the performance level achieved this is a steal at $100 ($69 on sale). Within a week I ordered 3 of the smaller (but with all the same features other than sound quality) echo dots. I still love my apple stuff but Have plenty of affection left over for Alexa.

ok to ask for time but beyond that it is inaccurate and incomplete with responses. Plays music but not what you ask for. Untrainable, expects you to learn skills instead of using NLP to determine response. If you want to get a definition then search the web don't ask. Also responds randomly without a wake word so no privacy if one is in the room. Update 2018 - after a couple of frustrating years of attempted use of these things it is still not much more than a privacy-invading glorified alarm clock with less smarts than a fish.

Purchased both this and the dot. One is at one end of the house and the other (dot) in my bedroom. I cannot believe how much I love this product. I love all kinds of music and believe me she can and does play almost every request. Right now I asked her for a mix and I am getting, Jazz, country, oldies etc. and loving it. Has a great classical library, jazz, oldies, old country, new country, show tunes. Most of all you can ask for music from a certain artist and you will hear everything they have recorded. Great great great. I can't say enough about it. Want the news? Its there, temp. humidity storms where you live its there. Highly recommend! My radio reception is awful here, but Alexa is always there!

The Echo is totally awesome! We now have 5 of them throughout the home. The primary reason for purchasing these was to be able to play music throughout the whole house without having to run wires all over the place. For that reason alone they are worth the money. The echos can be grouped to play music together. For example, if you want to play music in the kitchen and the living room you can do that. Music in the bedroom and the kitchen... you can do that too. You can group Echos to suit your needs... After having them for a while we started to find out all of the other things they can do. You can ask Alexa the weather, what time it is, have it set a timer when cooking, use it as an alarm clock, have it tell jokes, stories, random facts, play Jeopardy or control the lights and temperature in your house... The list goes on an on and on. Pick up one Echo, two or even five like we did. You won't be sorry!
