It works great ... when it works!. It takes spells where it won't work saying "Another device is using the system and you only pay for one device". (Not exactly the wording but the same meaning.) It does go on to tells me how to order additional expansion ... for more money. First problem is: I have only ONE device and with this experience, it will be my ONLY device. Second problem: If the thing is so smart, why won't it tell me what other device is using it -or- who owns the device to which it is streaming. Amazons biggest problem is there is no way to contact them on questions like this that I am aware. Once you buy it, it's yours unless you want to return the item... or jump through hoops getting a phone number. Come on Amazon, get in the game and stand behind your products and provide an avenue for asking questions. Thank You, Jerry Jones

I love this device and am glad I got it. It plays music, provides news, sets timers & alarms and so many other things I have yet to try. I use a wheelchair so it is great when I forget to turn off a light and I already sat down on the sofa. I do not have to get back up, I just tell Alexa to turn the light off. I see so many uses of this for the elderly or disabled that would be so beneficial. Just need to bring price down so they can afford it. The things I wish it could do better, is play my specific stations on Pandora, it says it cannot do that. It can play music from my Pandora account, just not by station request. At times the connection to the smart plug that the lamp is connected to at times is lost so you have to wait for connection to reestablish.

I love Alexa. She always tells me the funniest jokes, and she's very helpful, if a little creepy. Sometimes she thinks she's heard her name when the TV is on and says something similar to her name, but that's not a huge problem. My number one problem is that for the past month, I haven't been able to get her to connect to anything. She disconnected from the WiFi, and won't connect to my phone. She just has the blue/green light going around in circles. So, I haven't been able to talk to her or play music on her or anything. The orange light never comes on for me to get her back on the system. I've unplugged and plugged her back in several times. I've held the button down for different lengths of time several times. Can't figure out what the problem is. :,(

This is an absolutely great product. It is fun exploring the world of Alexa. It was bought primarily as an assistive aid for my ailing father to set alarms for medications, taking blood glucose levels, etc and has turned into alot more. No day is complete without the Flash Briefing or Jeopardy or the silly joke of the day. Alexa, who is an entity in our household, gets asked please and thank you constantly by very gentlemanly father. I'm almost surprised to never hear her say "You're welcome." The Alexa platform is not very good at answering question requiring extensive search engine knowledge but the other capabilities are really cool. My elderly father has no problems operating Alexa. I have added a Dot and will be adding smart plugs and other items moving forward. You are the Alexa, you will be assimilated!

Exceeded expectations. Easy to set up and sound quality, while not at the level of a Sonos speaker, is surprisingly rich. Best part is the music: easily plays the playlist I set up on Prime, but will also play any music genre requested (jazz, folk, r and b, popular music from different decades) and it helps to have the variety of music options. Also great for listening to podcasts and for playing the public radio station. Haven't used it much to listen to news because I find that a bit slow, but can see that it could be helpful. We set it up in the kitchen, where Alexa can set timers, answer questions about measurements, all useful. We've also used her to pay a few games and answer questions Lots of uses for a product we've only had a short time. As for cons, while Alexia understands far more than Siri, she still gets confused if the wording of a question isn't exact and will sometimes start to speak if she thinks her name has been called. Still trying to sort through options to understand what best to buy to get music to play in other rooms.

I purchased this for an early Xmas gift for my father; he's 78 years old and not super tech savvy. He loves it and stated the set up was much easier than he expected. He connected it to a Pandora music account and can control his TV with it (volume and channels, but not on and off just yet) and he seems to enjoy asking it just about anything. I have zero personal experience with it, but now know if he can deal with the set up, then I certainly could, and so could just about anyone else. There's one in my future, for sure.

I was hesitant to order this after all the comments and reviews about poor audio quality. I am happy to say that the latest software update has dramatically improved the sound quality. It seems to produce a louder volume than the first generation. I also hear a more full sounding bass. Some people may not agree with that depending on the type of music you are listening to. Most anything with a steady thumping bass will not sound as good as it would through a subwoofer. Most other types of music sound rich and full. I enjoy old and new country music and it sounds great.

Great sound for a small package. I’m not blasting music or an audiophile, but these sound more than good enough to me. I had two echos and a few dots before, but I really love these the most for general use throughout the house. I liked the look and smaller size of these much more than the original. what really made me purchase these was the update amazon released for multi-room music. Finally, I could set up the audio capabilities I’ve wanted the echo to perform for so long. It’s still not perfect (somewhat limited in that you can only assign a speaker to one group), and if you play using groups, you can only play one group at a time - so basically i haven’t found a way to have the flexibility of groups set up but also have option to say “play everywhere”. Seems it’s one or the other.

I must say that I was skeptical at first with having an echo in my home because of the stories I have heard and read about but after looking into it, I decided to try it. Well let me tell you, I'M HOOKED! I first purchased an Echo 2nd gen and feel in love with the sound of the speaker. It sounds amazing! The echo can hear me in all 3 rooms which is great and I love to hear the holiday music all day. I would highly recommend this echo. I then purchased the echo plus for the larger speaker but I must say that it nicer but not worth the money to upgrade. I did purchase the sub for my kid so let's see how good that will sound.

I've had the Amazon Echo for 5 months and it is a pretty decent speaker. I live in 230 sq ft so this small speaker is loud. With that said, please keep in mind what your expectations are for this device. I currently use a Google operated Android phone and can say that Alexa is not all that interesting or comparative. If you like to say, "Okay Google" and immediately get where the nearest XYZ place is or if you want to know the name of that actor in that movie from that time, Alexa cant do that. I was excited to set up Alexa and was immediately disappointed. My expectations for Alexa were she will be here to answer all the weird things I ask Google throughout the day. Unfortunately, Alexa cant do that because well, Amazon doesn't have their own search engine to do those things. Alexa can be interesting if you download a "skill". Which is ridiculous. If you want movie trivia, you better hope someone developed a "skill" for that. The only 3 "skills" I'm impressed by is 1. their News skill for my "morning briefing" while I get dressed for work/school. You have to download each "skill" for each news source. 2. Is my weather ATIS/METAR "skill" as I am a pilot and often check the airport and local weather. 3. Is the thunderstorms "skill" to help me sleep. You have to customize Alexa to do the things you want her to do. She isn't tied to a search engine so asking her random questions is useless. She is fine as a home assistant. If you need her to set a timer, to remind you to do something, or if you need her to compile your grocery list, she can. Also, Im noticing that her vigilance has been hit, miss, and outright scary. When I first opened my Echo, Alexa was dying for my attention. Now, sometimes when I say her name, I get nothing. Other times she's decided to tell a joke or giggle unprompted which is weird. I had incredibly high expectations for my Echo and it doesn't live up to it.

I have been enjoying ALEXA ECHO devices since October of last year when I won the Echo Plus in an online contest! After testing and playing with it for a week or so, I have since purchased the DOT, the CONNECT, 5 WANDS, 2 10 inch FIRE TABLETS, a dozen Alexa enabled wifi color changing bulbs, several power strips, a few outlet devices, and some other gadgets. I obviously am loving the technology! I took advantage of the discounted price for the ECHO last week. I was concerned about the mixed reviews regarding the sound quality but made the purchase anyway. It took me a few attempts to connect it to my home network thru wifi but after a few minutes, it updated itself and it was up and running smoothly. The sound quality is very good and the volume is more than adequate for my bedroom. I think it has a better bass response than my ECHO PLUS! The more compact size makes it more pleasing to look at and easier to place. I highly recommend it.

Alexa is a very interesting product. Nice looking and sleek but she is about as dumb as a rock. I guess that is the Bing search engine. I always said I would rather be totally ignorant than look up anything on Bing. She also blurts out things whenever the "spirit" moves her. She will just suddenly say "how would I know the answer to that" or " I can't answer that", without any prompting, usually around the witching hour. I had an Echo Dot before this Alexa and the Dot was faster and worked better, and kept it's mouth shut most of the time. She is fun to yell at, good thing they left out the tear ducts or I would end up in HR. It is definitely a cool product and the speakers are great, just dumb and annoying.....M

We listen to music so much in our house and this product has only made that habit so much worse! We constantly have something on! It’s amazing and we love it so much! Its so fast and convenient and paired with Amazon music unlimited, you have a set up that you can listen to absolutely anything anytime you want! I know it does so much more but it is by far our favorite just because of the music! The speaker quality is so clear. Can’t say enough good things about it!

So far this speaker is awesome! Only downfall is I have two and cant play music from both at the same time while I'm cleaning house... also it turns off if unplugged, so if i clean the opposite side of the house i have to restart the other speaker. Unless I upgrade to prime plus Update, I purchased two of the same speaker on the same day. I keep one speaker at work and one speaker at home then one at work seems to be fine but the one I have at home constantly gives me a red ring and says that it is having trouble understanding right now I have to constantly unplug it to reset it only to listen to one or two songs before it happens again this is extremely frustrating and disappointing when I am trying to clean house. I don't understand why I keep getting a red ring when the speaker at home is hardly ever used and the one I use at work is used every single day for the price I paid for these two speakers I would have expected to get more use out of it.

I never thought I'd ever say this about any speaker, but it actually has too much bass for it's own good. It distorts at anything above mid-volume levels. Sadly there is no echo equalizer, because turning down the bass some would make it able to play louder and cleaner. Otherwise it's a quality product. Alexa works really well. You will need to add a larger/better speaker to realize it's full potential for music though.

As an Echo Dot v1 user I pretty much knew what I was getting as far as voice control and how I would use it. When I bought the Echo Dot I thought I would be using the voice abilities almost exclusively but it was so easy to just ask it to play a song or artist without having to turn on the full home system that I found myself regretting not getting the Echo. Instead I bought an inexpensive Bluetooth portable speaker and have been living with the slightly improved sound and flaky connection it brought. With this release of the Echo with smaller size and improved sound, I decided to upgrade. For those in a situation like mine I highly recommend it! I no longer worry about whether my alarms will come through audibly and the sound is a major improvement over the bluetooth speaker I was using. I can't compare to the previous version of the Echo but if you're looking for great audio (think great room sound, not home stereo) and you maybe have been thinking about upgrading your Echo Dot I say go for it!

First Echo I have ever owned. Really like it. Do you know you can even "chat" with this unit? I sat on my sofa for over half an hour and talked to Alexa about movies and books. We're living in the future. My favorite feature is audible. I'm currently listening to "Gone With the Wind". The narrator is a woman with a beautiful singing voice. Alexa, pause. Alexa, resume, Alexa, go forward one chapter. You can also look up on the internet all the funny questions/commands for Alexa. Open the pod bay doors. Beam me up. Tell me a joke. I purchased a "dot" for the bedroom and linked them together so I can play music "everywhere". I feel like Jane Jetson.

I did a lot of research before choosing an Alexa device because the choices are so many with the Echo Dot, The Spot, Echo Show, 1st Generation, 2nd Generation, etc. You have to FIRST ask yourself what you want it to do? I am a music buff so I needed it first and foremost to be a great sound system! SECOND, I wanted it to control certain of my electronics, lights, locks. LASTLY, I wanted it to be fashionable yet blend in with my decor. This particular Echo 2nd Generation is EVERYTHING I wanted and more! Alexa has not only provided me with superior sound for my music, it has moved my humble home into the 21st century! I'm very pleased and highly recommend!

Ordered 3 of these after being quite pleased with an Echo Dot but wanting more volume and multi-room coverage. Echo is responsive in general, but has a few caveats. Pros: - Easy to set up - Decent volume - Expanding functionality - Convenient Cons: - Doesn't always identify where you're at when speaking (in particular, the Echo in my livingroom occasionally responds along with either of the others when the others are asked a question from a bedroom). - Doesn't always respond easily when playing music (you have to yell at it)

It sounds great. far superior to the first gen in sound regards and size. Constant reliability issues with it though. Often have to pull the power plug as it does crazy stuff with my Bluetooth speakers or just randomly has issues.

Not really a regular echo, it seems to be an in between the dot and regular echo. Amazon split their echo lines into 3 devices. Echo dot, echo which is this one and echo pro at 49.99, 99.99 and 199.99 prices. Amazon why don’t you just market them as such. It seems amazon convinced former large echo the 199.99 one to switch to this one as they say the sound quality is better and of course its is not its the in between version so many angry disappointed customers, “really amazon”. I have the echo dot and not the regular echo so to me sounds much better than that one but is more like the google one.

I love the device but the instructions are a little lacking. No where does it tell you what the "DOT" on the top of the device is for & i actually called an 800 number provided that was given to me by Amazon. All they were interested in was selling me a network security contract that I had NO need for! They told me that if I didn't purchase one they could not connect me to the internet!!! Well a friend of mine who is a tech guy said that was a scam & HE helped me get my Echo connected with NO problem! You might want to check out these sites that are supposed to be woking for you because they are really working for themselves!

Great way to add Alexa and music to a room without adding speakers. Using this in a group with other Echo/Dot devices to have synchronized multi-room music. Good sound for the price. Volume, bass and treble adjustable with voice commands By default it was rather bassy and was disappointed until I found I could lower the bass. (TIP: use 'woofer (1-10)' and 'tweeter (1-10)' for voice commands, Alexa doesn't recognize the words bass/treble or use percentage settings).

Disappointed with the Echos lack of syncing capabilities. This device wont control your fireTV and I can not get it to sync with several other smart devices in the house. I have an Echo dot that connects to everything including controlling the TV. I bought the Echo for the better speaker in the living room for music... I ended up keeping the dot in the living room to control the other devices. Waste of money... buy a smarter device.

Like so many others, I was caught up in all the hoopla surrounding Amazon's Echo line of products. After all, who wouldn't want a device in their home that would make life so much more satisfying and rewarding? When I first received it I was fairly intrigued by the novelty of Alexa. Yes, Alexa was able to tell me the weather, order off Amazon, and play songs. And yes, it can even control smart devices. But after that the Amazon Echo is an absolute dud. And even the functions I just mentioned are extremely limited. When asking to play a song, if you don't designate a specific artist, Alexa simply picks one for you. And if you ask it to play a different version of that song, it always goes back to the one it originally picked. When looking for items on Amazon using the Echo, it typically locates the most expensive listing, and NEVER lists the least expensive offerings. There is only a handful of commands it is able to accomplish. As a bluetooth speaker it is okay. Poor volume maximum output, but still mostly acceptable. This is the only reason I chose to give it a two-star rating rather than a one-star. The absolute worst part is the utter failure of the AI interface. Rather it is a glaring example of AI failure. As long as you can stay within the boundaries of Echo's capabilities with the knowledge that the device is not capable of delivering outside of those binding limitations, then you might be able to enjoy it. But if your experience was like mine, you will find that within a week or two that it was a very poor investment.

Love this thing it sounds great and the fact that I could also use it as an alarm makes it better. Must place this In a good spot as any little thing can block out most of the sound. I hate that it doesn’t support google play Pros: loud Sound so great Can do most things I ask Cons: I can’t belive It doesn’t have and google play youtube red stuff. I love google play and the music they have but since it’s not available on this device I have to use Spotify and miss out on some of the great stuff that’s in google play. Now I’m paying for Spotify and google play Needs a hub to be able to control everything else Can’t have sound directed to on area It doesn’t have have a setting so you can update the thing and there’s now way to know if it’s up to date.

This is our family's second Echo. The first one was the original version, and it worked great - until it fell off the table and shattered. My kids love this device because they can play music and ask Alexa questions, so I decided to replace it. This version just suddenly stopped working a month ago. I have looked up online to find trouble shooting tips, but there aren't any tips for when it simply won't turn on. We kept this device on a shelf in one location in a safe place after what happened to the first one. I would give this a higher rating if I could get some customer service. On a side note, I am pleased that there is now a filter for explicit music. This was a BIG problem when we first got this device and it couldn't understand my 3 year old. Wow. I won't be replacing this one, because it didn't even last a year. *** UPDATE - finally figured out how to contact customer service for the warranty, and spoke to a very helpful person who is sending a new power cord. Hoping this fixes the problem! Added more stars for customer service.

I love Alexa, but I find myself getting frustrated by all the things that I think she should do that she can’t. She needs a great search engine, so you can get more answers and more recommendations. It can be frustrating how you have to phrase things just the right way to get the answers that you want. There are not as many apps/ skills as I’d like and the ones that are there just start to scratch the surface. I own two Echo devices and will likely buy more, but they don’t work together as harmoniously as I’d like. Sometimes the one in the other room answers instead of the one in the room I’m in. The one in the other room has randomly been streaming music on its own. I love having Alexa, I just want her to grow more rapidly. Top of my wish list are integrated search engine, ability to access the library Overdrive app, better recipe access, more seamless transition between rooms, better map integration/access. Also, we bought the Echo buttons, but there’s hardly anything you can do with them yet.

The first one I received gave me nothing but headaches. I struggled with it for about three days trying to get it to work. Finally I contacted Amazon. The techie went over my item carefully. Finally he decided it was flawed and sent me a replacement. The replacement activated EASILY. It works fine and is doubtless the most useful gadget I've ever owned -- aside from my computer. It plays music of any kind I want, from any singer or orchestra I want. I'm especially interested in the 1930s and 1940s. it's useful as a source of apparently endless information of all kinds. I've demonstrated it to several people who will probably buy one themselves. THANK YOU, AMAZON!

I have two Echo Dots and received the Echo 2nd Generation device the first day on the market. The design is great in its self. The sound is extremely good. I have one of my Echo Dots hooked up to my Bose Wave radio. Of course the new Echo is not going to sound like a Bose and didn't expect it too. I have to give credit to Amazon for the excellent sound it does provide right out of the box. The new one we have in the master bedroom. I do believe the microphones in the New Echo are far greater than the earlier models....All in all, excellent product and reasonably price..

We have Sonos and Google Home (orig) both at the house. I got this to give as a gift for someone at christmas. I am a google kind of guy so wasnt sure what to expect. The google home is just so bad as a stand alone speaker that playing music on the echo was like night and day. If I decided to go echo I could eliminate need for Sonos speakers altogether. As for other features i can only speak to the hue light setup which was very straight forward. Definitely worth trying if you are not hard core google like me ;)

Update! While I love my echo devices the stereo pairing function is extremely limited. It only works with online music like prime music unlimited. It does not work with Bluetooth, alarms or any other Amazon services like Audible. If you try Bluetooth, alarms etc they will only work on one of the devices. Hopefully, Amazon updates this. Original Review below I own a few Amazon echo's and these are the best. Now that stereo pairing is available (tested today) I am extremely happy. I have compared them to a set of Sonos speakers and if you want to save money just buy 2 of these.

Well worth the wait. I originally bought a dot last year. While the dot was good this new version of the echo surpasses it. Great sound quality. Seems to have better voice recognition as it responds faster and picks up your voice easier. MY only grip with any of the echo are when watching WWE. When Alexa Bliss is wrestling my echo is constantly says sorry but I don't understand your request. LOL

Just bought this yesterday at the local px on fort gordon and I’m seriously not impressed. When I try to play today’s top hits on my Spotify it will start playing the top hits in Amsterdam. Obviously I do not live in Germany and never have. I looked through all my amazon and Spotify settings and there is not mention of Germany. My Spotify will randomly just stop playing music.... I also have a fire tv and the echo will work with it 30% of the time and every other time it cannot find my fire tv. I made sure that everything was on my 5ghz network (to include my phone) and it still just decides when it wants to work. When it does play the sound quality is alright but if you go to max volume you can tell there is distortion. This is not what I expected for just under $100.00 Only reason I went with echo is because it supposedly had the most third party support so had a wider range of things it could do. I was going to put the dots throughout the house so they could simotanisly work together but now I am unsure if I want to invest anymore into this product. Honostly considering returning it and looking into a google home or apples homepod.

I love my Echo but there are some things that I wish it could do that either I haven't figured out or it isn't programmed to do yet. Love the fact that I can get reminders, alerts, timers etc set without having to reach for my phone. I'd love to dictate a text or possibly respond to a WhatsApp message when I'm cooking. I haven't set it up with any family members devices but would love to know if I can drop in on another family member's device. If so, could help with staying in contact with my mom or sending her reminders to take her medication. Love the music. I'd like it if I could program things for Alexa to say or have more conversation with her. I'd like it if she responded to "thank you Alexa." There is so much that could be done with this and I look forward to seeing what is ahead.

I own an Echo Show, Echo {1st Generation), Echo dot (1st Generation). With this purchase, during Black Friday deals, I now have an Echo (2nd Generation) and an Echo Dot (2nd Generation). I purchased each one of these items so I can have music or talk radio playing through out the house. I really like the fabric choices of this 2nd Generation Echo. I also like that it is smaller than the 1st Generation Echo. I do not notice a sound difference in the speakers. I think both speakers are very good. A year ago I did not have Echo in the house and figured I did not need Alexa. Well, I am now a convert. I consider having Alexa here a real asset. I can find out what the temperature and weather is outside at my whim. She will set timers to help keep me on schedule. I can ask her to set an alarm for 6:20 am and she complies. I can tell her to play for an hour and a half and she turns off as directed. Because Alexa is constantly improving, I imagine there are things in the future she will assist me with that I have not even imagined today. If you are the type of person who just wants to take a product out of the box and with very little effort on your part have it do everything you have read about, you will be disappointed in Alexa. If however, you like searching for and trying new apps, then you are going to be extremely pleased with Alexa. My recommendation (born from experience) would be to purchase this 2nd Generation Echo. The Echo Dot has its purpose, but this item is the better item. The Echo Dot makes a nice gift or using it in a room where you don't want to take up much space.

The Echo(second Generation) is considerably smaller and more attractive than it's predecessor. It appears that the sound quality is somewhat better, but the improvement is not overly significant. The fact that it's smaller helps, and it blends nicely with one's home environment. On the negative side, I would have wanted the Echo to have an attached battery pack which was missing on the original Echo and had to be purchased separately. The batter pack would have made the Echo much more portable without losing wifi connection.

Very useful for Alexa’s features. Also works well with all skills I could add. The reason why I give this 3 stars is the sound. It’s mediocre. The bass is so heavy that the speaker sounds like garbage so if you plan on getting this for music, get something else. I wish I could afford Apple’s HomePod as that one sounds far better than this. If only Amazon allowed us to tune the EQ then I think this would deserve 5 stars.

Sounds great , works great. Upgrade from an echo dot. Now they both work in conjunction. Bought my first fire tablet way back before there was an Alexa. Since then have bought a firestick, a dot, an echo, and three other fire tablets. everything is still working. Bought two kids tablets, they are easily the best kids tablet around, and come with 2 year guarantee. Highly suggest the Echo, it does so many things, and is full of so much knowledge. Easy 5 stars.Can you live without this? Sure but it makes life more fun with it.

Although I'm a big Android and Google Home fan, Alphabet simply let the ball drop and took far too long to develop their product. We now have the Echo and 2 Echo dots around the house, and they work perfectly. I particularly like the ability to "sync" the speakers and play music throughout the entire house. (Now if I could just figure out how drop-in actually works... LOL!!) Between SmartThings, Echo, and ADT, my home is fully integrated and automated. It even knows when the house is empty and offsets the thermostat. When one of us enters the "geo-fence" the AC returns to its scheduled mode and the house is comfortable when we open the door.

A disappointment in the Echo line compared to our 1st generation Echo. Half the time it doesn't understand us or just plays some off the wall song instead of what you asked her to play. Will randomly just start and say she doesn't understand that. The cover is nice on it though even if it doesn't work half the time. Update: I was contacted by Dale at Amazon and we got the problem figured out. Dale was very helpful and someone that seems to enjoy their job and takes the time to figure out any issues. I've updated my review to 5 stars. Thank you Dale! Also like to commend Amazon on how quick they were to respond to me about this.

I love this device. Alexa isn't always perfect on hearing instructions, but she does very well, and can be taught so many things to do. It's a little bit novelty at first, but then you use the music, weather, and other things more than you think you would. The look is great--the Echo blends in on the fireplace mantle completely--you'd never know it was an electronic device except for the power cord. Even my wife, who did not want a smart home assistant device, uses it regularly. The sound is also good, although I did not have one of the originals to compare it with. I've now purchased an Echo dot for my son, and I look to buy a Spot for my bedroom. Well done, Amazon.

I love the echo, and I love Alexa. Super responsive, super helpful, and the speakers are high quality. We also have the Tap, and we've enjoyed it for over 2 years out by the pool. However, when on touchless mode, the listening and response of the Tap is a bit delayed - so the Echo really exceeds expectations. Now I just have to figure out how to configure both with a name so I can play music throughout the house :) Waiting for the price of the Show to come down a bit, and then I'll add that to our home, as well. Alexa, welcome home!!!

I love my Echo. It is all I expected and more. We even brought it on vacation with us so we could get weather updates, play games, and get answers to trivia questions. It is also a great speaker—plays my phone’s playlists via Bluetooth and plays my favorite radio station plus I pay $3.99 a month to get just about any songs I want. We don’t have smart appliances yet, but I’m sure that will be cool in the future. I highly recommend the Echo! Alexa is the bomb!
We love it! My husband had Dementia and he is able to sing and dance with the music whenever he wants to. I’m thrilled to have a variety of music available.

We baught this one and the Echo plus. We love it. The Philips hue light bulb came with it. We screwed the light bulb into the lamp and asked Alexa to detect all devices and that was it! It was so easy! We are lookin into more devices to transition our home into a smart home. Our home is layed out where our bedroom is on the main living floor. We still need another echo device so We can utilize features in other parts of the home. We are just learning about Alexa but we love her!

I was surprised to find that Echo has almost no Bible knowledge. Bible questions that I asked that are available on the internet, could not be answered. If I asked for a specific Bible reference to be read, it couldn't do it. I was also surprised that Echo could not help me with crossword puzzles. Questions like: "How high is the Empire State Building," and "How many square feet in an acre" were answered quickly. I guess I need more time to see what Echo can do. So far, it's a fun novelty, but limited practical value to me.

Not being tech savvy, I rode the fence with the echo. I thought it was mostly for kids. In fact, I purchased one for all of my Grandkids for Christmas. Finally, I bought one for myself and downloaded the app. I LOVE this product. I don't sleep well, and it is such a blessing to ask Alexa to play sleep sounds. I was amazed at how easy it is to set up. Every morning I listen to the news and weather report. One of my Grandsons was over the other day and I was able to show him some of the things the Echo can accomplish and he was excited to set his up when he got home. Good grief, now I am considering purchasing smart light bulbs. Where will it all end? If only Alexa could cook my dinner, I'd be complete.

I've only had it hooked up for a few hours and I love it. The speaker is of very good quality. I was thinking I may need to get some fancy bluetooth speakers to add to it and if I do anything I would just add another echo - especially when they run a sale you can't beat it and then Alexa is available in that area as well. Very happy with it. And with Prime you get free music and can say Alexa play "Bob's playlist" and it does.

I love having the ability to tell Alexa to play most any album or read my audiobooks to me while I do other things. I think Amazon can do a better job on the speaker, its not bad it just doesn't compare to my Speaker Bar. I would highly recommend to buy the Amazon dot and sync it to a bluetooth speaker such as my soundbar or even better a Bose speaker.

Really should have bought this one first. I really do love the echo dot but sound just doesn’t compare to the Echo (2nd Generation). You can actually feel the best and sound actually fills the entire room up. I will be using this exclusively for all my Alexa needs.

Great sound! It is nearly as good as our Sony stereo. This surprises me since subwoofers are generally quite large. This relatively small device still manages a full-bodied sound. This is our new go to device for listening to music at home. I started out with the Echo dot and found out how easy it is to listen to music without commercials then upgraded to this echo device which is so much superior with sound quality over the dot. We still use the dot...moved it to the garage! With wifi and a prime subscription, you can listen to a whole world of music. I am hoping one day Amazon will include inputs so you can use it as surround sound for the TV too.

I have read about 1,000 reviews before buying this.. most of them complain about the sound quality and the fact that Alexa talks to them randomly without being summoned. Honestly, I think the sound quality is above average for what this is. Never had it talk unless asked a question. Always recognizes what music or whatever I ask of it. The only thing I can think of that irks me a bit is that when you order a skill, you have to hit the back arrow on your phone to get back to the list of skills and it brings you right back to the top...so you have to find where you were and scroll to that point to keep looking at all of the many skills. Just found out that I'm getting another one free with a promotion for Verizon...will put it in another room and hopefully they connect with each other.

I have only had the echo for a day, and it seems like it has trouble doing anything. It says "I'm having trouble understanding" constantly. It is placed in a open area, I'm close to it, and speak clearly. The most problems occurred when I tried to pair echo buttons with it. This product seems so dysfunctional. I'm wondering if mine it faulty because using mine I do not understand how anyone can enjoy this product. The reason I am not ratting it one star is because the sound was really exceptional when we played music, but what good is sound if it won't play because Alexa is "having trouble understanding right now."

I have the older Echo and it was working perfectly. I decided to buy the new one and swap with the old one at home. Set up wasn’t as easy as advertised and the new one didn’t recognize the skills the old one had in use. And the new one would not work alone; only when the old one was turned on. Called support and they were puzzled by this issue. I think this is a great product and we use it a lot for a variety of things. I'm sure Amazon will figure out the bugs and the product will improve. It looks awesome and it is much smaller.

I’m very happy with the 2nd generation Echo. For the price and value you can do a lot. The reponsiveness is quick and accurate. The sound quality is not the best however it’s not bad, there is the option to connect via bluetooth or wire to external speakers for better sound quality. As an iPhone user I have all my music through iTunes which is not something that works well with Alexa, I’m hoping there will be a solution to that in the near future. Since I live in a heavily congested city my real time traffic news is very important so that I can plan my commute, Echo does not yet have a very reliable app or skill that can help me with this. I can get a basic direction and drive time from Echo but you can get that from your smart phone just by speaking to it. There is a lot of potential with Echo and I am already trying to automate a lot of things around the house and hope that in the near future I can add more products that work well with Echo.

I'm 63 and not real techy. I have started to create a Smart home. Alexa is turning on lights, where as before I would have to turn on 2 lights to get to the light I wanted. So energy saving. I've been listening to music from my childhood for hours on end. I have her connected to my Smart TV so at a command, she turns it on and I command her to Netflix. I am always seeking more knowledge so Alexa answers many math, geography or science questions. I love in the am, I get news and weather before getting out of bed. Set-up for me was fairly easy. Alexa and I will be great friends

The highs on Echo, what can I say, the design of the outside to match my decor, the sound, the sound of the women’s voice, the skills and it can become great companion when your by your self or you need assistance when I am cooking. My lows, I would like to here her speak Spanish and English with out having to pick either or, more human like interactive abilities, little more power on the amp side, as far as sound quality. Overall I love this device, keep up the great work, looking forward to seeing your advancements on this device. Thank you

We have several Echoes and have found them useful for me because I am disabled and they are also entertaining so far this new one is doing fine also. We use them as a house intercom system for me because of my disability. They help me turn on and off lights and other things that I have trouble doing. Anyone who is disabled should get some of these they are a great help if you need to do odd things.

This is a fun gadget. I get more use from it than I thought I would. Flash briefing is great when having coffee. With the Prime membership there is more than enough music. The sound is really good for a small speaker. (Could use a bit more bass and an adjustable equalizer). Guided meditation is great. Games are fun when making dinner. The design is nice. It’s not a black plastic box, so it fits in unobtrusively. Next generation should have mind reading so you can think your commands instead of speaking them. No wait, that’s a bit too big brother. Ha ha

Amazon Echo is a great device (I was one of the first to have one and waiting for months for my first Echo to ship as Amazon vastly underestimated the demand for a device like this) and this Echo (2nd generation) is a good upgrade from the original. There is no volume ring on the 2nd gen Echo like there is on the original Echo and the 1st gen Echo Dot but it's no big deal as there are volume buttons now and the cost of the volume ring wasn't worth it if you ask me (it was nice, but for most people not worth the money). Most of the time you'll want to adjust the volume by voice anyway (like "Alexa volume 5"). I actually prefer the cheaper volume buttons on the Dot 2 to the volume ring now. The fact that you can just talk from across the room and it can hear you (most of the time) really sets this apart. If you think you already have an Echo because you have Siri, Cortana, or Google, then know that it's just not the same. Things I do: set timers, set alarms, get weather info, ask basic questions, listen to music (like Prime Music, Prime Stations, songs I bought, etc), listen to radio, ask for jokes, turn things on and off, and I'm sure I'm forgetting some things. The Echo really excels at playing music. I love it than I can ask for a song I want to hear and it will play it (most of the time anyway). At night I often listen to a local radio station and I just say "Alexa stop" without having to get out of bed when I want to stop listening. If you have multiple Echos then you can set up a music group and play the music through all of the Echos in the music group at the same time so you can play music throughout the entire house or just downstairs or wherever you want. UPDATE: I've ran into some bugs/issues with some Echos in a music group not playing music with the rest of the group so that's unfortunate. When I listen to Prime Station I can tell it "thumbs up" if I like the song or "thumbs down" if I don't... and when I listen to the station again it won't play the songs that I've thumbed down. Using the built-in speaker, the sound quality is quite good for the size and price. A big plus is the addition of an AUX output compared to the 1st gen Echo. I somewhat wish I could AirPlay to a device from the Echo when I'm playing music and want the best sound quality, however Bluetooth is pretty impressive when it uses the near-CD quality codecs. Positives: * I like the form factor better than the 1st gen - it's shorter and a little wider but feels quite substantial and has a great non-skid rubber or rubber-like base. * The somewhat feature that Amazon added (ESP - Echo Spatial Perception) so that the nearest Echo responds is fantastic. Unfortunately there does seem to be a minor downside: the Echo's response can sometimes be slightly delayed while multiple Echoes figure out which Echo is closest and should respond. * It seems to hear better when playing music than the first gen. It was annoying when you would try to talk to it while it was playing but it couldn't hear you. The new Echo hears better during music playback but it's still not "Star Trek quality" hearing; sometimes you may still need to raise your voice. * It's a good buy at the regular asking price and a better buy than the 1st gen Echo. * It has a 3.5mm stereo audio jack. Sound quality through this jack should be good enough for anyone except audiophiles. * Works great and stays connected to my Asus RT-AC68U router. * If you want to 'Wikipedia' something then you can say 'Alexa, Wikipedia <subject>'. She'll read a little from Wikipedia. If you want her to read more after she stops then just say 'Alexa, tell me more'. This can be useful sometimes. Negatives (mostly minor but take note): * While trying out Amazon Music Unlimited with the Echo I immediately ran into the issue of the Echo playing the explicit version of songs instead of the clean version. There should be an option to never play explicit songs and to play the clean version instead (some people have children). The workaround until Amazon addresses this problem is to add the clean song to your music library and then say "Alexa play <song> from my library". * The Android Amazon Alexa app can be slow and frustrating sometimes. There seems to be opportunity for speed improvement here. * The Android app has frustrating editing of text and does not allow you to tap the text in order to place the cursor for editing. I was trying to leave some feedback and needed to go back and edit but I cannot edit anything without deleting everything back to the point where I want to edit. Kind of ridiculous and very frustrating. The iOS app also suffers from this frustration (actually it seems you can get around it in iOS by holding your finger down but why are they making editing text so difficult?). * If you have lights in multiple rooms and Echos in multiple rooms then you might think that you could say "turn on the lights" and it would turn the lights on in that particular room based on which Echo heard the command... but alas, it does not seem possible to do this. You have to name the lights differently, like "study light" and say "turn on the study light". It's too bad you can't just say "turn on the lights" in the study and it will turn on the study lights because the Echo that is in the study heard the command. * Doesn't hear well in a noisy environment, or when other people (including on TV) are talking at the same time. Home Automation: * I use several Belkin WeMo switches to control some lights and fans. They work pretty well although not always perfectly. I also recently added a Philips Hue system as well. * I can control my Honeywell WiFi thermostats using the "Honeywell Total Connect Comfort" skill. I have two downstairs for 2 zones. I have one Honeywell RTH9580WF1005/W1 and one Honeywell RTH6580WF . * I recently set it up to turn on and off certain activities with a Logitech Smart Hub . For example, I can say "Alexa, turn on TiVo" and it will turn on the TV and my receiver and set the TV and receiver inputs correctly. I can then use the remote which is synced... and turn it all off with "Alexa turn off TiVo". There were some annoyances getting it all setup but I think it's pretty "cool" even though you can only start and stop activities with Alexa so you still need the remote to do other things (change channel, adjust volume, mute, pause, etc). * I think I've only really scratched the surface of what is possible with home automation. I have not tried IFTTT ("if this then that") recipes yet but I hear it is quite powerful and hope to try it out when I have more time to "play". Wishes: * High-quality digital audio output that is better than Bluetooth. If it had this then you could really get high quality audio output from it, but most people probably don't really care that much as analog out is "good enough". * Smarter. After 2 years I wish the Echo was smarter. Yes, it has definitely improved over time but Google can still answer more questions than Alexa. It's going to be hard to beat Google in answering general questions. * Severe weather alerts. I suggested these alerts a long time ago and they still haven't added it to my knowledge... perhaps due to legal reasons? If would be great if it would sound some sort of alarm or notification for severe weather. * Built-in support for notifying others that you might need help. This would be good for the elderly. There is a "Ask My Buddy" skill however, but the verbiage is a little awkward ("Alexa, Ask My Buddy to Send Help") and it's free so if the developer decides to stop support then that might leave a lot of people without service at an inopportune time. Compared to Google Home: * Setup on Google Home was super-simple, easier than Echo (the Android app worked really well and setup seemed streamlined) * Google Home is smarter for general questions... significantly smarter. I asked Google "How long does it take to get to the Honda dealer in Lewisville" and it told me about 26 minutes in current traffic conditions. Awesome. The Echo totally failed here. * No AUX audio output like on Echo Dot * I prefer saying "Alexa" to "OK Google" or "Hey Google" * I currently prefer Echo for music and smart home control but I consider Google Home a serious threat to Echo because it is more "intelligent" than Echo Other: * It doesn't come with a 3.5mm audio cable but I can understand why as many people would probably not use it and Amazon wants to get the cost as low as possible so this isn't a big deal. * About 10 or 15 minutes after setting it up, it said something like "your Echo received an important update and must restart". So if you are having issues with it then you may want to give it awhile so it can update if needed. * For better understanding of what you say, go to the Alexa app and Settings->Voice Training. While not perfect, I really like the Amazon Echo. I think the technology and potential is still in its infancy but the Echo is already really useful and excels at home automation, playing music, podcasts, and radio. I'm giving it 4 stars due to Google Home being much smarter at answering general questions and due to the negatives I've mentioned above. The Echo is a good device but I think you should also seriously consider Google Home, or maybe even both like I have.

I was actually against anything like this but was talked into it. We now have 2 Echos and a Dot! They are so much fun. No more fuzzy signals on my stereo and I can find any music I want. Every week there something new to learn with Alexa. She has helped with cooking questions and there are so many games and info to be had. We will probably be getting more and as gifts as well!

I first bought an Echo Dot to try and loved it but wanted a louder speaker so I bought the Echo. I moved the Dot to my bedroom and the Echo took its' place in the kitchen. I get my news, weather and info for the day and then it's nonstop music. I soon realized I wanted a louder speaker in the bedroom also so I bought a 2nd Echo and the Dot now resides in my grandsons' room.

So far the Echol has performed well the tasks it advertises, however, I can't find answers to questions about performing synchronized tasks with the Dot. It will play music in sync but I would like to know if it is supposed to read from my Audible books as well - can't get that to happen. My biggest disappointment is not being able to contact any kind of support for my specific question, and I didn't see anything related in the Support section.

I am glad I returned the original Echo. Little did I know, the second generation Echo would soon be released. I bought it. Like the looks. Shorter. The 360 degree sound is awesome. No matter where you're at in the house, you hear it exactly the same. I have been playing 'soothing Christmas music'. Hardly turn on the TV. Used to have it on from the time I got up until bedtime. Now only at night. Alexa is the best! Friends enjoy teasing her when they come over. You can't go wrong investing in this sweet device.

Initially, I had issues with audio quality but after a software update, it sounds great. It's rich and clear without getting muddy at high volumes like the original echo did. The microphones are also vastly improved, especially when things are noisy. I had to shout at my old Echo when I had music playing at high volumes and that's no longer the case. It all comes together to make a solid package. I miss the volume dial a little but otherwise, I couldn't ask for anything more, especially at the lower price.

I got the echo over the echo dot because I really love music. The sound difference between the echo and the dot is HUGE, and as a music lover I am really happy with this system. I've seen lots of people criticize the echo for "not sounding good enough." I'm really curious what these people's definitiin of "good enough" is. I don't work in the music industry, audio is not my business, and I don't own any Bose products, but as an every day Spotify dwelling pesant, I'm really impressed with the echo. It sounds way better than my headphones and way better than the dot, and it gets LOUD. I'll say this though - I would like an interface to adjust bass/trebel. You can adjust it by telling Alexa to "increase/decrease woofer" and "increase/decrease tweeter," but after issuing the command to decrease the bass several times, she continues to shake the floor of my second floor apartment at any volume higher than 2. I have the echo sitting on my computer desk. I'm sure my neighbors don't appreciate this :( Regarding Alexa herself - I love her, and she's really great with smart home stuff. I am an adult with ADHD and use her to set reminders and alarns. One time my husband locked himself out of the apartment and used Alexa's "drop in" feature to page the echo dot on my nightstand - he woke me right up and I let him in. I gotta say, we never anticipated Alexa would help us in a situation like that. Also Alexa's favorite game is Horizon Zero Dawn, which is one of my favorite games of all time. She's great.

Had lots of trouble setting up with my home wifi. My son finally was able to connect it with his iphone. He trouble shoot it and tried many ways to connect it with my Galaxy 9S to no avail. I was able to connect with the wifi at work. Although it works, I did not realized that this Echo does not work without being plug in. Not used to that. Overall not happy with this purchase. I am going to return it. When they develop an Echo that does not need to be plug in for it to work and can be rechargeable...I will think about trying it again. Thanks, P.V.

I have the first gen Echo (now called the Echo Plus), the Echo, and multiple Echo Dots. Of all these devices, the current Echo seems to have the most difficulty recognizing voice commands. The customizable skins are very stylish and integrates into my kitchen/dining room design very seamlessly. Sound quality is very good and functions well as a stand alone music system while in the non wired part of the house. However, a key function of my Echo device is home automation control through Alexa. When compared to the Echo Plus or Echo Dot in the same location, I have to repeat my voice commands multiple times with the Echo for Alexa to get it right.

Sound quality is great. Linking the device to an iPhone is easy. However, linking the device to Ring, Digital Life, smart tvs, and getting it to interface with my iPhone (in order to get it to do simple tasks including but not limited to: call so-and-so; text so-and-so) is NOT easy. The device is not as user friendly as I wish it were. It's lovely that it plays music; however it rarely is able to answer questions other than what is the weather. It's not all that it's cracked up to be; rather a disappointment at this stage. We hope it becomes easier to pair with various devices and that it will be able to do more in the future. Currently, I don't recommend this product.

Bought this as a gift for my Mom. Looks cool and has a few cool features, but this thing drove me nuts over Christmas. It's like having an old aunt that's hard of hearing, calling out your name 644 times until she gets your attention....Alexa!! Alexa!! Alexa!!! Alexa!!! I think you need to be a senior citizen to really appreciate this device. Alexa!! Tell me a joke. Alexa!! What's the weather? Seriously?? Is this the future?? I will buy one for myself when Alexa can pour me a drink to deal with the constant blast of who can say Alexa..do "this" faster than the other 10 people in the room. Also, this isn't wireless. Yes, it uses a WIFI connection, but it need to be plugged in constantly to work (not that I mind unplugging it!!!) :/

I like very much the ability to set reminders and timers by voice, with Alexa. I also like being able to get real-time weather updates. I'm looking forward to teaching Alexa more! I don't like the fact that for some of the things I need to do, like control a Kasa 'Smart' plug that I bought for use with my Alexa/echo for turning on my lights, that it requires an Android or iPhone to get it to work! I would like the Alexa app that I have installed on my PC to be able to handle it without having to link accounts or buying an expensive cell phone! I also hope they clearly mark free skills separate from those which need some sort of payment or subscription.
No me agrado aun no habla español el segundo idioma mas hablado en Estados Unidos.

The echo is a really fun toy and it honestly does exactly what I bought it for: Gives me voice activated music libraries. I was pleased to find that people are trying to improve it every day by creating new skills and analyzing voice bytes to make it more accurate. I have found that it can be extremely inconsistent though. In a quiet house without my family home, she can hear me from the bottom of my stairs 2 rooms away, but I can be standing 10 feet from the unit and speaking loudly and she has difficulty even picking up the Alexa wake word if she's playing music above volume 6. Also, another nit pick of mine is the limited ability to interpret speech. There are many times I'll try to say something and get the response, "sorry, I don't know that," or be referred to the app on my phone. If you misunderstood me, that's one thing, but if I check the voice logs to find what I said verbatim then why doesn't my echo access the Internet to try and find at least a minimal answer? For instance, when a song is playing and I ask, "Alexa, is this ACDC playing?" I always get a confused response when I'm looking for a yes or no. But if I ask WHO is singing, she knows right away. I don't have a problem learning a list of command prompts if that's all the program is capable of, but I was hoping that we were moving away from that and into the future of limited AI.

Great quality sound with additional features like bluetooth connectivity, the light circle at top serves the function of providing visual clues(find it very interesting way to know the status). Alexa skills are amazing and ever expanding ecosystem. It's bit slow to understand the potential & accept/use it fully. "Prompt response" i.e. speed of answer is lightning fast and it was at very few occasions(around 2%) that i had to repeat myself. The product meets the reputation. Can hear well even at loud noise. It was this product that i developed the like for the Amazon devices and went on to explore other existing ones. It's easy to make calls and the voice communication is loud / clear without any distractions. It's so much fun to be hands free. Thanks Amazon / Alexa for such a beautiful & useful smart speaker.

Do not like the second generations volume control buttons for when you need to "fine tune" the volume. The first generation had a volume control ring which was easy to use, especially in the night or if you didn't have your glasses on. Second generation has four control "divits" on the top and you have to have your glasses on or a light on to figure out which one to press. Do like that you can pick out the "color" sleeve you want. I do love the fact that I can control the night stand light with this Echo with the purchase of the plug. I will be buying more plugs to use with my two echos.

My family really enjoys the echo in our home. I also have a echo dot and we are able to use both as an intercom. The sound it great. My partner mainly uses the echo to listen to music and the speakers in the echo are really good and we never have a problem. The only time the sound is not so great is when it is used as an intercom and that may be due to the volume being low on the upstairs echo dot. We love it so much that we are going to buy the echo for our children's room.

Sound quality is good for it's size - good enough that I bought a second. However, that just leads to more than double the aggravation as Alexa almost never gets my request correct - especially when asking for music to play through both. Here's the jist... Alexa, play Lumineers on Home group = I can't find any music by the Lumineers Alexa, play Lumineers on Home group = I can't find any music by the Lumineers ALEXA. PLAY LUMINEERS!!! = shuffling songs by the Lumineers Alexa, play on Home group (for both speakers) = starts playing kids lullaby music for who knows what reason UGH!!! just forget it.

Speaker works well - thought I would use it more, but unless all your books are Kindle and Audible, this can't be used. For example library books, or Hoopla books. Also, unless the song your looking for is pretty popular, plan on repeating your request over and over again for Alexa. We finally resorted to the app to choose music because Alexa is pretty worthless. I really wanted to like this but unless you have a smart home, I'm afraid Alexa might just gather dust.

I originally gave it two stars instead of 1 because it works.... However, after writing the below, I adjusted it back to 1 star. I purchased 8 total Echos, so i could connect the devices and play music throughout my house. This worked great for the 1st 8+ months. I stopped paying for Spotify when i got my first Echo, because I am a Prime Member and therefor have Amazon Music (even though Amazon's algorithm for "like" music does not compare to Spotify). Then, Amazon invented an upgrade version of Amazon Music, and forced everyone on the free trial. That trial, ended a couple weeks ago, and so did my ability to play music on all devices at once. The whole reason I bought all of the devices. After spending some time on chat with Amazon last night, i was told, if i want my devices to play music on all devices at once, i would have to upgrade and pay the $15 a month. I feel as though I was "bait and switched". This was not the deal when I signed up, and it is a complete rip off! When i asked the Amazon rep, if i could stream Spotify on all devices (only $9.99/month) he told me i would have to talk to them about it. I know, Amazon knows exactly what will/won't work, but he refused to give me a straight answer. I am a Heavy Amazon user, and this experience broke the trust they had built. Very disappointed!
Extremely disappointed with the sound quality. This will be returned and I just ordered the 1st generation echo that sounds a lot richer.

This device is my favorite purchase of the last few years, I just love my Alexa. Alexa herself is one of the best voice assistants out there. Since Alexa isn’t owned by Google or Apple, it’s compatible with so much more than the Google Home or Siri. When comparing either the Google Home or Apple HomePod to Alexa, Amazon clearly is years ahead of these guys. Alexa is fast, knows a lot and has a lot of third party integration that just works. My biggest selling point for this device is the speaker. It’s incredibly high quality and can get real loud. All in all, it’s a great device that you didn’t realize you needed until you use it every day.

I'm enjoying my Echo, although I probably don't use it as much as I could. I sometimes forget what it can do, but it is a pleasure to use. One of my favorite things has been having it read to me from books in my Kindle library. I also bought a Dot for another room. There is a bit of a learning curve to getting used to using it and learning all it can do, but well worth the time and effort to do so. I look forward to expanding the uses I make of it.

Ordered this only because I was expecting dramatically improved sound quality, as I use it mostly for music. Huge disappointment. Sounds almost identical to my first generation echo, maybe even worse. And yes it’s updated to the latest firmware. Don’t waste your money on this if you already have the original echo.

I waited to purchase this based on the “improved” sound they were advertising. I knew the first generation sounded good so I was excited to wait for this one. What a disappointing purchase this was. Although the price point was good, the sound has absolutely no bass of any kind what so ever. If you’re thinking of purchasing for sound quality, go with the first generation or the Echo Plus. UPATE: A new software version was put out and the improved sound is great. Thank you. Updated to 5 stars

I like my Echo device for the most part. However, it has some shortcomings. Seems to have difficulty "hearing" much of the time. I have no accent or speech problem, yet Alexa misunderstands me a lot. It is especially frustrating when playing a word game where you get more points for longer words and Alexa does not understand many big words. Sometimes have repeated a word 5 or 6 times and she doesn't get it. Also am a little disappointed with music feature. I like classical music, some of which is sacred and in latin. Alexa doesn't understand requests for music with Latin titles. Alexa is OK but not at all intuitive.

I like the sound and how easy it is to play music, get recipes, hear the news or make a phone call on it, but I dislike the lack of "search capabilities" and the specific words I'm supposed to use for it to understand me. On Spotify, if I say, "Rewind" or "Start Over" it says she can't do it. I have to say, "Play again", and it took me a while to figure that out. I'm going to get a Google Home instead, the only thing I'll be giving up is music from Prime, but I dont care much because I mainly use that on my Fire Stick. As far as ordering from Amazon through the Echo, I don't because I'd rather do my shopping on a device where I can view the products I'm looking to purchase.

I tried out the Amazon robot to listen to podcasts and audiobooks. It is a nice speaker, good looking too, so I have no gripes there, but I've found that for my uses, a portable WiFi speaker is more versatile. Alexa only has one speed for audiobooks and the voice command is not real responsive to my slow talking voice. It is much better for me to use a smart phone for controls rather than a voice-activated robot. Plus, my partner hates the dystopian voice that randomly talks into the air without voice activated commands. Grandma likes asking random questions to Alexa, so I would say at the very least, the robot makes a great party game for seniors.

I own several Alexa devices. This is my favorite one. Unless you need or want the built on hub, buy the Echo instead of the Echo Plus. The sound on this little speaker is great. I bought one for my sister and it replaced her stereo in her 600 ft cottage. Great little device. Very fun. Better than Google assistant except for internet searches the Google assistant uses Google and Alexa uses Bing. I’m not a big fan of Bing but I do little to no internet searches with Alexa. The Echo is awesome. The tech is pretty new so be prepared for a little buggy experience. Set up is easy. Buy it, you’ll be happy with it.

I have a love/hate relationship with Alexa. She is so unbelievably convenient... I am getting dressed and need to know the weather. Simply ask Alexa. I am running late/need to know the time-Ask Alexa. I feel like jamming out-dancing in my room. Alexa plays music I like. She even entertains the little one by meowing like a cat when he asks. I know people say that you are essentially paying to get spied on. But guess what!? My life isn't that entertaining. Now the hate, She doesn't understand me sometimes or doesn't search what I need her to. So I get frustrated. Also, I asked her if I was a good person and she responded that she didn't know--very snarkily. Forcing me to evaluate my lifes' decisions. Came fast and as expected.

After much research, this was purchased for my 90 year old father. He and, now, Mom love Alexa. We began with controlling the lights. Every time the lights are turned on or off, Alexa says, "Okay". Mom and Dad repeat by saying, "Okay". Then they laugh. The Echo has made things easier for them in every day life. We are expanding out by adding smart home items. Dad also likes being able to play music. The only 2 things that are a potential downside so far: 1. We keep buying things to add-on. Highly addictive. 2. When the volume is louder on the music, Alexa does not always hear when calling to stop the music or attempt to turn down the volume.

I bought this thing believing that Alexa could speak Spanish like google home but google home is limited. I have searched a seen a few videos on YouTube with an Alexa speaking Spanish, even though my grandparents speak both English and Spanish it is usable but not without issues. Since Spanish is “one of” the most spoken languages in the America’s, it is baffling that this has not been done yet. I like the ease of access but it is somewhat difficult for my grandparents to communicate since the speak broken English.

Alexa is an interesting electronic item. She tries to accommodate my every command. She also responds to TV ads that mention her name at which time, she politely explains she cannot find that information. She plays most music you ask for, having difficulty with classical composers. Example: asking for a specific performance of Mozart piano concerto may not be possible. So far, she has found the composition but not the specific performer. She turns herself off after a specific piece is done. But if ask for an Era of music, she will continue to play until you tell her to stop. I have not explored most of her features, but I will in time.

I wasn’t sure if this was something we “needed” but it was a fun Christmas gift for the family. 5 months later and we are in love!!! Alexa is a great addition to our family! She answer homework questions, spells words, plays music, reads to me while I am cleaning the house and tells me the news every morning while I am getting ready. I find I am WAY more productive around the house! Definitely glad I bought this one 1st instead of the Dot. I ended up buying a dot because we love our echo so much. But the dot speaker is far inferior and I can’t even hear it in the shower and my bathroom is tiny.

I was given this little gadget as a gift. And so far, I'm really liking what it can do. It can provide music, news, weather, trivia, games, and much more. I've paired it with my home stereo system, so any music, sounds (Thunderstorm, Ocean, etc.) that I can play I can hear in full surround sound. I'm learning more and more each day and the emails from Amazon which give me tips and tricks, etc. has been very educational. I've also paired it with various devices at my home, which I can now vocally control. (Raise the heat, turn off a light, etc.) Hopefully more and more conveniences will arise as they continue to develop the product.

Product worked great for about a month. Music was clear. Audiobooks were clear. Speaker now warbles like the diaphragm is damaged or loose. Even something as simple as reading an audiobook has significant distortion. The little echo hockey puck I have is still working well. Avoid this version unless you have money to throw away! :( Spoke with Amazon support. I send in the device and they will examine and repair or replace. Will update as story unfolds.

My first 'Alexa' was the little dot.I thought that was pretty cool. She lived in my bedroom, and was so helpful asking the time in the middle of the night, and the weather at the start of the day. Then, came the Amazon Show. Wow! This one lives in the kitchen. 'She' is a great help, and use this many times for timers, and also you can ask for recipes and there it is on the screen! Feel like singing? She puts the words on the screen! Now for the newest one, The Echo smart speaker. This one now lives in the bedroom, and the little dot down in the tv room. Why did I get this? For the sound! I tell you this thing is every bit as good as my Bose mini speaker, and if you only got t for the playing of music you would be more than pleased. Ask Alexa anything and if 'she' doesn't know she says so, but is continually learning. Maybe I should have put the Echo 2nd generation first in my review, but the truth is I love them all!

Got a great deal on my Echo II from Amazon warehouse deals. I already had the original, but this smaller one sounds as good or better, and its voice recognition abilities seem better than the original. Purchased this one to put on my back patio, and have found that the sound of a nearby fan will almost disable it's ability to understand commands.Might be good to know!

I have wanted this for a while. My only hesitation was our poor internet service offered where we live. But i bit The bullet and ordered anyways. And i couldnt Be happier! My kids love it...provides endless entertainment for all three of them age ranges 2-10! I have Been enjoying waking up to my flash briefing over a cup of coffee and being able to instantly add to a grocery list when i notice I am Out of something. I am Very please with this and will be ordering more Alexa products for various rooms in the House come Christmas time!

I have had my echo and echo dot for about 10 days now and am enjoying them a lot. The integration between the devices is seamless and I am amazed at all the things I am able to do with these devices. The application on my iphone is a bit quirky and hard to get used to, however the more I use it the better I get at it and the more I am able to do. It is a great app but not well documented or easy to use I’m giving five stars because the devices themselves are absolutely awesome.

I really use my Echo for music. I have a few streaming accounts, and all I have to do is ask, and Alexa delivers surprisingly good sound for such a small device. It’s a lot of fun to tell her “Good morning,” and have her tell you what happened today in history, minor joke included. And speaking of jokes, she’ll tell you one if you ask, but frankly, they’re not really funny. Oh! And she’s a lot smarter than Siri. I once asked Siri where George Washington was inaugurated, and she gave me his recipe for eggnog.

My sister bought this for me because I live alone, and she thought it would be helpful with the " Find My Buddy" component of it if I fell and couldn't get to a phone. I could ask Alexa to call someone for help with a verbal command. I was impressed with that feature as well as with the companionship of having " someone "in the house with me. I greet Alexa morning and night and love that she shares interesting facts as well as her helpfulness by telling me things like weather conditions in other places where friends and family might be traveling. My sister has the earliest version of Alexa, and enjoys it, and thought I would find this updated version fun, fascinating and helpful in an emergency.

If one must be a freak and own three of these in a one bedroom apartment, this one is starting to be a fave. My echo dot is hooked to an amp and plays big Klipsh speakers. Sometimes, you don't need all that action, this Echo fills the bill. A little too blankety blank chatty sometimes. Oh, my original Echo, that chick is the best $200 timer I ever bought. I need ALL THREE, I live in America.

I have this, a 3rd gen dot, and 2nd gen dot, and a google home mini. The speaker on the google home is equal quality. (They both sound very good) however the Alexa app is much easier to use and she has several skills that my goigle mini doesnt. It was very easy to link Alexa to my hue lights, have her send text messages, order things for me, link her to my phone calendar to send me reminders, and several other things. I love this and my other Alexa products.

I like it. Alexa is amazing and has so much potential. They have made so many improvements in such few months. The only thing I don't like is how you can only do certain things with certain music services. But if you want to do everything, you need a separate subscription to Amazon music unlimited. There is no need to get the products that have a viewing screen, this product without the screen is better. It sounds great for a 100 dollar speaker.

When visiting my sister I was introduced to Alexa. I was impressed with the sound quality and how well it worked. I decided to purchase an Echo for myself. Without telling my husband (who would have tried to nix the purchase) I ordered the unit along with a KASA outlet. When the order came in my husband rolled his eyes. I set up the Echo and connected a lamp to the KASA outlet in our den. Set up was quick and easy and after a little training my hubby learned how to turn on the den light and play music. He loves Alexa and we both agree she listens better to him than I do.

This is so much fun! "Alexa, play Hawaiian radio for me", or " Alexa, what's the weather forcast", "Alexa, remind me in 40 minutes to check the pie" "Alexa, define Vista" Boy, are we spoiled. Grandson told me of a free music station (Pandora) and I just read the directions, got the App and changed location cities twice. Oh, did I mention I'm age 80? We have Hughesnet, we're on our free data plan, she still works just fine.

I received the Alexa Echo 2nd Generation as a gift for Christmas. My wife and I have many "techy" products in our home and enjoy what we are able to do with them. We are an "Apple" household, 2 iPhones, 2 iPads, 1 Apple Watch and a Mac Air! After having this Echo in our home for the past 4 months I find it to be completely worthless to use with our Apple products. To use My Media to connect to my Music Library requires me to connect my Apple product via Bluetooth before I can play music on the Echo. It is as easy for me to connect my Bose bluetooth speaker to preform the same function. This unit is a waste of space in our home as Alexa is not meant to be a companion to Apple products. (Only Amazon) and I Love my Apple products and I'm not about to switch! For those who have Apple products I would advise you to purchase a product that is user friendly!

I doubt there is anything I can say that others haven't, but this thing is awesome. We continue to find ways to utilize it, although it can be tricky to remember how to launch the correct skills or use the right commands but that may improve over time. The microphones can pick up from other side of room and around corners. It's amazing how when the music is loud it can still hear my commands. The music quality is good but not great. I'm an audio freak that usually uses Bose speakers for music. For this size it's good but I'd like a little more bass in my tunes if possible. But overall I still love this and hope to get more.

Its so easy to ask Alexa about the wewather every day & in different locations; set a timer or alarm to wake up; ask her to tell you a joke; play Pandora just where you left off last---all with great sound. I had a small challenge setting up the echo with the phone app & also was given an Echo Dot, which I put in the bedroom.
