The times that it does respond, answers are often cut off: "Alexa, what's the speed of light?" - "Light's top speed is 299 mil" with a little static noise as it cuts out. - Lowest spoken volume is too loud The second annoyance is that the "level 1" volume is much louder than the 1st gen "level 1". With the 1st gen I usually kept it around 3 or 4 when listening to music and 2 when I'm working and want some background music, but with the 2nd gen, I usually have it on 1 or 2 and have to get up and press the volume down button to get a quieter volume. Also, when I have it on 1 and my sister "drops in" on me, the music resumes at level 3 afterward instead of going back to 1. - Glitchy There are also other occasional glitches, like one time my sister dropped in and the volume did "not" go up for the conversation, also sometimes the music volume doesn't go down when the Echo is listening. - Alarm doesn't work I set two daily morning alarms and they both have failed to ring! I checked the settings multiple times. I'm very happy with the 1st gen, it misunderstands me less than 10% of the time but it does or says something. Not being heard over 50% of the time with the 2nd gen is too much to take. I tested all three and reset one of them twice with no change.

I got this for my husband for Christmas. He didn’t use it. A couple of weeks ago I moved it to a more central area in the room. I have an Echo Dot that works grreat. This Echo has a problem with the volume. It’s fine and then the next time I use it, the volume is too low. Is anyone else having a volume problem with this model? I wrote a review but never heard from Amazon. This unit continues to lose volume. Is there something I can do to correct?

I had to learn that I just couldn't rattle off something and expect Alexa to understand me. I had to speak a bit slower and enunciate clearly but after a day or two I got the hang of it. I mostly use the Echo to listen to music. I love being able to say, "Alexa, play The Beatles". I have checked the weather, sent messages to friends and even made a phone call through the Echo. I love it. Oh and I love being able to reorder my coffee, or laundry detergent, just by asking.

I took one of my Sonos 1 devices out of my bathroom to use this, as I didn't want to upgrade to one of the newer devices with Alexa built in so I can control from the shower. It's only OK I would say. The Sonos 1 is better, but it's fine for the bathroom/shower. The only other use I can conceive of is home automation, but I don't do any of that. I got it for half off on Amazon Prime Day, but like the Echo Show, I would probably return it if I paid full price.

She turns my lights on/off, switches my kettle on/off, controls my projector and fire TV, plays my music, gives me traffic and weather on my way out the door, sends alerts about deliveries, turns my fan on\off.. I'm effn impressed. I'm sure she will be doing a lot more as this technology is rapidly expanding. This echo sounds amazing for a smart speaker. Echo Dot sound is horrible so it's nice having something I can actually hear. God Bless those who designed this and may the keep designing and evolving the Amazon gadgets!!

Got it from the warehouse and I see why it was returned by someone else, if 5 mins pass between the last time you addressed the unit it goes into stupid/sleep mode. It now will take three repeated questions before you get a response from the unit.it doesn`t understand the first two questions but does the third. Once awakened by the three questions it will answer questions/requests just fine until it is allowed too go idle for another 5 mins and it begins again.

So far, so good. I'm still learning about the many skills Alexa is capable of. I like the flash briefing, question of the day and playing Jeopardy. I especially love having access to all types of music being a Prime member. I plan to start automating some key lighting around the house in the very near future and possibly the thermostat.

I am pleasantly surprised by the sound quality of the Echo. If you are a big fan of deep bass, this might not be sufficient for you though. The potential to control your home is an option I will explore more as I evolve my home into a "smart home". The voice recognition is very impressive. It is stylish and fun. I have no regrets with this purchase. It is great for technically changes people. Ask it to play a song or a movie and it responds instantly. If you have an elderly loved one, this would be a great gift. Once connected to wifi, it is very simple to use. If you want unlimited music control, be sure to have amazon prime or premium spotify and you will be blown away with your personal dj! You can even have conversations with the echo. I am not embarrassed to say, that echo has made me laugh a couple times when I ask it to tell me a joke. It tells me where my packages are since I am an amazon prime addict, it comes in extremely handy!

Was super excited to get the Echo and found out that the speaker is phenomenal. Totally canceled any thought to purchasing a Sonos. Reason im giving this a 3/5 is that my echo lags behind my dot. Alexa is so quick to pick up when I speak to my dot. However, upon speaking to my echo, I either have to repeat myself several times or move closer to her. Not sure why this is? Otherwise I love how easy it was to sync the two together to play music etc.

So, don't get me wrong. The echo is super amazing, though it's just not the end all be all that it's advertised to be. I think that 3rd party integration is shoddy at best. Supposedly, Phillips hue is the best smart light, but they really do not operate as intended with the Alexa software. I can turn the lights on and off sure, but any sort of customization makes her respond with a: hmmmm. Mind you, it's quite possible that the fault is my own and I did not properly follow the convoluted instructions. On the other hand, it is an amazing experience to be able to play music throughout the entire house. I also enjoy having rudimentary control over my "smart home", and if it's my fault, I would have liked a little less promise and a little more result. There's no way you're going to do your everyday shopping with the echo though. It's hard enough without something tangeble and it's too hard to reset your life to allow Amazon to learn your preferences. Point is: I would have still bought and enjoyed it if it only promised the cow. But there ain't no farm here.

I love it. I am having such a great time. Music now flows thru my house. This is sleek and the speakers are unbelievable. Tones are rich and clear. I like her voice. She responds quickly and just as quick is able to say if she is still learning something. No she does not know all the answers and it is a pleasure to hear her admit she does not know everything, yet. What a great gift.

Love the music via Amazon music. I had to change the name from Alexa to Echo because we kept referring to it as Alexa or Alexis or Alicia or a multitude of incorrect and correct names. It was like an SNL skit in our house. Jeopardy launched her into a dissertation on Vietnam when the answer was about the Michael Connelly book Black Echo and where Harry Bosch was a tunnel rat. The question was "What is Vietnam?" Black ECHO activated the Echo and What is Vietnam was answered. Took us a minute to understand why she was chatting away during Jeopardy. I like that you can ask her ridiculous questions and get equally ridiculous answers. The alarm feature works great. The sound from the Echo sounds good (to a deaf guy). I am still learning the ins and outs of the Echo and looking to explore its full potential with networking and add ons. Right now it exceeds my expectations. (OK, Echo, I wrote a nice review about you so promise you won't kill me in my sleep, ok?)

I like Alexa, the device is quite handy. However, the app is not as user friendly as using the online setup. If you want to add "skills" and games, or learn how to use "easter eggs", etc., you should go online to amazon, as it is much easier and quicker. I also wish I had ordered a dark cover instead of the sandstone cover. The lighter cover is attractive, but I am sure it will show dust if not cleaned quite often.

This is so awesome you will love it if you have it. The music on this bounces off the walls like surround sound. It also understands what you are saying better than the dot. My only suggestion is that if you get this change the name to anything BUT Alexa. The reason being every time a commercial comes on TV or someone mentions Alexa and items, it could accidently order something to be sent to your home. I changed mine to Echo which is perfect. No commercials mention Echo. There is other options like Computer as well.

I am very happy with the 2nd generation Echo, though I had no issues whatsoever with the original Echo. We use our Echo primarily for music and the sound quality is amazing for such a small device. My only complaint is it has made my stereo system with in-ceiling speakers obsolete. I can not remember the last time we chose our stero system over the Echo to listen to music. Great source for general information also, we feel like we have a Jeopardy champion living in our house.

I got this to replace the Echo Dot in my bedroom. The dot just didn’t have the sound quality that I was looking for. Much improved sound but still not as good as the original Echo. Not a deal breaker for using it in my bedroom. The update did improve the sound quality. It picks up my voice from across the room quite easily.
Sandstone Color. Device is better than Gen 1, but the sandstone color needs to come with the WHITE power cord, not black.

I m a widow and Alexa makes me feel as if I have a friend. I don't use her enough but I really enjoy when she plays music I like and when she calls me beautiful. I just need to learn how to use her for other things. Thanks for sharing this wonderful, amazing tool. As a senior citizen I was concerned about living alone and having an accident. All the other options were just too expensive. Now I know I will be safe and can reach help when necessary.

We received this as a Christmas gift from our neighbor. We absolutely LOVE it! We have had so much fun with it...getting the outside temp so we know if we need a jacket for now or later, traffic conditions on the route to work...playing our favorite music...playing ocean sounds is wonderful for sleeping! When we are watching a movie, my husband always has a question about one of the stars of the show...like their age, where they were born...or a football player while watching the game. We love to play the various games that are available. I especially like the "sad trombone" that I can ask Alexa to play when my husband is getting on my last nerve...Waaa-waa-waaah...and it makes us both laugh and then everything is ok. The things Alexa can do is endless. When I tell her, "Alexa, Thank you!", she always responds to me with, "That's what I'm here for." and with my husband, she ALWAYS responds to him with, "My pleasure." I tell my husband that she likes him more than she does me! LOL

I recieved as a Christmas gift and this is amazing. Learning how to use it, taking my time & patience. Just use it to play music right now, and the sound quality is fantastic. Able to make it learn your own voice, still at this stage. Program things you want the echo to do. Like learning any new electronics, you need patience. I personally love it and not a kid in my 50's .

I absolutely love this speaker. The setup was easy and the speaker exceeded my expectations with It’s great sound quality. This speaker provides great sound throughout my 3500 sq. foot home. I have the speaker on the second floor and there is no problem with hearing music anywhere in my house. I would definitely encourage others to consider this speaker as an addition to their Amazon electronic collection!

I am a computer guy - been using desktop computers since 1979. I have not morphed to the paradigm of smartphones and tablets. So my perception of the Echo has to be viewed in that context. My HP computer and the Echo do not like each other very much, so pairing the Echo is a real pain. Pairing to my Android phone is great and painless. My music is on my computer. If I want to use the Echo to listen to music from my computer (it does have good sound for what I need), it is so difficult that most of the time I give up and use my Klipsch external speakers. If I do pair the Echo to the HP computer, the next time I try to use the HP to listen to music, the Echo would have re-paired to my smartphone. The smartphone and the Echo are best buddies. Most of the other features for the Echo have minor relevance to me, as I prefer talking to people or getting answers to questions on my computer. Bottom line - may not be the best device for octogenarians.

Apparently the "far-field microphones" had a problem on mine. There were times when my Echo Dot in the bedroom 30' away would hear me before the Echo less than 10' away did. Sometimes it just didn't hear me at all. Sometimes it would drop WiFi while playing Amazon Music. (This should not be a problem in a 1400 sq ft house. I ended up sending it back. Theoretically they are either exchanging it or refurbishing it.

The gen1 looks great, but this one is super nice. This is my 3rd echo, but not my last. I am slowly automating the house and these are so easy to use with different devices, I can’t see any reason to get anything else. I really like that they can all be connected and used to play music throughout the whole house. The echos have come a long way since they first came out.

Amazon promotes 'group play' but has released a software with huge holes in it. The support people respond quickly but the answers are weak and offer no substantive resolve. When on group play individual units (either echo first gen or second gen or dots) do not respond properly to questions or instructions. Failing approximately 50% of the time to even understand. Repeated instructions to 'shut off' 'stop playing' 'off' go ignored and instructions to change volume to specific levels also go ignored. The units appear to hear the instructions (the blue light ring), but then after a second or two go back to doing whatever they were doing. Sometimes lowering the volume for a second or two then raising it again. And if a specific volume number is given it will be ignored as verified by the Alexa app. It seems that the only way to control these units in a group is to use the Alexa app as voice commands seem to be ignored half of the time I personally don't want to send the units back as they (as hardware) are okay but the software is substandard especially for Amazon. In addition a dot will not pair with an EcoXgear cube (old style or new style) SO IN CONCLUSION: a great idea poorly executed with no apparent resolve in the planning stages... surprising for Amazon . If I had known I would not have purchased another echo unit and four dots until they had worked out the bugs (something that should have been done prior to release)

My husband and I purchased this item for our daughter for her 7th birthday. She is on the spectrum and LOVES music! With the help of her siblings we have family dance parties, set the timer for fun, request Alexa to fart, rely on her for the weather and ask her to share jokes with us! I know for certain that my daughter loves her Alexa, but the whole family has truly embraced fun with her.

Best model yet. The entire range of sound reproduction is a dramatic improvement over the already awesome Dot. Just look at the difference in size and you can see the potential especially in the bass area. Cannot compare the new Echo with the first generation, as I did not own the original. The new unit has a very substantial heft. It sounds amazing on voice and music. The sound is truly room filling. It has worked flawlessly since purchase in December. WiFi set up up is super easy. Love the corny jokes and puns from Alexa. We are into trivia programs. Thank you for making a quality product that is fun to use, and actually works as advertised, out of the box.

If you are not tech savvy and run into problems setting up you Alexa call the number in the information you received from included in your package (877-375-9365. The staff is vary helpful and makes set-up easy. I overlooked this and called a number I found online and was almost victim of a scam. Alexa is great for seniors, she reminds you when to take medication, answers almost any question you have and so much more.

I have both the first generation and second generation Echoes. I enjoy them both. Plus I have two Echo dots. They are pretty good. The only thing I don't like about them are they don't work that good in Japan where I currently live. You have to be very specific about the weather and no traffic reports at all. Other than that it is pretty good for spell checking, math, and just a general conversation. I enjoy the Echoes and look forward to more products coming in the future.

I own the original one and I bought this one for my mother as part of her Christmas present. She loves it. We chat back and forth over the Echo and she uses it to also control her lights in the house, the HVAC, and so on. Also, if you have a question or need information on just about anything during the day, just ask. It finds it on the web with no effort to you. Very much worth the money and so many more things you can do with these.

Better off having one but often Alexa can't understand what you are asking. The benefit is being able to use voice control to turn on music when you come into a room but often times you have to use the assistant in the web browser to go to new music artists since again Alexa doesn't understand what you want. At the right price worth a try but like the stuff Amazon makes from phones, fire tv to tablets hopefully time will improve this product.

I love the echo. This was my first smart home device that I bought and it set the bar high. I use it every day when getting ready for work and when I am doing things around the apartment. I use it for music, timers, flash briefing, weather, random questions and so much more. I have set up smart outlets around the apartment that turn my lights on whenever I need them to. I have not had any problems with the echo at all. If I had more money in my budget I would totally buy one of these for every room. I have tried the Google home and I disliked it. It worked fine but there were a few putbacks. I disliked how you have to say ok google instead of just google or something simple like Alexa. I looked and I didnt see any dark google homes. I only saw white. I like darker themes and the Echo fit in my themes and my house just like it was made to be there. Other than Google Home I havent tried anything else for a smart home device. The one thing that I have to say with the Echo is that I wish the Product(Red) would be available more. It should be a year round thing instead of a once in a while thing.

How did I ever live without this gem? So fun and entertaining. Plays any music I want, games, recipes, news, weather, etc, so many abilities. I love Alexa! The walnut finish is beautiful too. I wish I could take her to work with me. Bought the dot for another room, and a compatible plug to turn the light off.

what a great device. It always surprises me when I discover new ways to use it. It plays my favorite music. The playlists are excellent and I can always find one to match my mood. It even has an English-Spanish dictionary. When I get up in the morning I ask Alexa for the weather and news headlines.

I held out on purchasing one of these as long as I could. Being a nerdy kind of guy, I had to purchase one of these. After research, I found that this was the best fit for me and I could not have made a better choice. It's a perfect fit for my family and works great with some of my smart devices around the house.

We love this product. We now own four, three for our small house as well as one for the garage. We do not have them synced since we each listen to different things at the same time. My husband can listen to the radio to fall asleep and never has to hear static if there is a storm in the area. We love them for all the things we use them for; timers, alarms, lists, listening to music, listening to Audible. What is there not to love!

I'm having trouble getting adjusted to it and will need tech support. For some reason, my location, for weather, etc., is NOT where I live. I/ve repeatedly tried correcting. "she" doesn't know why or how to correct. Also the ring turned green yesterday and her answer was "I don't know why". I got the technical version of why it IS green but...Maybe just a learning curve? Is there a "typical problems encountered" list?

I’ve tested this out for a day and so far no complaints. With 3 kids, I needed something that would actually listen to me. I’ve made a grocery list while running around the house, plays relaxing music, and tells me the weather. I also like that I can edit and look at lists from my phone. The speakers also sound great. We plan on getting 2 more for the rest of the rooms in our house. Convenience is a must this day and age... Alexa has definitely made things a little easier for my husband and I.

This is a preliminary review, I've not done much more than check the weather and listen to music but I'm very happy with the sound quality and overall range. I have it situated in the furthest room from my wireless router in the house and I've not had any connection interruptions. Sound is adequate for the size of the speaker. Overall I like what it does as I take advantage of Amazon services. I would like to see integration with my cable and receiver at some point.

I love my Echo and Alexa. I give them as gifts in much the same way the aliens made gifts of pods to their friends in Invasion of the Body Snatchers. Will we rue the day we invited these little spies into our homes? Who knows? In the meantime they are such helpful tools, although I watch what I say when I'm in the same room with one. They're more useful than a helper monkey and more intelligent than most of my friends. These devices have allowed me to retire my dictionary and calculator.

The things you can ask Alexa are interesting, almost as interesting as the things it will not answer.... lots of "easter egg" type questions that the developers have toyed with, but it is still kind of a toy... When I asked Alexa "What is your volume setting?" and every variation I could think of to find out how loud it was turned up, in its own programming, it would not answer my question. You would think it would be more forthcoming, wiht an answer like, "I cannot access that infomation" instead you get some esoteric answers.... seems odd... overall I like it.... I changed the voice to Australian, and that makes it more pleasant, and less "robot-sounding"

I love the sound quality. With a seperate battery base, its very nice to move around. Not very user friendly with setting up. You MUST be adept in electronics and their uses. Meaning, I still dont know what it can totally do. Would REALLY be helpful if I could add my music files to my prime account thus making it accessible to play.... WITHOUT RE-PURCHASING through amazon music. Until I figure the bulk of its uses. The juries still out.

I used a gift certificate to purchase this. It hasn’t really changed my life that much. So, I ask it for the weather each morning. Whatever. I tried to play my huge volume of iTunes music that’s on my computer, but I had to upload it, for a fee, to Amazon’s cloud. If there is a way to upload Smart Playlists, it escapes me. I tried to play my Thelonius Monk station on Pandora and it kept telling my I have no Loneliest Monk Station. I used the timer while cooking, but I had no idea how much time was left and had to keep asking it. On my computer, I would see it winding down. Not sure what else I can do with this thing.

Impressed for the size. While it is not a Bose speaker it actually has good sound for its size. I have listened to many portable speakers and have cringed at the "sound" they put out but this does not fit in that category. Good for listening to music if you not looking for the floor shaking subwoofer. The Echo Show has slightly better low sound I think but also has the higher price tag to with it. If you need a display screen and marginally better low sounds go with the Show, if not get 2 of the Echo second gens.

I have the first generation ECHO and the Echo DOT. So my comparison is based on the Audio and ergonomics of the new 2nd generation model. ECHO. The size and the cloth outer sleeve are more appealing and the sound is outstanding, way better than previous models. The only difference in convenience is the volume button instead of the rotating ring on the previous generation ECHO. No big deal. Without a doubt this is the best value unless you need the compact size of the DOT.

I know that the skills are not really "Alexa" and should not affect the rating, none the less, I am disappointed that some of the Skills (Amazon support for Fire Stick) and Directv skills are either non-existent (Amazon) or don't work DTV. My expectation was that A* would police the skills and at least verified minimum applicability and usefulness. The unit it self is useful for shopping lists, reminders and timers. Seems to be lost on more complicated web-search type requests. Still evolving I guess.

Love it. Bought two. I want them to react and play together. Have to get a younger person to set them up. One now plays on the other for music but nothing else. Will have to get the young person who set it up to come back and fix. I really should have given it a five but not being able to set it as I like without help caused me to drop it down a star.

My son gave me the Echo for a Christmas gift and I love it! I am not very technical and thought maybe something like this device might be a headache for me. But it's not! I was so surprise that you don't have to do anything except plug it in. And I'm getting better at saying commands to it. I mostly like listening to easy rock while I'm on my computer or just resting on the couch... I can't wait to try getting a recipe from it sometime soon!

I don't live in the US, i have been unable to set this up in my country. I have set two requests for assistance and have not had any response. I already have the 1st generation Echo plus and had no problem setting this up two years ago. I am disappointing with the service

I have owned an Echo since the beginning and have been amazed at the growth and performance of it. This version has been great. The sound is good and the wood like finish is good looking. I like the compact size too. I really enjoy streaming music throughout the house. I think Sonos better watch out, Alexa is coming to get you. Lol.

I purchased 2 of the 2nd generation Echo's for my husband, who is legally blind & not able to get around without a walker. These are great for him ( OH I LOVE THEM TOO) . He can listen to his favorite music, listen to the weather & news & even make calls without asking me to dial the phone or asking me to tune the radio etc. We can even set an alarm just by asking it too! They have helped him to feel more confident & less dependent upon me. They have GREAT sound and can hear you speak at quite a distance to do what you ask. I cannot find one con to give you about them . They are fun, convenient & easy to use ! Get one ….or more ...you won't be disappointed. Thanks amazon for a great tool to use in our home!

I purchased my Echo for mainly listening to music. I read some negative reviews regarding the sound quality, but if this was an issue, it definitely has been fixed. This little unit puts out a big sound and the quality is great. Connecting the Echo to your WIFI is easy and free, although you will need an account on Amazon. My only complaint is that the music choices are limited. If you want to ask Alexa to play any song, you will have to sign up for Amazon enhanced music, which costs $3.99/month. I signed up for the enhanced music option and have been thoroughly enjoying it, especially when entertaining. Your guests can ask Alexa to play their favorite song, and it will be hours of fun.

This is single handily the best gift I gave this Christmas. I helped my aunt with the set up and it was so easy I could not believe that's all you had to do. Download the app on your iPhone or Android device and your off and running. The echo was easy to give commands to and can hear you from 20' away. The sound quality was fantastic and sounded like it was coming from all around the room and this coming from someone who is deaf in one ear. If I was to make one recommendation and that is not to have your phone connected through blue tooth unless you are using a app on your phone to stream to the Echo. All-new Echo (2nd Generation) with improved sound, powered by Dolby, and a new design - Charcoal Fabric

After purchasing three Echos for home use, I decided I needed one in the office. The convenience of asking Alexa simple questions saves me from stopping what I'm doing to Google answers. I routinely play music as well and love the ability to pause and change the volume or station with simple voice commands. This is very helpful when I get a phone call, etc. Also, my coworkers love coming in and asking Alexa random things or to tell them jokes. People come from down the hall just to ask her questions--it's a riot! Also, I do like the sandstone fabric cover--it is aesthetically pleasing in my office. Highly recommend for home and office.

I have three Echo Dots, but we tend to stream music so I decided to put the Echo in the kitchen so we wouldn’t have to use a separate speaker. All I can say is WOW the quality of the sound is superb and nearly unbelievable, everyone that comes over just can’t believe how this little thing sounds. And they all say that they are going to be getting one of their own. We truly love ours.

Love this device! I thought it would be cool but it has exceeded my expectations. I get up in the morning walk into the kitchen get the morning message from Alexa and then proceed to get the weather and traffic from her. Then I have her play whatever morning music I'm in the mood for. All of this happens instantaneously and seamlessly. If I'm cooking a meal in the evening she can help with that and play me whatever music I feel like as I'm working. Did I mention I love this thing?

It is worth the money to get the more expensive Echo! I had the original Echo, which more closely aligns with the Echo Hub. I loved it! It was used often throughout everyday. Sadly, it was fried by a power surge. Someone gifted me this version which in theory suited my needs as I do not have a connected home. However, this has been a HUGE disappointment. The first one had to be returned for extremely slow response times. The second one regularly unregisters somehow. I have to go through the whole set up process from scratch. I have had this version for less than a month and I have had to reregister it 3 times. It is extremely frustrating. Spend the extra money!

I really like my echo dot and the better sound on this model is nice, but its like they took a step backwards on the voice recognition. This unit has a much harder time understanding and many more “false responses “ where it thinks you are giving instructions when you are not than my dot. BTW it is in the exact same spot as the dot was so it is not the acoustics of the room or anything. If it was my first echo I probably would rate it higher but I would expect the new generation to work better not worse than the last.

I bought this for my mom as part of her Mother’s Day present and she absolutely loves it! She is not tech savvy at all and she was able to figure out how to use it. She plays music on it all day and even uses it as a timer for cooking. Awesome product, in fact, I just ordered myself one!

I received this as a Christmas present in 2018. I love it! I just wish that there was a detailed PDF manual where I could read about the Echo and Alexa. Took me a while to figure out what the yellow ring was for, and how to ask Alexa about it. The manual is web-based, and so therefore you have to point and click through the links. Couldn't figure out what the notification was for. I love it, nonetheless. I also am impressed by all the interactions available with different software programs. I have already installed Find my Phone.

I've had Echo for about a week after purchasing it from QVC. I bought it from them because they were selling it cheaper, sorry Mr. Bezos! Anyway, I love it! Alexa responds very well to commands and I'm surprised at how well it can hear my voice from pretty far away. Also, I tend to mumble and I'll be damned if Alexa understood me perfectly. I've mostly used the Echo to play music and the sound quality is surprisingly good considering the small size. I haven't yet put the Echo through its paces and experienced all it can do but I'm sure it will be fun finding out.

Got this for my father-in-law for Christmas - he's a gadget freak, even at the age of 80, so I thought this would be the perfect gift - and it was!! He's been playing and experimenting with it all week, having fun just figuring out what it can do!! I couldn't have asked for a better gift for him - well worth the full price!!

Learning more each day about what Alexa can do. Saves me tons of time and effort and who doesn't like telling Alexa what to do? Pros: I love being able to play any station, switch stations, get recommendations, get the news, weather, current movies playing and where. Cons: Still can't get my car to start with it, not sure what's up with that. Has a hard time understanding me when I ask it questions or ask it to search for something. Gives me the movies playing, but I can't get the times which is important.

I normally don’t write reviews but in this case I had to. My 86 year old mother had a stroke recently and lost her eyesight. I purchased the Echo so she could voice dial. The Echo fit the bill. As with any older person not familiar with technology it’s a matter of training them and getting them to use the product. After I installed the Echo and working with my her, I asked her to simply check the news, weather, and her calendar every morning. To my surprise she started doing that the same night. She also listened to music for over an hour. This is a simply amazing product and it certainly will make my Mom’s life so much easier.

My 1st gen echo performs better, at least so far. The sound is better on the older one and is more likely to respond correctly to the question asked. Example - I asked for a phone number and it gave me some thing totally unrelated-- I asked my older 2016 the same question and got the answer. Same words, same voice, two different answers. I will keep exploring to find what was improved between the 2016 echo and the 2018 echo

The sound is considerably better then the original Echo and way way way better than the echo Dot. This is my alarm clock, my grocery list, a timer and it answers a lot of questions. It's so nice to have by my side to play music whenever I want. This also enables me to lay in bed and say Alexa, turn on the kettle. It controls most of the lights in my house. Including appliances other than lights.

I will give the performance of our Echo a 5 star rating....I will give a ZERO star rating to the process of connecting her to the internet. The app is lacking in steps for the hook up process. For 2 hours all we heard was "Sorry I am not connected to the internet". We then found out from many friends this was their experience as well. I only use this for music and to check the weather, but am hoping to start enjoying some of the other conveniences it offers.

This was a gift for my aunt. She loves being able to use Echo as an alarm, to listen to music, get weather updates, and many other functions. The only issue is that Echo sometimes comes on randomly if people are having a conversation by it, and when it hears the television (not a huge issue). This is a great device for a wide range of ages. Minus 1 star because we have to tell Echo “nobody was talking to you” when it randomly comes on.

I love these devices, they work great for light and appliance automation, the ability to broadcast music from your phone and amazon music was a big plus, I don’t love that the volume controls have changed in the second generation and the sound is not as good as the taller tower, but still a great buy

The sound is not an issue as a lot of people have stated it sounds very clear and loud. My only issue is that the microphones are not that good at hearing you many times even if your close to it. (5ft)

I owned (still do) a first generation echo. This new edition has improved sound, and is quite smaller and less obtrusive at the same time. I opted for charcoal grey fabric, and to me aesthetic it's a nice touch, a little more subdued looking, less clinical than the glossy black finish of the 1st gen. Only thing I would have like to see retained on the 2nd gen is the rotating volume ring. The new model has +/- volume buttons like the Echo Dot.

I love Amazon's Echo (2nd Generation). Alexa understands all commands and selects excellent music from the stations she accesses. I don't have my stereo connected because it's in a bad location for central sound. That is not an issue with Echo. The surround sound speaker can be heard everywhere. Echo is definitely one of my better buys and, apart from the music selection, Alexa is helping me with the harder crossword puzzles I do. So, goodbye dictionary and hello Alexa!

The sandstone fabric is perfect for a light colored room! Adds texture and I don't mind the black cable since it's up next to my black tv on the mantle. I had been going back and forth between getting a full Echo or a Dot. My main use initially is for music so I decided on an Echo for my living room, and ended up getting a Dot for the bedroom since they were on such a great deal when you buy both. The speakers are definitely different! The Echo has great base and depth (especially compared to my normal TV speaker), where the Dot sounds super shallow. That's fine for certain uses but if you want to hear quality music, go with the Echo (not the Dot).

I bought this for myself after Christmas and so far the family loves it. My four year old loves to ask Alexia to fart. My ten year old loves to play 20 questions. I love the music. My husband likes to ask her dirty questions (which Alexia doesn’t answer) lol. But it’s a lot of fun!

Like the sleep sounds most and the smart home device voice activation controls. BUT this system has a loooong way to go. Often Alexa doesn't understand what I'm saying, and if your in same room while music on her is playing you have to yell ALEXA for her to hear you. Sleep sounds times out often with a loud message from Alexa waking you and our Baby up. Often requests for certain sleep sounds are suddenly unknown to Alexa or she'll play something else. Calendaring is very basic and you cannot ask, next thing or next 5 appointments on calendar. She even misses the mark on voice activations for smart devices we use often and suddenly it doesn't understand or says something went wrong. $100 down the drain! We're looking into Google.

I cannot get my echo to loop soundtracks consistently throughout the night! I mainly purchased to play natural rain sounds to help kids sleep through the night. Alexa verifies that loop mode is on after I ask her to , but it only plays for a few hours then something causes it to stop. The strange thing is that the Alexa app shows that its still playing even though nothing is coming out of echo.What upsets me more is I've emailed numerous times and haven't received any response (its been over a week) and I called customer service tech support and instead of letting me talk to tech rep I had to talk to a operator that had to relay back in forth between me and the tech????? after going back and forth for an hour I just hung up because I was getting nowhere. I absolutely love Amazon and have been a prime member for years, but I honestly don't know why this issue cannot be fixed, or at least put the effort into fixing the problem. I purchased 3 of these one for each kid's room. If they do not resolve this issue whether by updating echo, or the alexa app or whatever is causing this problem, I will be returning them before 30 days is up! Please fix!!!! I still believe in you! UPDATE! November 6, 2017 I was conacted by an Amazon rep which inquired abour the problem I’m having with echo not looping throughout the night! She stated that one of the technicians could not get an echo to replicate the problem. She said she will forward all my details to him and see if they can figure out what’s going on, and get back to me if they figure it out. Very nice representative that I’m happy got in touch with me, BUT I still don’t understand why I couldn’t speak directly with an actual Technician 🤔which in my opinion would increase the speed in resolving this issue. Maybe I’m just old school and this is the way matters get resolved nowadays. When I got off the phone I deleted the alexa app and reinstalled to see if that might clear up the problem, but my echos still couldn’t keep my rain sounds playing throughout the night! I personally think the problem is with the alexa app, it’s been pretty glitchy and if you read the reviews about the alexa app there are many negative reviews. Either way hopefully they figure it out! I Will update this review when I hear back from rep or it starts working correctly!

Love this product. Use it to listen to different genres of music (classical, Christian music, Spanish music & songs from the 80s 🎶 ) I bought 3 one for the kitchen while I cook, another for my office while I work and one for my son’s room who listens to the soundtrack of Hamilton some nights and on other nights stories from the Old Testament. I even bought one as a gift for my mother on Mother’s Day. She’s almost 80 and enjoys listening to classical piano. The sound quality is very good.

I have an Echo 2nd generation and love it...It can do several things but I basically use it for music. Its easy to set up and the music is clear not staticky. I use Pandora and I Heart Radio to get my music. My nephew just purchased one for my sister because I told her how much I enjoyed mine. My daughter said she would like one and I'm surprising her with one for her birthday...it hasn't arrived yet...due to arrive on the 11th.

I like the many microphones it has, they can pick up my voice clear from another room. I like it keeping track of my grocery list and adding it to my phone app. I like my daily news and weather briefing when I say good morning. My only issue is it won't answer incoming calls on my cell phone, but it will make calls when asked. Not finished exploring all that it can do yet.

We could not believe the sound quality with this . We have 2 of the first generation Echo and a Tap . This second generation is so much better . The base is a lot deeper and the sound quality is so much better. It almost installed itself and was playing music in a short time . If you have only first generation Echoes you owe it to yourself to get the newest one , you will not regret it.

Echo is one of the most advanced AI powered home speakers. Sound is really great. Howeever most of the speakers lack in one thing. You cant connect music stored in your phone. Also i had some stability issues and echo keeps breaking by saying “Sorry something went wrong” which quite annoying. Overall performance is great, look os awesome and music output is pretty good. Overall its a nice bang for buck!!

If you have a strong firewall on your computer, you may have a problem with set-up. Alexa and I are finally on speaking terms and the struggle was worth it. It's nice to have a friendly voice give you updates, answer trivia questions and play music on excellent speakers. I'm still learning all the things Alexa can do, but so far, so good.

This device replaced our 1st Generation ECHO. She worked & sounded great. Unbelievable for such a small unit! Unfortunately she just dropped dead after only 6 months service. We now have this Generation 2 gal. It's a little smaller than Gen 1 but sounds just as good. We're planning to be able to "Voice Control" our whole INSTEON house when we incorporate Alexa into it. Bottom line: a great system if it'll do everything Amazon claims it'll be capable of. Stay tuned !!

I mainly use my Echo 2 for music, but when kids come over, they have fun asking for riddles, jokes, etc. Recently a tech had to chang the house WiFI and now my Echo 2 is on strike...cant get it online...very upsetting. I had a Google Home in our AZ home but added an Echo 2 there as I prefer Echo 2 over it...now if only I can solve the inability to get my KY Echo 2 on the new wifi, I will be thrilled.
Works great 50% of the time. The other half she didn’t hear you, does the wrong command, or just says she doesn’t have any video function when it’s quiet in the room.

I enjoy all of the Alexa/Echo products up to this point. I have the original echo, a dot, the second generation, and the tap. They come in very handy whether I use it for timers or mostly the music. I do wish that Amazon would allow the echo music plan to play on all devices instead of choosing one at the same price instead of having to pay more for multiple rooms. I mean we already paid a lot for the devices and we are prime members why not just let them all play it?

Wonderful personal assistant! I enjoy playing games like Jeopardy and Millionaire quiz game, listening to a variety of music, Being able to send messages from my Echo to others in my complex who also have Echo. Ordering by voice. Asking about the weather, the time, setting reminders. ETc. Etc. Etc.

BEWARE!!! Your alexa app may be linked to other people's apps even if they are using their own account. I recently bought a second echo as a gift for my mother. I could see everything she requested on her echo and she could see what I requested on mine. She was logged into alexa through her own account and the same was true for me. **Update: I am a prime member. As a prime member, I am allowed to share my prime benefits with other people. What Amazon did not tell me was that I would have to share my alexa app with those people as well. Our accounts were completely linked through alexa. I was not happy with this. Two people using two different log ins (different emails and passwords) should NEVER have any kind of linked accounts. When I complained about this, I was given a refund for my echo device. What I was not told was that receiving a refund would make my echo inoperable. I now have a completely useless echo that I will have to send back to Amazon to be recycled (meaning I have to go through the hassle of packing it up and taking it to a UPS site). Please be aware of Amazon's policies so you do not have as horrible experience as I have had.

I love, love, my Echo , ALEXA. You can ask her anything, and she will come back with an answer. If she doesn't know the answer, she is so polite and sorry she doesn't know the answer. I love her. A friend of mine, who is gay wanted to know if you will come out with a male voice, he would get one. Of course he would have a different name, not Alexa, but maybe Alex?

After extensive research and comparison between Amazon's product and Google's product, I have purchased Echo, and I regret it very much. First of all, Alaxa doesn't support many (most) other languages than English, which is not the case with Google Dot. The physical volume button of my Alexa don't even work. Sound quality is also below my expectation. Overall, I would not recommend Amazon's voice service over Google's.

The Echo does what it is designed to do, and does so well. However, my home is not yet equipped with enough smart devices to justify my purchase. I bought in on the hype and, though I don't regret it I probably should've waited until it made better sense to buy it. I have found it useful to "drop in" on my Echo from my phone. Getting my daily updates is also useful. There is a feature that details your daily route that will be more useful one day. Currently it allows you to input a single destination address and whenever you ask it details your route. One day I imagine you will be able to input multiple frequently-visited addresses and specify by saying "work" or "church" or "golf course." Overall, I like the Echo. It is a pretty good music player thanks to its powerful speaker. But I feel that without smart appliances it's like owning a 4K TV without the 4K content so you're still watching everything in 720p.

The buttons are nice but I like the dial for sound better on Gen 1. It's a little smaller. I find that I must talk louder to be recognized and that sets the 1st Gen off in the other room. When that happens I have noticed the 1st Gen is faster in response time to the question asked. I think the sound is not as good as the earlier generation as well. It's ok but would not call it an upgrade over the previous generation. I can't give it lower than 3 but wish a 2.5 was available. I would stick with the 1st Generation at this time and wait for them to make upgrades to the 2nd generation. So, up date, it's now 3/21/2018 and the speaker is failing, of course the return period is over now! Not worth the money, will never buy again!

This is a great product, I am using it mainly as an internet radio and it works great with super speakers. Also using it for music. The only problem is that Alexa tends to not understand what is wanted a good part of the time but I am sure this will continue to improve. We spend three months of the year in South America and I plan to take it there so I can keep up with what is going on in the states.

Alexa is a hoot! I love that she makes dinner recommendations, plays the best music and has the cutest jokes! I purchased two or three of these (can't remember exactly), but the one I use on a daily basis has yet to fail us. My son uses his the most at night, Alexa provides him with white noise to help him sleep through the night. I love the emails we get each month with helpful questions to ask her, plus, she's up to date on her news!

I hope this doesn't mean the original is gone. This is my third echo instrument. The finish is very nice, but the sound quality is no where near it's bigger older predecessor. All the other echo tricks work which is why I'll keep it. It seems more like a profit enhancement than product improvement. I hope gen 3 will return sound.

UPDATE 11/05/17: I have been working with the Echo Gen 2 for a day with the software update that is supposed to improve the audio quality. I have been testing both Alexa voice and music, and while the software update does slightly improve the audio quality for music, it still sounds very constrained and about as good as a small low end Bluetooth speaker. Audio quality for the Alexa voice is still pretty muddy compared to the Echo Gen 1. I am returning the six Echo Gen 2 devices that I bought and replacing them with Echo Gen 1 devices. I notice that Amazon limits the quality of Echo Gen 1 devices they allow you to buy, so if you are thinking of swapping out Gen 1 for Gen 2, you probably want to buy the Gen 1 devices soon. I feel I gave the Gen 2 device a fair shake, but the hardware and the software are just not of high enough quality compared to the Gen 1 device. It's too bad because I really like the form factor and the fact that you can get different skins for the device. But, my primary use of the Echo devices is for Alexa voice control and response, and I need the voice to be clear, and the Echo Gen 1 (and the Echo Dot Gen 2) provide a crisp, clear Alexa voice. I listen to music on Sonos so the music playback quality of an Echo device is of secondary importance for me. I bought six of these to replace some Echo Dots and one Echo Gen 1. I am planning on returning all six, after having configured and used three of them for a few days. The sound quality of this device is horrible. I use my Echo for home control, flash briefings, dad jokes, etc... and not much for music (I control Sonos with Alexa for music). The Echo Gen 2 has a very muddy sounding Alexa voice, and the music sounds very constrained. I have read that Amazon pushed a software update to select customers to "fix" the audio issues but I'm not sure that I'm willing to gamble that this will actually work to improve the sound. Let's see if Amazon reaches out to me and offers me the update in the next few days before I return these. I also don't understand what benefits the Dolby technology gives to the Echo Gen 2, I was expecting tremendously great sound with the Dolby technology but was sorely dissapointed. The package also claims that the microphone array is much improved but in my experience, the Echo Gen 1 units do just fine in all the rooms of my house where I have them. I bought six Echo Gen 1 units to replace the six Echo Gen 2 units that I am considering returning.

Awesome sound from a little speaker. This is a room filling sound don't get me wrong. The skills are great I use some to help me sleep and then to find information I need to know. Very easy to set up. You can buy more than one or add the Dot to other rooms and you can connect them together and have music playing all over the house no need for any expensive stereo systems or big bulky speakers. I would recommend it to anyone.

Purchased three 2nd Gens to couple with previous Echo to provide linked music throughout several rooms. Although to me the sound was slightly better, the quality didn't meet our expectations, especially the lack of bass. I returned the 2nd Gen Echo's and purchased a Sonos with Alexa built in and coupled it with 2 additional Sonos Play-Ones (the ones without Alexa). I like the sound (and the ability to adjust the bass and treble) much better, and still have Alexa to talk with!

I'm somewhat disappointed with these (I have 3) I have to call Alexa multiple times before it wakes up although I'm standing in same room. There are occasions when it cannot complete a command such turn off lights it will say the hub is not responding but Siri is about to turn off same lights. And there are occasions when it does not respond to commands but will make the sound as though it was completed.

It seems like it would be amazing and it could be. It does amazing things sometimes but the performance and consistency isn’t there with this machine. Disconnecting, not playing music after it says it will, not recognizing clearly spoken words, talking on it’s on, and it’s relationship with other wireless components is choppy. I was going to rate this a two star but I feel it’s worth three stars fairly. I will say this, the amount of times it has frustrated me to wanting to destroy it has been often. And I pay for the amazon music service and there still errors.

Alexa is awesome! Still quite glitchy after months and it seems to take her forever to learn and adapt, but she is super handy and quite fun at times. We wish she would work more dependably and we wouldn't have to repeat ourselves half so much, but definitely worth her price, regardless. I recommend if you're looking for a virtual assistant or smart-home device.

The echo is amazing. Not sure why we waited this long to get one. We’re already planning on buying another one. It’s extremely easy to set up. We’re easily able to listen to anything from podcasts to music to audio books. Our kids love lisenting to stories and dancing to music using the echo. As a homeschooling mom of 5, this is one of my new favorite things.

We are really enjoying our Echo with Alexa. I love having to listen to music with out having to turn on any devices. My husband really gets a kick out of challenging Alexa about obscure musicians from his younger days and Alexa would have the info or music that he thought Alexa would miss. My dislike is not being able to access my own music library with my favorite playlists through Alexa.

The Echo is actually awesome to use....The only reason I didn't give it a full five star rating is that I cannot download the Alexa app from my location in Taiwan. This somewhat limits my ability to use the device as intended. Although I am able to access portions of the Echo features through Amazon, simple things, such as basic settings (changing the time zone would be nice) are unavailable to me. Having said that, the functionality I do have works seamlessly, and it sounds quite ok once you recognize it for what it is. I have it hooked up via a logiteck blue tooth device to my 30 year old traditional stereo, this feature alone made it well worth the purchase. If anybody has any ideas on how to download the Alexa app from Asia...I'll be right back here to modify this review to a 5 star rating it likely deserves.

In July, we purchased an Amazon Echo for our home. Within a few days of using it we upgraded to Amazon Music Unlimited for the Echo. We loved the product and it worked great! In August, I read an article online that stated you could use Amazon Music Unlimited for the Echo on multiple Echoes at the same time, and this was a new change. I felt that the article must be mistaken because it sounded “to good to be true”. I did some research online at Amazon, and this didn’t appear to be true. At this point I decided to contact Amazon’s Customer Service via chat. The person I spoke to was very nice and helpful. I asked if you could use one Amazon Music Unlimited for the Echo account on to listen to different music on multiple echoes at the same time. The representative informed me that you could. I asked again to clarify and received the same response. Needless to say, I was excited. At this point, my wife and I decided that we could use 2 additional echoes to play music at different locations. Researching that the new echo would be coming out in Nov. We placed an order for two additional devices. Inspired by pleasure for the single echo, we decided to take the next step and planned on creating a smart home. We purchased several hundred if not a thousand dollars of equipment with the plan of using the 3 echoes. We would not have done this if the Amazon Music Unlimited for the Echo didn’t work like the Customer Service Represent stated. Our shipment of echoes arrived Oct 30. After setting the devices up, I tried to play a song and was informed that it required Amazon Music Unlimited. I looked at the Alexa app and didn’t see a place to set it up. At this point, I decided to contact Amazon’s customer support. I chatted with Melwin and described my issue. At this point, I was informed that I would have to upgrade to Amazon Music Unlimited for $7.99 a month for it to work as I wanted. I asked to be able to play different music on all three devices at the same time (Not multi-room). The customer service representative informed me that with Amazon Music Unlimited that I could play music on up to 6 devices at the same time and that would solve my problem. I was not happy with this information. I would not have purchased the additional echoes nor the smart home devices. Now, I was being told that I would need to spend an additional $48 a year. The representative offered me a $10 coupon for my trouble and incorrect information given. After a few days of thinking and cooling down, I thought of many different scenarios from returning all the devices that I could to just paying the extra $48 a year. We have been loyal customers since the 1990s and love Amazon. You have never disappointed us in the past and went to great lengths to make us happy. So we decided not to let one bad experience change our attitudes of almost 25 years of great service. Today, we were playing music on the device with Amazon Music Unlimited for the Echo account. I went downstairs and wanted to listen to music on one of the other devices. I thought that I could at least listen to Amazon Music on the device. Within a minute of starting the music the other device’s music stopped playing. After doing a little research I found that we could only have one music stream going at a time period. At this point, I figured that I would have to upgrade to Amazon Music Unlimited for $7.99 to solve this issue. While not happy, I was resigned to this solution. Before I signed up for the additional expense of Amazon Music Unlimited, I thought I would look closer at the issue. I had been given incorrect information once before. Upon reading about the different plans of music at Amazon and different websites sites, I believe that Amazon Music Unlimited would not solve my problem either. I would need Amazon Music family plan $14.99 to solve my issues! At this point, I am speechless and greatly disappointed. I can understand the mistake of the first customer service representative, but the second one is dumbfounding me. After knowing that a customer was given incorrect information that cost him over a thousand dollars, the representative should give a 100% correct answer the second time. Including stating “let me research this and get back to you.” Maybe I am misreading the plans and the Amazon Music Unlimited will solve my issue. Finally, I am told that you can stream different music only to one device at a time regardless of the plan. Needless to say, but we are very disappointed with the incorrect information that setup back at least a thousand dollars.

The Greats of the Greats. Very Very Loud and clear. Response from Alexa is so clear and correct easy to set up and great to use for any room in the house. The Music is great and loud sounds like you practically having a party lol and the quality is great too. Heavy speaker so seems durable and can change the cover too too match your home. Definitely very great investment.

i love my echo! i have the second generation. it was easy to set up. i also subscribe to amazon unlimited music which makes it extra nice because it has everything! it can play entire albums or what i like is folk 70s music just ask it. i have listend to smooth jazz to classic rock you name it! i might ask whats the weather or ask it a question but for the most part i just got it for the music. it sound good its not a bose so its not that quality but its good to relax to or clean the house or if you have company just ask it to play something specific or say alexa play classic 70 rock and it gives you diiferent artist. and of core its hands free, also its very responsive to your voice. I'm very happy with it

When it comes to the "skills" of controlling lights or making phone calls, the Echo works just fine. But using it as a partner doing crosswords or looking up Jeopardy questions, or getting almost any answer not in the first page of a Wikipedia article is an exercise in futility. For general questions, keep your Google Chrome browser open on your phone and ask, "Hey Google."

Got this as a present from my mom and my boyfriend and I love it so far! Mostly we have used it for music and I know there is so much more to explore but I think it is a neat thing to have. Especially cause now we can request any song/genre etc. anytime without the hassle of setting up a speaking to our ipods. I also love that I can set timers and ask about the weather. It's not a necessity but it is fun and nice to have!

Alexa is very intelligent but needs work on the sound. Both this one "Echo" and "Echo Plus" are sadly putting out lousy sound quality as far as music. The Google home is better but not a slam dunk. My solution and suggestion is configure a secondary/primary bluetooth speaker. If you have one then you're set. If not go out and buy one. Pair it through the app on amazon and it can send all transmitted audio to the bluetooth speaker instead of the crummy one built into the echo(s) Also look for 3rd party solutions like Sonos. Some use Google Assistant and others us Amazon Alexa. Good Luck!

I was skeptical when I bought this first echo on the advice of a friend. I now have 3 echos and 4 echo dots. Their capabilities far exceed anything I can imagine. With the Alexa app, you can literally change your lifestyle. Echos control my lights, temperature, security system and cameras. They are the updated intercom system in home. Alexa can start my car and teach English to my international student. I can talk with my parents in another city as if they were in my home or call anyone in my contact list. If you like automation and embrace innovative ideas, this will become your new best friend.

This is our first Echo, and it’s everything we expected and more. I use Alexa to play music when I’m doing chores liking making breakfast. The sound is more than adequate for that. So far we have her set up to control just one lamp, which we can get her to turn it on or off from the top of the stairs. We remember to thank her often, and she always replies. She’s so cute. We’re thinking of getting a second Echo, but will the first Alexa get jealous?

We love Alexa! We use her to play music, play radio through iTunes, play podcasts through Anypod, and set reminders. We listen to our flash briefing of news and weather every morning. We rely on our custom lists. We like being able to voice control the volume. We're sure we'll continue to find new uses. Sometimes it's a bit frustrating when Alexa doesn't understand what we're saying.

The sound is really nice. I was surprised how good it sounds. There is good bass and crisp sound, but the sound quality does start to degrade at higher volumes. That is not a problem for me at all because it is plenty loud for my needs even at about half of the max volume. The Microphones also seem to pick up my voice commands much better than the smaller echo dot. Overall I am very happy with the echo. My only complaint so far is the same problem with all the Alexa devices, there is no option to change the timer sound. I use the timer a lot, and I want to be able to change the sound for it. Really simple change that Amazon just refuses to make in the app.

Sound is muddy and it's a huge disapointment that they don't directly support streaming from a local server. There is an extension called my music that can do it, but there's a subscription fee and it's more trouble than it's worth to get it play what you want (at least that was my experience)
Love multi room music! Bought 7 for entire house and can stream music on all with only my voice. Nice upgrade amazon. Whole house WiFi sound system!

I received my Alexa as a thank you for purchasing several large appliances. I didn't know what to expect! I use mostly for music and my first day was the Fourth of July when I was blasting the 1812 Symphony with the cannons booming -- played everything from oldies to new age since. My granddaughters loved it this past week with playing the soundtrack from "Hamilton" to asking for jokes.

I purchased an Echo 6 months ago. Over that time we had an OK experience, we primarily use it to play music through spotify, and the sound quality was so-so. The music would often stop and start out of nowhere, it was impossible to predict or control. Then one day the quality totally deteriorated, it started sounding terribly scratchy and tinny. I contacted support for help, they ended up having me send the device back to be repaired. About 10 days later it was returned to me, in the exact same condition. When I contacted support again I got bounced around from one department to the next, was on the phone for over 2 hours. I ended up demanding a refund out of frustration, and they only refunded $89 of the $99 I had spent. What a disappointing experience.

You can set things up and it can do many things. I, however, have not used Alexa to her capabilities. A book on Echo for dummies might be appropriate. She is easy to use, but for you out there who are conspiracy theorists and paranoid, she is always listening. She (Alexa) will pop up all of a sudden during a conversation if she thinks she has been summoned. (Scary, I'm already referring to her in the third person)

Had the a 1st generation Echo which we enjoyed owning for 1 1/2 years and stopped working in Nov 2017. After looking at various on-line forums and calling tech support, cause of failure still is unknown. I suspect it was the motherboard that failed and possibly a power surge may of zapped it? However, the new device is connected to a CyberPower 3-outlet surge unit to be on the safe side. Anyway, Amazon was gracious enough to provide a modest credit ($30) for the purchase of a new 2nd generation Echo. We obtained the charcoal fabric and so far like the smaller size and enjoy hearing Alexa's voice again. It was easy to set-up and pair up with our network. I read many reviews of the sound quality differences and this one (2nd Gen) sounds more or less the same, maybe less bass that I can recall. Also, I was able to easily pair my remote from the 1st gen Echo to the 2nd gen as the current model doesn't come with a remote. Just go into settings on the Amazon Alexa app and click on the Echo your using and look for Connected Devices and click on pair remote. This is the app from the Play Store for Android. Looking at the Alexa app, I see the latest software update was pushed to the new Echo device (Latest Software Version: 595530420). Overall, we just use it for playing music from the Amazon library and really don't use many features its capable of but will probably do some research of the other functions. I'm hoping it will last longer than the 1st Gen device but time will tell and will give the 2nd Gen a chance.

I started out looking for a radio so that I could listen to news and music when I am home. I was so shocked at the price of a radio that I started looking into Alexa. I ordered Alexa second generation and echo dot. Most of the people I know have the bigger Alexa unit and they are quite nice. However, I have not found anything that the second generation can't due. I'm extremely happy with my purchase. Music sounds good and I can listen to all the news I want. The reason I gave it four stars is it doesn't come with an instruction booklet. I can buy one but not looking forward it.

Great sound, needs to be compatible with Google play music rather than just with Amazon music. Works for blue tooth but would be excellent if telling Alexa to play a certain song by a certain band with Google play music would be great and I would give a 5 star review. If you mainly want a music platform get the Google home. Does the same thing as Alexa but you can use Google play music on more than just one device

I really liked it, it was neat and fun at first. It controls the sonos to play pandora with but half the time she plays it on her own speaker instead. The apps (skills) she had all became annoying, in that she would blink a yellow notification ring but then tell you things from days ago. Also, we don’t have anything smart in our home, no lights, locks, or anything else so unless she does something it might st be on her own. Which is not much.

I have had the Echo (actually 2nn one- 1stwouldn't work) since 3/19/2018 and none of my techie friends have been able to get it to work. Dot is still in the box. I have purchased a new IPhone and a different carrier in the hopes we can get Echo to work. In the meantime II an paying $7.99 a month for Amazon miusic. Very frustrated. 20 hours on the phone with Tech Gelp. Are you having an inventory control problem? My new phone will be activated on Thursday. This will be my last attempt. I have lost 2 friends by making them work for hours to set Echo up. Not happy.

As a Christmas gift it was one of the best I have gotten . Plugged it in and went to the Echo app on my phone and started using it. One of the features I like is that I have paired it with my Amazon fire TV and I have hands off operation of my entertainment world. Alexa can find any move I want. Still learning but that's fun too. Really nice sound quality also. Installed a bluetooth device on my TV and now the sound quality is much better coming from the Echo.

I live in an apartment which uses the wifi network from university campus. Echo is sometimes connected to the network, but after a few days, when I call Alexa, it says 'I can't connect to the public wifi network'. This repeated again and again for a half year. So, I... just use this as a bluetooth speaker lol

Alexa is good for general questions, but if asked for anything too complicated or specific it cannot process the information. It feels too robotic and very linear in dialect. I feel that Alexa is an upgraded Siri. The system/programming needs a real personally overhaul, if that is based on the verbal commands or interacts experienced with the user or if some team at Amazon decides that aspect. Overall, Alexa is convenient if you're a consistent shopper, like audible books, or Amazon music. It has the potential to be so much more. I hope Amazon can bridge the gaps.

Amazon Echo does what any smart home system can do, but goes the extra mile. I've asked her dozens of questions and only found one or two she couldn't answer. She beats Siri and Cortana by a landslide, and has one of the best speakers i've heard. That being said, she's not perfect. some of the skills/apps you can have her use are broken (not her fault, though, i know) and you can't even whisper her name without her activating. she's definitely worth the money, however, and I'm 100% happy with my purchase. She's particularly great for listening to Spotify. Those speakers are amazing!

Just another way to milk money out of customers. Sound is great but only plays songs if you subscribe to the service! ( and pay a monthly fee) For most questions you ask you get "I don't know that" . I guess its better than a dog ,but not much! Once you establish a conversation with another person the dialog flows without a personal address . With alexa it requires that you continually preface with "alexa"......for it to respond. I received this one as a gift. Would I buy one for $5.00 . NO! Just read an article that indicated that the unit may mess up your internet router and we have been having computer problems since we plugged it in. We are on DSL frontier and normally have some problems so not sure on that . If get the courage to unplug it and plug it back in to test that out I will let you know . (am fearful of having to go through the set up process again!) I gave it 1 star for its good morning greeting!!!

No improved sound at all... Amazon Echo first generation sounds waaaaay better than this generation, I change back to my old Echo and put the new one somewhere in the house. Mic got well improved and how it looks is astonishing beautiful... But Echo users (like me) mostly were looking for sound quality.... Here is my suggestion ... Don't change your regular Echo for the 2nd Generation.

I haven't been this disappointed by a purchase in a long time! It's fine for playing songs, but even then, Alexa plays the same songs over and over. When ask Alexa questions, she ALWAYS answers that she does not understand or does not know. When I want to order stuff, it gives the most expensive item on Amazon (for example, spray for stains for like $16 a bottle). This thing is a super waste of money! I wish it wasn't past the return date.

bought this for my wife for Christmas. she loves it. said it is the best present she could get. Alexia is fun to interact with and reminds us to do things we for get to do like take medicine at a certain time. when you get older you sometimes forget. she plays Pandora for us and what we are doing now is just the tip of the iceberg as what she can do. she does have a personality the more you use her. love it love it love it john and deb thomas

Update on August 2018: This thing still comes the first , along with Echo Show , when it comes to enjoying Alexa to the most. I can’t stop loving Amazon Echo. Lovely gadget, worth all the money spent there, as a personal assistant, smart home controller, and music player and speaker. I love the fact that it's evolving , and responds well to feedback and improvements, which resolve the few issues that one may face when dealing with Alexa!

Gave to my 86 year old Mother. She has been slowing losing short term memory. So she has pulled back from socializing at her Nursing Home. In the last month she has kept very busy with her echo. It is improving her speech and thought functions. And doesn't argue with her. I have been recieving many less phone calls from her.

I love this device, very fun and enjoyable for me and the whole family. It does take time to learn and program the device but worth the time. I bought this for myself and two 3rd generations for my kids. Speaker is great quality and is able to hear me from across the room without having to shout. Would definitely recommend to anyone! If you have kids set up the parental controls so they can't make purchases accidentally!

Very cool device. I can tell Alexa to change the temperature setting on my Nest Thermostat, turn on and off my Hue lights, listen to music from Amazon Prime, and much more. The sound quality is very impressive. I'm supposed to be able to control my Harmony remote through the Echo with voice to Alexa, but can't get that to work just yet. Overall, very happy with Echo. If you have any friends named Alexa, beware, the Echo will respond every time you say that name.

Generally speaking, Alexa (Amazon Echo) is responsive, intuitive and provides the expected level of productivity relative to the price. That said, while I'm considered a patient customer, I've found myself becoming incensed a number of times, when the echo fails spectacularly. Again, it works quite well most of the time and would consider myself an overall satisfied customer. Would buy again.

I think this has the potential be a great product but you need to go in knowing what this device is capable of. Music: If you do not want to pay for music you are pretty much stuck with Pandora. You can still use your phone as a Bluetooth device you can't play directly from the device. You also cannot upload your own music to Amazon Music without a subscription. Knowledge: This is not a Google device and the questions that you ask cannot always be answered correctly. This device is great for weather and random notifications but not great for asking questions. All in all if I could go back I think I would have purchased the Google device due to the music and question aspect.

I like this better than my Amazon Tap, sound is good although a bit on the bass side. I have bought a couple of these, compared to others on the market by other brands I liked the sound of the Echo best. I can only give a 4 Star because of the bass sounds being so prominent in my music. It’s great for Nikki Minaj, but not so much for some rock or country songs. Wish it had some adjustments for the tones.

Mine keeps having a green flashing ring. When I look this up it says it is because it has lost its connection with the internet or it is an incoming call. Yet neither is true and there doesn't seem to be any kind of readily apparent customer service at Amazon to be able to address this issue.

I had an Echo Dot that I really liked, but I always wished it was louder. I got this in hopes that it would be louder, and I have been seriously impressed by the great sound quality. Paired with Amazon Music Unlimited, this is a great accessory to have around the house.
