What can I say I love my echo! I’ve had it for a few months now and love it so much I bought a show as well. I use it to listen to music, control lights and switches and cameras. I love using the shopping list feature and I use it when I make phone calls. She helps me find my phone when I lose it, answer questions, settle arguments, start my car, control my ac. I don’t know what I did before I had Alexa in my life!

I decided to wait a few days before posting this review, because initial impressions consisted of one word: Eww. I know this speaker is not that of Bose, Sonos, or any known high-end brand, but the audio quality was simply terrible. Alexa sounded pretty drunk when it responds to whatever I asked it to do, which was actually more comical than irritating. I guess after a night or two (and several one star reviews later), there was an update to the Echo firmware and it somehow improved the audio quality making music sound halfway decent, and Alexa sounds like she is sober enough to recite my reminders for the day (as if I was that important). Honestly, the speaker sounds decent, it's neither the bottom of the barrel nor the top of the crop. (Ugh, corny, I know.) Alexa works as expected. That's pretty much it. Get it if you want it, pass if you don't, simple as that.

The sound is sooooooooo bassy as to render the unit hard to hear. I thought they fixed it from 1st gen.... they didn't. Amazon needs to enable the user to tailor the sound they want from their devices.... that's the only fix that will work... i.e., an equalizer app at their end that is associated with your account .. the sound quality currently stinks and need fixing (again/still!)!

Excellent household technology. Even better (and more useful) when you build a constellation of Echos throughout the house (Intercom function is becoming quite popular in our house). Alexa is a win overall - and FUN! Will be exciting to watch where the technology goes next in the coming years. Good on Amazon to take the lead in what is sure to become a staple technology.

Just bought one for my apartment - I love it! Only issue is sometimes it has trouble recognizing my boyfeiend’s commands even though he has his account sync’d up as well. And for some reason when I ask what’s on my calendar for the day, it says nothing even though I have something scheduled (I’ve tried my iCloud calendar plus google calendars, and have tried selecting different calendars for it to read from and it still doesn’t work).

I love everything about it except the lack of tone controls. The sound is punchy and sounds best loud. At lower volumes, the bass drowns out the higher frequencies (treble and midrange). An online equalizer or tone control "skill" would make this perfect. The sound on this thing goes through walls--you can FEEL the bass. A lot of sound in a small enclosure--amazing... Will add star when the tone controls become available--I suspect they will. Oh--some people have reported "undocumented" tone controls. These controls only alter the volume on my Echo. My Echo Dot is envious. It's been relegated to reminders only.

At first, I really liked the two Echos we purchased for a party but I’m seriously considering returning them. It’s just not worth it for $200 for the two of them. It’s a bit ridiculous Amazon Prime members have to pay extra for streaming music.

The Echo 2nd Generation very good upgrade, sound a lot better than 1ST one , price very reasonable for look n sound. if this 1 wireless it be prefect. my sons love the 1st echo, this 2nd they not even touch it, because it not wireless. too bad I may return it later for the wireless 1.(love the sound)

I love the new form factor and colors. It has a aolod weight, and responds when I say Alexa almost always. But when it's side by side with my first generation, the original just sounds better. More base and mids. I'll keep this unit, but I definitely don't plan on buying another for music purposes.

I question the improvement vs the Echo 1st generation beyond the height and color. Response time seems slower (with regards to giving commands), sound is not as good as original Echo (play Bohemian Rhapsody by Queen which hits extreme highs and lows). I would say it is a little better than the dot. Probably should have gone with the Echo Hub unit.

The speaker on this Alexa is amazing! Alexa will spontaneously reach out to us throughout the day, which we don't care for. There is lots of information she doesn't know. but we really like the speaker!

For normal functions, taking to Alexa, is great. Sound is very good. Controls compatible devices fine. If I were only buying one echo for my home and I didn't need video it would be this. I'm disappointed that it wasn't compatible with my echo spot for multi-room music, so for my multi-echo home, I would not buy this again.

The biggest issue was tech support who did not know what to do despite having to speak with 3 people tonight. --- they kept repeating what i already told them and then told me to do same things I have already tried unsuccessfully. It took an infinite level of patience to just understand what they were saying. Secondly, connectivity issue was compounded by repeat drop offs and error messages (both on screen and Alexa voice) despite many attempts to set it up. I have spent too much time trying to make this work in vain.

All three Echos we own will not connect to our new home Wifi. My phone connects to the new Wifi. My laptop connects to the new Wifi. None of our 3 Alexa's will connect. UPDATE: So I had to 'Reset' each device and now they all work. Switching Wifi should be easier. Also, it really worries me that Alexa records all of our private conversations.

My Grandson (9 years old) asked for an Echo for Christmas and he loves it. He uses it as an alarm clock in the mornings and to play music while he studies. Who knows all the questions he asks but he is engaged and this is a learning tool. We have an Echo ourselves and use it constantly. For me, the best part is to add items to my wife's shopping list.

I love the idea of Alexa. Asking her simple questions like the weather stuff works out fine. She struggles to understand us when we're in the skills section playing games so we get a lot of the answers wrong which is frustrating, trying to get her to play certain songs with non explicit lyrics is a big issue as well. Simple commands she doesn't understand :asking for duets or asking playlist to be stored is also an issue.

The Echo is Amazing. First of all, it is a terrific Bluetooth speaker. The sound easily fills my medium size living room. It has an audio output plug, so I can play it thru my stereo if I want to. Then there is the idea of having a companion who can answer questions, schedule my appointments, add items to my shopping list, etc. I am sure Alexa has many "skills" that I have not discovered or mastered yet. I am very excited to have an Echo in the house!

Love the sound that comes from this small device. I always thought there was no reason to purchase the Echo, since the dot was loud enough for my small room when I wanted to listen to music. Man, if I had only known the clarity and bass that came from the larger Echo, i would have purchased sooner. If you want to listen to music daily, or occasionally, then you need to purchase this.

I have had several months now with the Amazon Echo. Sound quality is good. Better then expected once the software upgrade completed when it was first set up. Alexa makes things easier, like finding out the weather in a certain area before I head out, or what the traffic and travel time is. There are better speakers on the market, and they cost more, but I went with the Echo primarily for my music library, and ease of accessing it. I plan to purchase more in the future for the other rooms in the house.

Bought the grey one as a gift for mother and set it up in her kitchen. She loves it. Mostly uses to listen to music and NPR radio, but she loves for weather, spelling or to ask questions. I have multiple units through out the house. A Dot that's linked to my Tv system via a Harmony Hub to a Echo in my kitchen and another in my bedroom that works as an alarm and controls a smart plug that activates a fan. Easy set up and great tool. Decent sound considering price. Can't go wrong considering all it can do at this price point.

My primary uses for the Echo are to check the weather and play music. My disappointment lies in the fact that I have to reboot the unit several times a week because it loses contact with my WiFi, and sometimes it just stops in the middle of playing music. I'm also not that pleased with the musical selections. I have a very broad range of musical interests from classical to classic rock and when I ask for specific composers or albums, I sometimes get unrelated pieces or nothing at all, e.g., "play Beethoven" starts off with some pop piece, or, in the case of a specific Moody Blues album, I am told I have to subscribe to Amazon music to get it. I don't ask Alexa to tell me jokes or provide data on something or someone, so I can't comment on that aspect of the product.

I have wanted an Alexa since my mother and sister got one about a year ago. They have Echo dots so for Christmas I was asked if i wanted one and said heck ya! I asked if the Echo was possible since I listen to music all day everyday. So for Christmas I got the 2nd Gen Echo and I am in love with it! The sound and bass is amazing. Although Alexa has some stuff to work on which all brands do i love the games and skills. Great job Amazon! Loving it!

Can't say enough how much I love my Alexa. This little speaker is pretty loud. Sometimes when I talk it outside it has a hard time. Understanding I guess because of car traffic noise but otherwise I use it every single day. My kid plays games w it, I love listening to music, my hubby listens to his podcasts and asking it questions and it's. Funny little features is nice.

I was skeptical at first but asked for the smaller Echo for Christmas. After setting it up and finding all it could do, I moved that one to the bedroom and ordered this for the main living area. They're much more useful on a day to day basis than I had ever imagined. Especially like being able to do voice control for home automation devices. Also nice to wakeup and ask Alexa for the weather and what's on my calendar for the day!

We've had our two Echos for a month now. I can't say enough about the convenience of having information, news, and music available all of the time at any location in the house. Alexa isn't perfect but we've already noticed her 'learning' our patterns and voices. She is getting smarter all of the time. If the Echo was just a music player it would be worth the cost. With Music Unlimited plan we have not asked for a song she didn't immediately start playing. It is almost space-age.

Despite help from Amazon, my Echo either cannot find any internet or rejects the password which works on all my other devices: wi-fi extenders, Printer, etc. I have tried everything suggested but suspect the Echo is now a doorstop. Non of my devices work and it is very INCONVENIENT in a large house. Limited lifetime!!!

I don’t have an alarm clock and I can tell her to wake me up at a certain time. I also can tell her what to add to my list when I think about it after I’ve already laid down for the night to remind me.

My Echo was a gift to me. And what a great gift it is. The sound quality from the speaker is fabulous. “Alexa, play (whoever I say)” and she responds, “Shuffling songs by (whoever I said)”. I say, “Alexa, add eggs to Grocery (a list I created)” and the next time I open the Alexa app on my phone my grocery list is right there for me. I can call people from my contact list hands free. At first I had thought, “What am I going to do with this thing?”, but I have to admit that it is really convenient and was very easy to set up. I highly recommend the Echo.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! Alexa is fun, helpful, and entertaining. We use the Echo and Alexa for music, recipes, answering questions, and smart home uses (turning on/off lights, heater, plugs) This Echo sounds great in our bedroom, we have dots too, and love both, but this definitely has a richer sound than the dot, I use the dot in another bedroom and office and it is perfect for background music, go for the Echo where you want a better music experience
Fun...the speaker sounds way better than expected. Now part of the family even though it may be spying on us. We love it.

Love this!!! Had lots of fun with it initially asking questions. One of my favorites now is asking Alexa to play Praise and Worship music when I first get up. Starts my day out with a thankful heart and love for my creator as I make breakfast and get ready for the day. As I leave the house I say STOP. I don’t have to go over and turn some button off before I grab my coat and purse. I know We’re so lazy aren’t we? Wow! So happy for a great product.

I like that I can "drop in" a call to my wife who is in another state being treated for cancer. Feels like talking through an intercom to the next room. I like the nature Sounds it will play when I have trouble sleeping. My Echo was a gift, I could accomplish everything this echo can do with my cell phone. (And my cell phone does more, actually.) Mostly, it acts as the most expensive alarm clock I've ever owned. Only real useful thing I can think of that the Echo would be good for....... giving them to a paraplegics or quadriplegics who have trouble with touch screen phones. Would not buy an Echo myself. Waste of money, makes people lazy.
Did not work or respond, wasted time item defective.

This is the second one I purchased. I Iove it, I don’t need to worry about where my remote for my TV is nor the remote for my sound bar I can control it from my Echo, most of all I can set reminder when my favorite TV shows are coming on. And when I want to change the mood, I can even control the lights. Next project will be to control my thermostat 🤓

This Echo is a surprising let-down. Asked her to play The Rolling Stones, and she played songs which I never heard before. And she does this habitually with any artist we request. I have $100 dust collector on my table. Thank you Amazon for another disappointment.

Echo is a lot of fun for the money. It’s instant and informative and humorous at times. One thing to know: Alexa got a little screwy once. Couldn’t answer questions. I googled and couldn’t find a solution. I reset the modem with no success. But when I unplugged the echo for a minute and restarted it, it was fine. It’s like powering down your phone or iPad from time to time.

I like it very much and like the various tasks it can do. My only "complaint" is that the Alexa voice is not always easy to understand. It's an electronic voice so words are not always pronounced correctly or distinctly. This becomes a problem when playing some of the quiz games. Other than that, it's fun and informative. And, I love the music feature, particularly with the improved speakers.

I don’t get this new “improved “ echo? It does have a nicer form factor (smaller and fabric covers) but the sound in my opinion is a big step backwards compared to the original echo. Tinny and no base, I wonder if it’s not really designed for music but just voice confirmations? After playing my Eagles radio for a few songs, I had to turn it off. Back to my DOT Bluetooth w/Bose Soundlink mini.

this is my second Alexa-one Echo and my son gave me a dot for Christmas. I am almost 80 and cannot believe all the wonderful inventions and new products in my lifetime. I especially like the music unlimited and the wonderful sounds that can put you to sleep. There isn't anything that I do not like about it. Alexa is our future and I hope everyone gets the chance to enjoy it.

I bought this as a gift for my mother and I have to say, despite all the negative reviews, I am so happy with this! She has been wanting one for a while now and I opened it to set it up and it's too cool. It plays music perfectly, I'm not all that into specifications and what not, the sound quality is amazing and it's so easy to use. Will probably buy myself one soon as well!

Save yourself the headaches and get a Google Home. The best part about the Echo is the line out port. Everything else is meh. Search results are poor. When you ask it to play something from Spotify, 90% of the time it’s wrong, or can’t find what you are asking. Even with learned skills, my results are hit and miss... mostly miss. You can’t stream from Spotify on your iPhone to Echo in the Spotify app the way you can to Google Home which is a huge pain. You have to use the Alexa app, which again, usually doesn’t work. The audio quality is meh as well. Thankfully an audio out port is on the back, so you can plug it into another set of speakers. The best thing about Echo is that my son can send voice notes to my parents whenever he wants, and that’s enough reason to keep it around. At least it looks good on my dresser!

It’s all right nothing special . It would probably benefit someone with a smart house more than it benefits me. Many times I ask Alexis question she doesn’t know it or she’s working on it. I also don’t like the fact that there isn’t a choice on explicit songs. All of the rap songs or some R&B songs only have explicit version. I would rather have the clean versions.

I purchased my Echo for the music and radio variety. Well, I discovered something else. Alexa has a great knowledge of vocabulary. While reading, if I come to a word for which I don't know the meaning, I ask Alexa. No need to keep a dictionary by my side. I love Alexa and can't wait to discover what other qualities she has.
Upgraded from echo dot for better sound. (And to use less space. Had added a blue tooth speaker for dot).

This is a good tool but it still needs work. First, the inability to send voice to text messages is a pain. Also, you can only message people who also have the Alexa app. So, if they have Google Home or something else...no. The Jeopardy app is a good feature but it's hard to get out of it once you launch it, no matter how many times you say Alexa. The key is to wait until the narrator is speaking then speak Alexas name over that voice. I sometimes have to say Alexa a few times to wake up the device too. The most important feature (voice web search) is garbage. That needs a lot, a ton, a tremendous amount of re-work to compete with Google. Also, I bought mine in sale for $79 and I think that's the perfect price point. $100 is too much.
I received a Dot for Christmas and I loved it so much that I bought a Echo for my living room. I use this primarily for games, weather, music, and now an alarm.

It refuses to properly pair with a bluetooth speaker. I've tried multiple bluetooth speakers at various distances but it won't continually connect. The Amazon customer support was garbage as their only suggestion was I permanently use an aux cable and reset the device. As a stand alone unit it is fine but if you are hoping to use it with a blue tooth speaker, look elsewhere. This thing sucks. I don't understand how in 2018 a company as big as Amazon can make a device that is unable to connect to a bluetooth speaker is completely beyond me. Get a Google home

Even a complete "tech" idiot like me handled this. I have three now and absolutely LOVE them. We pretty much just use them for music, and the occasional weather inquiry, but having music in every room is awesome. Our floor plan is pretty open,so having all play the same music is great. None of the Echo has to be too loud, but the sound is very good . Like having a Sonos at half the price, without using a reciever. We're sold.

Convenient technology, my kids use it to ask intelligent questions and learn more. The other multitude of features come in handy as well. I like the drop in feature which allows me to communicate through the Echo from my phone. This is great especially when no one hears the phone ring, I can reach them any where in the house being that I have a pair of Echos.

Great product, impressive interaction, from asking questions about anything you want to know, play games like 20 questions (and she is smart!), play songs you like, traffic, weather, even make phone calls. One problem is, as nice as it sounds, the treble or "highs" need increased a bit and there is no way to adjust the bass & treble. There are posts out there about how to do it, but it does not work on this version. I am considering returning it just for the sound quality. I'll see.
This has changed everything in my home. Fully integrated into smart devices. Very easy to set up. Glad I made the purchase. I intend to purchase 2 of the next model up, along with the subwoofer.

Mine has a funny reverb noise. I wrote to the help desk and got no answer. Still, I listen to worship music with it and can't live without it now. Also I love that it puts my shopping list together for me .

I really love Alexa. She keeps my shopping list efficiently on my phone. She greets me with interesting facts each morning and a joke and the weather if I ask. She sounds great when I ask her to play my favorite station. There are a lot of things she does that I don't even know yet....however, every once in awhile I am denied because I don't have amazon prime......

So new we are still learning what Alexa can do. So far I like that I can add to my grocery list at any time then pull it up on the app while shopping and check off items as they go in the cart. Asking for the time, weather, a joke or for a song is great. Does math, answers history questions, recites ammendments to the Constitution if asked. I know there's so much more but we are just getting acquainted. My only regret is a few days after setting up our Echo 2nd generation I see that a 3rd generation has come out so now I'm curious what we are missing out on. (Typing this I asked Alexa how to spell acquainted. I wasn't sure.) She's so helpful!

Planning on building some smart functions into a new home. Stage one was one echo and one echo dot. Getting them up and running very easy. Linked with Amazon music works flawless. Simple tasks like setting alarm checking weather and news feeds easy. Next start adding in some automation such as lights ceiling fans and thermostat.

It works just like the first generation (original) Echo and didn't observe any improvement so far. It's definitely not as nice as the original Echo both sound quality wise and design. I like the ring volume control of the original echo which is missing from the 2nd gen and only available on the 'plus'. Obviously, it's only half the costs of the original Echo and smaller so I kind of expecting this.

The differences on these are not clear and therefore I ended up buying the wrong one. Unfortunately my wife through the box away and cannot return. This device will not work your lights and thermostat like I was hoping. With that said it is anwounderful device and love the functionality of the Echo. The only reason I gave it a 3 star is because of the ambiguity in the description. Had I known I would have gladly spent the extra, at that time, $10.00 and got the Echo Plus....

We ordered this after lots of research in our quest to find the perfect gift for my mom who has everything. We spent a few hours setting it up with her yesterday and what fun! I would not risk my health by posting her age, but suffice to say she's over 70, and was thrilled with the things Alexa could do right out of the box. We ordered a couple of smart bulbs so she can control her lights without leaving a room. Long story short, we were so impressed we ordered one for our home and for each of our children. It will be a great additional way to stay in touch - love the drop in feature!

I love Love Love my echo! Always wanted one and using it has become my life haha. Officially replaced my alarms and daily routines with Alexa. Only thing I wish the Echo could do is make internet searches. Anything that is somewhat opinion based she can’t answer so that’s a bummer but otherwise super awesome and super amazed by all the extras she can do when looking on the app!

My second amazon device after receiving the new echo spot and im loving it. The speaker is good and picks up your voice well. Set up was easy. Already had my Phillip hues, cloud cam, and tp outlet set up in my alexa app for my spot and within seconds of setting this up it was also linked to all my devices and ready to go! its low profile and fits well in a room. Very excited to see what more it can do!

I received this as a Christmas Present. I will be buying a couple more to modernize my home. There are alo5 of things to do with this Evho and Amazon is continuing to add more things. I signed up for the unlimited music for $3.99. I’m glad I did. I have found more new artists to listen too. The kids love it to tell them jokes and just ask questions. I get local news, weather, and can find new recipes for supper. Only downfall is my internet. I’m in the country and my DSL is really bad. Not Echos problem though. The color is perfect too. It can go in any room. Very pleased with this product.

Thanks to the reviewers that prompted Amazon to improve Echo II's sound quality issues by automatically installing software updates. Nice timely/prompt work on the updates Amazon, good job! Just fired up my new Echo II (a gift- had not ever had an echo prior), and I experienced the same issue with very lackluster audio. About 15 minutes after setting up & connecting Echo II to wifi (follow the prompts on Alexa app), Alexa informs me that she has received an update, and will have to restart in order to install it. 3 min later, she restarts... low and behold- very nice audio! Software update is version 592452720, which you can check for in the Alexa app 'settings > devices > click on your Echo device > scroll down to Device software version. Echo II looks to be a fine addition to our household. We have prime, so tons of music available- so far have asked Alexa to play: soft jazz; Rhapsody in Blue (she brought up the Leonard Bernstein/New York Philharmonic version); Cake; ZZ Top; Vince Guaraldi. All sounded great. Other tasks tried so far- 'set an alarm; tell me a knock-knock joke; what's the weather; where's the closest Home Depot; tell me the news ('flash briefing'). All were performed flawlessly. Looking forward to discovering other Echo II capabilities. Highly recommended, and at the Black Friday weekend prices, a bonafide no-brainer!

Echo...Second Generation. I have waited for this to get the updates and improvements before I purchased it for my home. Alexa is a great feature and I can listen to any music I want to hear along with having questions answered on just about any topic. I still get a laugh when she starts talking when something on the television activates her. AAAAA+++++

Great product for hands-free music, weather, recipes--but I especially appreciate the ability to communicate with my disabled relative. Thanks to drop in, we can have instant conversations without her having to do a thing--she just starts speaking when I say "hello"! She can ask Alexa what day it is, what the weather is, what her calendar holds--as many times as she likes. GREAT product for elderly/disabled consumers. Could be improved for that population with higher volume, slower speech.

So far my wife and I have only been using the Echo for basic things. Like setting a timer, or asking it to remind us to do something. We've listened to some music on it, and it does a good job of that. Sound quality is what you would expect from a small speaker. We hope to get a smart plug or two to control a lamp or two in the future. My wife has also asked it about the weather. I even got it to sing happy birthday the other day on a friends birthday, although it won't insert the person's name into the song. I think as time goes on we will find other uses for it. I gave it 4 stars because it's still has room to improve, ofcourse that could be us not using it to its potential.

Echo has changed the way we track many things in our household! Shopping lists, to-do lists, timers for cooking, bedtimes, etc. are all now done by the sound of our voice. Echo family trivia night has become a favorite for everyone as well! With Echo plus two Echo Dots, we can easily communicate from upstairs to the basement or play music through the whole house! The only downside is that we can never watch another movie or TV show with a character named, "Alexa" or anything close to it.

Oh my goodness what a bad purchase. The bass is INCREDIBLY WEAK, even for the size of the speaker. I have multiple Bluetooth speakers that retail for less than half the price of this speaker and are smaller but they all produce better bass. They are also cordless which make them much more practical. (How Amazon has not made these things cordless yet is beyond me, doesn’t make any sense for the price they’re asking). Basically, you are paying for Alexa. If that’s what you really care about, great. But I bought the echo as opposed to the dot so I could have added bass and that is not something this product does well whatsoever. In summary, DO NOT purchase this product if you’re just looking for a portable speaker with all around good sound quality.

My wife bought me the Echo for my birthday....I love it. Alexa does everything from play music, tell us the weather and stock market, timing our meals in the oven to predicting the Eagles will win the Super Bowl (which I have may have a few doubts about). It is actually a very useful tool.....next up for Alexa....ordering from Amazon through the Echo. Highly recommend...fun and helpful tool.

I am unable to connect the Alexa App -- the username and password is correct. Tried with ipad, iphone and Alexa web app. After 30 minutes with an unhelpful agent -- still no connection. It is on its way back to Amazon.

Sometimes, Alexa talks without being spoken to. We're still trying to get the hang of it. Alexa can do a lot of things but she doesn't offer anything that you cannot live without. In my opinion, she is overrated and over priced. We mostly use her to play music which can be achieved with a portable Bluetooth speaker for much cheaper. Worth the hype? Not really.

I love the sound that comes from the echo. Its rich , beautiful. It can tell me everything i want to know. The only thing i don't like is im having trouble with the 2nd echo keepling it on line snd getting it to pair eith the other one for multiroom entertainment. I eould recommend this .

Love it but it does take some set up on the iPad to get the music you might want to hear. I use Amazon which has tons of free music from which you can choose. Sometimes I just talk to her to see what she will say. There are sites that will give you clues on things to add and offer downloads for Echo. I’m enjoying it. Voice sometimes hard to discern some words she says.

So far loving the Echo! I have set my commute in the app which has been helpful for the morning traffic. My calendar is linked and is nice for anyone in the family to ask Alexa, so that the kids know when a baseball game or Girl Scout event is happening that day. Music of course is awesome. The skills are fun to explore for the kids, even the dog loves the Zoo Keeper. Still so much more to discover! Will be buying more Echos for the kids room!

I have had nothing but issues with my echo, not staying connected to the internet. The dot works fine, this unit is just horrible. I tried to work with the customer service with zero support. They told me to reset the unit and I have done so twice. The unit just doesn't hold a wifi signal. Should have gone with the apple HomePod.

Got the first one free with another purchase. Hooked it up and it worked fine. Bought a couple more, hooked them up. No problem. Changed wifi routers and all heck broke loose. Took hours with tech support to get them working. Then, a couple of days ago, one of them arbitrarily changed wife networks and now won't play music or radio. Tried to switch it back but following the instructions didn't help. It is a good product but they have some bugs to work out. It has been good for my aging mom to use to call us in the night. Will keep them and try to work out the kinks. When they work, they work well.

This is the 3rd echo we have in addition to 2 dots. Love the capabilities and have them all over the house. We can add to the grocery list from any room as well as listen to music through the entire house. We have 7 wemo switches and take full advatange of the skills and automation with the Echo’s to control lamps in the living room a fan in our bedroom and more. I enjoy the emails of new skills and know we will always have these devices as part of our daily lives

I bought this as a gift and thought it would be as easy as the promotional materials indicated. not! We were finally able to set it up but I can't recommend it. We just use it to play music but if you're talking in the area where it sits, it does ask questions when it's not included in the conversation. I thought that was untrue but beware!

After using a comparable Google Home, I definitely like the Echo and Alexa WAY better. I love the sound quality and volume and already started adding home automation with Alexa support which is totally cool (always wanted something like this since seeing Star Trek as a kid). I highly recommend the 2nd Gen Echo to anyone. VERY cool.stuff!!

This made my life easier. I make lists but when I am not at my phone or laptop, I usually forget the list item before I get to the phone or laptop. Not anymore...Alexa add (whatever) to my (shopping, to do, or whatever) list. I've also added lamp controls so I can turns lights on/off by voice command. Sweet.

Love the voice and basic abilities and also know that Amazon is coordinating additional features but as for tying it all together and or asking "Alexa" a question... barely better than Siri. Be prepared to spend a great deal of time in setting up and "learning" what Alexa can do and not do. Simplicity is key and for the lack of current features, I subtract 1 star.

The echo is mostly irritating. When you ask a question, it's as bad as a phone that misinterprets what you request. E.G. I asked for Christmas music, which Echo always starts with Burl Ives, so yesterday, asked for Christmas music without Burl Ives, and Alexa said she couldn't find any Burl Ives music. It is frustrating and usually results with a request by calling Alexa stupid and going to a computer for info. It was a gift. Thank God I didn't pay for it.

The best thing about having an echo like this in the kitchen is that you can tell it what to put on the grocery list the second you think of it. And even better, while at the store, family members can add what they want and it will show up on your app on your phone. I also like that I can play music from my Amazon Music app while cooking.

I thought the speaker would be better than the original one, but it actually is not better. And, I like the volume control on the original one better too. Otherwise, the small size and fabric cover I sleeker looking and more decretive.

I haven’t used it but once and only for a couple minutes. I’m not To sure I want to even use it with all that is being said about it being intrusive. I would have sent it back because I bought it for a gift to my wife and she didn’t want it. My Mom passed away and I was gone over the time limit to return it. It was still in the box never opened until the time limit was up and when I got back home I opened the box it came in.

Still need improving when speaking to make the conversation more personal like google home, Seem to be as well in form compare to my Google, Cortana, and my Siri. Also like that it has interchangeable covers. and with Amazon Tap Charger and Cradle can be use outside. Con: Mic sometime don't pickup as well as I would like, not sure why with 7 of them. But I believed it will continue to get better.

I absolutely love my echo. I loved it so much I got the dot right after buying this and was pretty unhappy with the sound quality of the dot so I will be buying another echo for multiple rooms of my house. This product is incredible and 100% worth the price

We keep it in the kitchen area of our home and use it for playing music, getting weather updates and keeping a running shopping list that I can reference from the app when I’m at the store. It’s so convenient for anyone in the family to add things to the list and have it updated at all times.

The only thing I don't like is that the 2nd Gen doesn't come with a volume control ring but with buttons instead. It was a gift for my Mom, and she doesn't mind the buttons (you can also control volume with voice)

I had the first generation echo dot and loved it but this echo is so much better! I had to connect my dot to another Bluetooth speaker for better sound quality... that was a pain. But this echo has incredible sound, looks stylish, works great and I love that Alexa now has the drop in feature. (It May have had drop in before and I never noticed it, regardless, it’s awesome).

I love this speaker and Alexa. I use it for all things; reminders, alarms, timers, playing music, news and weather updates and answering all my cooking questions. Personally, I think the sound quality is quite good. I'm just sorry I waited so long to purchase. I couldn't be happier. Next, the gadgets to make my home SMART!

We LOVE our new Echo - so much entertainment for so little money. So easy to use that our 2-1/2 year old daughter is able to ask Alexa to play her favorite songs from Frozen, Moana, and Lion King ! All the features haven't even been explored yet as enjoy learning what Alexa is able to do. The shopping list feature is super handy to use as well. Even the dogs get to enjoy endless, commercial free loop of smooth jazz music while we are away from the house. Looking forward to using the Echo in our new home we are building, with plans to install Bluetooth capable speakers throughout so we can have unlimited entertainment - the fact that she can play different music in different areas simultaneously is amazing ! The best purchase we have made in Years.

i love my echo .... i got it to play music and so far i have set timers for cooking which is helpful .... there are so many things i havent used it for yet but the possibilities are all there and i am sure with time i will use it much much more ... love it

Good sound, a bit stodgy when it comes to some recognition of pronunciations, a great addition for simple conversion in recipes, would like it if the traffic skills were more comprehensive. It only allows for one route to be set, really not that useful as there are frequently multiple destinations that would be helpful to be checked on. Make those improvements and the rating would easily be a 5.

Getting EXACTLY what I'm trying to get is a bit frustrating sometimes. Use mainly as ambient noise at night. However, have cranked it up for some hard rock and the sound is VERY impressive. For the most part, I have to figure out what I can use it for. Get a little agravated over songs that aren't available with Prime. Shouldn't have to pay more to whole library.

We have an echo dot one and though useful for checking time listening to music and checking temperature outside the speaker just wasn't loud enough. So naturally we bought this because it was on sale for black Friday and we love it.

I love this new toy! I did not buy it for personal use, but for my business to help with finding information quicker. It still needs fine tuning to find local addresses, but its sound is unbelievable and the Alexa software is easy to use! Please buy you will love it!

Got this for my mom for Christmas. I should say, I got this for everyone for Christmas. My family loved it, they asked questions for hours and made it play music. We laughed, and had a good time. It's definitely scary to have something in your house. Which is why unplugging it is a nice option when you don't want something listening to you ;)

Alexa is such fun. I received this as a birthday gift from my kids. I'm still learning how to utilize Echo more and more. It is very clever, and very easy to set up and use. I highly recommend Alexa -- even when you think you would never use her -- you do.

Great to be able to set-up with my mom's smart phone so she can verbally make calls to her friends and adjust the volume vocally so she can hear them. My mother has RA and had a stroke so her hands are almost useless. So this gives her more freedom and lets her be less isolated from friends who are a good long drive away.

Just received our Echo and am very satisfied. The sound is great, very full and with nice bass, definitely loud enough for a living room. We tried a Dot last year and had to connect it to a blue tooth speaker, ended up returning it. This one is a keeper.

Awesome gadget that everyone will love. It has descent speaker. You can ask Alexa anything & she will answer you. Find out the weather, play music. It can connect to my fire TV. Of course it has it's limitations. If she doesn't know what you are asking her, she will say, "sorry, I don't know that.." It's like having a personal assistant at home.

My son and I fight over Alexa. The only con is the lower volume button doesnt seem to work and sometimes Alexa doesnt adjust the volume when we ask her to. Thats the only reason i am only giving it 4 stars. We wouldnt let you take Alexa from our home if you tried. We bought a "used" one that was $25-30 cheaper than a new one. The only thing I can imagine is someone bought it and changed their mind and sent it back. It looked brand new to me.

I love my original echo and I had high hopes for this product. I ordered it on the day it was released! Unfortunately, the sound quality is not nearly as good as it's predecessor. I wish I had spent the extra $50 and bought another original.

Bought two, one for the bedroom and one for the living room. The sounds is great for the bedroom, OK for the living room but not great. The biggest problem I have with them is it seams that it does hear the activation word as well as the smaller echos of which I have three. We are always saying the name twice because there is no response on the first try.

Seems like it gets stuck easily and doesn’t respond to some of the “skills” correctly. Not fond of Alexa repeating a song or title when I ask for a song to play. Sometimes I ask late at night and it’s annoying to hear the title repeated. Fun to ask Trivia. Would be nice to be able to customize the name, instead of using Alexa. Might be dangerous

Instructions on how to set things up so Alexa will recognized could be better but I had a friend help who had one. After that......this is cool. Still learning things that Alexa can do. Also bought smart plugs and echo dots! Alexa recognized smart plug instantly and I'm waiting on dots!

When our new Alexa wasn’t as response as the first generation one and seemed a bit more buggy. We called it the slow Alexa but the initial humor has passed and now we’re just frustrated with this generation of Alexa. Frequently I’ll have to say Alexa 2-3 times, despite sitting directly in front of the unit. When it does respond it will often go into listening mode and then immediately go back to playing music. I liked the first generation Echo and was so excited for this model that I ordered it a month early and talked about it to anyone who would listen. Now I am disappointed I didn’t keep the packaging because I doubt that I will end up keeping it.

Pretty scary product, I don't understand why it "talk" to me everytime I watch Youtube video.The problem is that Amazon echo is to sensitive to the word 'Alexa'. After I switch the trigger to 'echo' it works just fine. However it then become a lot harder to wake up. Amazon LLC . please don't send my voice records to my friend.

I like the speaker and I love the functionality but I bought it because I thought I would be able to do more with it and I can my Sonos with echo built-in however I think it’s a little cumbersome to use and not that easy for more sophisticated tasks other than streaming music. Still good product with decent sound and I do like simply giving a voice command for streaming a song

This is a fantastic smart speaker. The sound is great and it easily picks up your voice. I have also had experience with the google home and I can say without a doubt that the echo performs better than the google home atleast in my personal opinion. Also l, if you plan to get into the smart home game a little more with smart bulbs, plugs, etc I would suggest just buying the echo plus since you will have to a hub anyways. It will probably have save you money in the long run.

Alexa started out great. Now when I ask it to tell me the news I get ads for online gaming. If I wanted that then I would search for it. I have not been able to get it to stop. Quite annoying. Almost to the point of returning Alexa.

I went for the "buy 2 get a third for $50" deal. Two of them have similar MAC addresses (FC:A1:83:*) and work great! The third has a very different MAC address (6C:56:97:*) and has to be unplugged to reset at least once a day, or it says it's having trouble understanding. I thought it might be a wall blocking the wifi, so I swapped it with the office one that wasn't having problems, and the problem followed. I'm assuming it's a refurb or something. Rather disappointing...

Love all the features this thing includes. The only down side to having multiple devices is unless you either purchase the family plan for amazon music unlimited or enable other music streaming apps for the alexa it will not play different music on each individual echo. Other than that it works great with the drop in feature, calling, texting, shopping list, music, weather, news and the list just goes on. Good job on the device amazon

I didn’t think I wanted or needed one. It was a gift. It’s the best invention since the DVR!! I just ask for weather. I’m able to listen to any kind of music by asking an artist or jazz, etc. I travel and can turn on my lights at different times I also received 2 Phillips Hue smart bulbs which are already paired for Amazon! I use to google to look things up Anything ! And you have an answer. She always understands me. Not like Siri. It’s amazing

We have 3 echoes, 2 dots, and 1 plus around our house. Not only do we utilize the smart home functions, most are grouped for listening to music. This provides full, rich sound to large spacious areas. Alexa has an increasing list of skills that are interesting and fun. We like Jeopardy!, word and question of the day, and reminder functions. They are very commonly used as simple timers too. We have had our echoes for about 4 months, and we are still finding new and exciting ways to use our echoes.

Love learning all the ways Echo has made simple ordinary tasks even easier. Echo was easy to set up and is very user friendly. I wanted it thinking it would be most helpful to my physically disabled husband and to my surprise it has been just as useful to me. Timers, alarms, weather, music reminders, calendar keeper, we are still discovering new uses. Best Christmas gift to ourselves!

I love the 2nd Gen Echo. Speakers get super loud and the commands it can do are endless. Just like any AI it does require setup, time and making sure things are configured properly. Once that's done Alexa works amazing. It even knows a Spinal Tap reference - Say "Alexa turn the volume to 11" and it will go as loud as it can go :)

Amazon Echo (2nd Generation) can call your phone contacts, set alarms, tell you reminders, give you news updates, etc. All the stuff is great but the main reason I purchased this product is to listen to music. I am subscribed to Amazon Music and sometimes it can't find certain songs, if you ask it to play a song, it will only play that one and that's it. I wish it functioned more like the YouTube app. Other than that its great, but that is why I rate it 3 stars.

Quality of sound goes significantly down as volume goes up. When using as speaker phone for phone calls, friends on the other line stated there was static and an “echo.” ( no pun intended). I returned to the item. I was told by customer service the item must have had a defect as this was not normally experienced by Echo users. I’ve since purchased another Echo 2nd generation device and once it arrives my rating may or may not change.

I LOVE this list creator. It's helped me tremendously keeping up with what I need to pick up when I'm shopping. I've created different lists for the different types of shopping we do regularly. It isn't able to answer all questions, hence she gets a 4 rating rather than 5. We use it to help spell a tough word, find out the weather, get business phone numbers and, although it's not consistent, find out what new movies are coming out, to name a few. I'm still learning more about how to use it, but I find it very useful and fun to use

I like the Alexa options. She helps u connect to Spotify, call, text, etc. I absolutely hate that it only works when plugged into a power source making it unportable!! I didn’t realize this when I purchased it. So for that reasons I’m thinking of returning it. Yeah, yeah I read already for ANOTHER $50-$60 I can buy a battery for it but that’s BS in my book. I also dislike that I can’t play my music from my iTunes from my phone on this. Apparently there is some way from my PC to do this but not many use there PC and use their smartphones and iPads for music storage so how is this very smart compatible???

We really like Alexa. She will even respond to my 3 year old who doesn't always speak super clearly. She even yelled out to Alexa for help in Target. My parents liked it too, but they would be better suited for the Echo Silver addition...

We have 3 Echo Dot's and 2 of the Echo 2nd generation unit's in our home, while the echo dot's are nice to have and very handy they do not have the sound quality that the Echo 2nd generation does. We really enjoy listening to our Amazon music on the Echo 2nd generation units

We now have smart light bulbs, smart outlets, etc. We use Alexa a lot now (shopping list, games, etc). Ordered this newer model for the master bedroom. Now I want a few more of the newer models for around the house! Nice units, SUPER handy. Will likely buy at least one more.

Alexa is okay but a nightmare to connect and set up and always drops in connection. When it works, it's amazing breaks more than actually work. Get yourself a google home, more skills that don't pertain to only Amazon and you dont have to install nothing, but can do actual searches on google browser.

I never write reviews and I consider myself a pretty heavy Prime user. In my book, Amazon usually knocks it out of the park with their products but I am really not sure they got it all together with this Gen 2 Echo. We love our Gen 1 and decided on picking up another and went and preordered the Gen 2. When it arrived it was good looking from an esthetic standpoint but I immediately noticed a different sound in comparison to the Gen 1. I was compelled to run to the Gen 1 and play a song and then tried the same song on the Gen 2 and it just didn’t feel as crisp and sharp as the Gen 1 does. I don’t want to be too critical because it does sound good but not if your comparing it to the Gen 1. I don’t know- maybe it needs tweaking or maybe I should just return it. I’m torn.

Alexa is so convenient to set a timer, play any genre of music (with voice-activated control) for louder or softer, ask what the weather is and will be all day and so so much more. You can sing a line or two from a song and she recognizes it and plays it! We learn more and more about it each day, and it helps so much when you’re in a hurry. We ask her to summarize the important news of the day each morning while having coffee and a quick breakfast. Her skills are endless, and an extra feature is getting emails from Amazon adding even more features. This is the best there will ever be on the market!

I received one as a gift and bought two more for other rooms. Didn't thing this would interest me, but it really is convenient, when I need a quick answer to something or want to listen to music. The speaker is great. I have even used it to listen to soothing sleep sounds! I plan to learn more about all the features I can use.

This is my 6th Echo device,1-Dot, 1-Tap,2-1st edition and 2-2nd edition. I'm running out of rooms. LOL I'm very pleased with this purchase. The sound quality is superb and I really like that it's smaller in stature.

I love this device already! It’s hands free entertainment and information, all you have to do is ask. It’s wonderfully pair with your prime account to bring all kinds of music. I like that the volume can be adjusted by button or voice. The Echo is stylish and can be changed with additional sleeves. Great for my small trailer, can hear in every room.
i have both 1st (tall) and 2nd (short) echo. the 1st gen has way better sound. Maybe that is why 2nd gen is cheaper.

The five stars are for the Amazon customer service people having the patience to go the long and winding road that it took to figure out that I DID NOT have a "smart phone", I had a "feature phone" and would therefore not be able to set up the Echo with my current equipment. Never mind that my AT&T gateway has Wi-Fi printed on the front of the gateway...the light was not lit. (I have deliberately not kept up with new telephony over the years, so no surprise that this is the end result when I decide to make a tech purchase without asking my tech-expert son first!) So I never really experienced Echo and Alexa. I had to return the Echo, which Amazon made it easy to do. May try this again sometime if I am better equipped. ;)

This is a great product. You can not believe the sound that comes from this "Lady". Christmas carols are so wonderful. Audiobooks sound so much better. Not a thing wrong with this. This is my second one in this house. I have ordered 4 more for others and they are thrilled.

WE LOVE ALEXA! We use this to play music, to check the weather forecast, for TV programming times, to play games, and to organize family dance parties. She is so intuitive that my kids (3 &5) can boss her around. The only tiny problem occurs when we use this with our Echo dots in other rooms. Sometimes she has trouble responding when we stand in the room between the Echo & the Dot. Otherwise, we could not be more pleased with this purchase.

Out of the box the sound was awful, but it almost instantly started to download a firmware update. I had music running during the update and it reset... once I started the music again the difference in sound quality was night and day. Very happy with the echo and its new form factor and the price is excellent. Love the sandstone (light grey) fabric. Very happy!

I absolutely LOVE our Alexa~ I say I detect a bit of attitude and I love it!~ Personality or is it my imagination? Either way I love the fact that my Echo can give this disabled lady the weather forecast and so much more with the apps we can download~! Thank you Amazon~ We Love Alexa~

Got one for xmas, downloaded app and went through start up process, showed it was connected to Wi-Fi and blue tooth. But she never would talk, blue ring spins when you ask questions, questions show up on I-phone app no volume, raised, lowered, muted, and un-muted nothing, Called help line at 1-866-316-6909 talked to tech explained issue was put on hold for 25 minutes then call was dropped, called this morning same thing talked to tech put on hold call dropped. Really!!!! it stressful enough it not working but no customer service???

Amazon Echo is amazing. I love music, and have it on all the time. Amazon Music has a wide variety of playlists, and I like a wide variety of genres. It is fun to have the weather forecast always available, and I am looking forward to doing my Amazon shopping by voice rather than keyboard. The tutorial emails are very helpful.

Not very smart. Integration with fire tv is awful and just plain useless. It can’t start understand things like “open Netflix” it can only find the Netflix app. Furthermore integraron with multiple echo devices is also a pain. You can play music in multiple devices ( a pain to setup, it should be plug and play). But then you can’t tell Alexa to stop playing in only one device, it’s all or nothing. Simple put, echo is good at turning your lights on or off. That’s about it, anything else it’s dumb as brick.

Sound quality beats the previous generation and I like the more compact design. I'd rather the device was larger and had a better speaker. These work great for listening to music and the ability to set them all up as throught-the-home speakers is amazing if they just sounded better.

I got this for my wife for music streaming, thinking we'd have it unplugged most of the time when not actively in use. Didn't work out that way. It's on all the time for random dumb questions or for a quick check of the weather or to set a cooking timer or for a dictionary question or ... I'm surprised that we like it so much. We bought an Echo and a Dot as part of a package deal, and might buy another Echo for the office.

I am thoroughly enjoying my Ecoo! Love to have it read my audiobook to me while in the office and then I can simply open the audiobook on my kindle to continue it when elsewhere. Wonderful for listening to music when not in the mood for a book. Great for setting reminders for myself too and so much more.

Wonderful and loud sound. Echo's in general are great for home automation which I'm using with Philips Hue stuff. Alexa for the most part is great, but still some things she doesn't know how to answer. I have a Google Home Mini, which complements this well. Awesome purchase when Echo was on sale for $79, which I also got a Dot at the same time.

I love my echo. The sound quality and aesthetic value are extremely pleasing. I often pair to my Bose speakers when I'm working or meandering around the house. When Alexa wakes me up I get my briefings for the day, then I'm ready to start my day. I haven't tapped into Alexa capabilities, but I love not having to press buttons...I just ask and she usually delivers.

The echo performs as specified. I’m enjoying listening to music whenever the mood strikes me using Amazon music. I’m also starting to introduce smart technology into my home. I started with a smart plug and a smart bulb. Both perform well. Despite my intitial concern that my wireless signal would not travel the length of my house... it does. The one shortcoming that I note is though Echo is used for smart home technology. It does not have dusk to dawn capability for lights. You must specify what time you want the light to come on and go off. As the seasons change you must manually reset the on and off times. All in all echo performs as expected.

Getting this device on the network is a tedious affair that requires joining via an app on your phone. Lots of steps to add any smart home device. Pretty dumb out of the box. Still have not succeeded in getting it to make a list. Can change channels on Hopper if you have Dish, but not much else. If you like tinkering around with things that sort of work and require lots of steps to do anything useful, you will love it.

I really like the Echo. I use it in our kitchen. We listen to music on this device all the time. I also get the weather report from Alexa every morning before leaving for work. We have begun using Alexa to control our two smart thermostats as well. I'm sure there are a multitude of things we can do with the Echo, so we are slowly learning those features.

We are so glad that we got the Echo over a Bluetooth speaker. Alexa does so much more stuff than other non smart speakers out there. I personally love the timer feature. It has helped me with cooking multiple things simultaneously. Pandora integration is another feature that I use daily. So happy with out Prime Day purchase. I will get the Echo hub and a few more Echo dots in the future.

I bought this Alexa as a Black Friday special and I really love it. I also purchased three smart plugs and a light switch to get started. Set up was easy and fast. I went back and purchased two dots as well so I could use Alexa in different areas of the house. I also have the Amazon Fire stick but have not been able to figure out how to combine the two. I have no issues with the sound quality and did not bother to hook up my Bose speaker to the device. Still have No regrets after using it for over a month.

I am so happy that music sounds great on this Echo. My husband has the little disc shaped Echo and I was disappointed listening to music. I changed the name from Alexa to Amazon because it was easier to remember. You need to use certain phrases when asking for something. The Amazon help staff answered my questions. I love listening to SiriusXM and Pandora.

We've found the 2nd Generation Echo to be really fun as well as useful. Every once in a while Alexa doesn't understand something we've said but it's not often. The email we get from Amazon about what to ask Alexa or recommendations for skills have been super useful as well. We would recommend the Echo 2 to anyone. It's been life changing for the lists we use.

The echo dot did better at hearing my commands. This one just tells me that it will do as asked "playing spotify" and then it wont play. It does this with several requests. It also disconnects often (while my dot doesn't) and it can't hear over my dishwasher (my dot can)

This will be a long review. First of all I'm not new to amazon echo. I have had one for 3 years. Well I decided to upgrade to 2nd generation echo. Hooked everything up. went into the Alexa app and linked my echo to my fire tv 2nd generation. Now everything worked except it would not launch my Netflix/ hulu for example. The funny thing is when i was watching a movie on netflix I could pause and resume movie with Alexa. It just wouldn't launch the app. was on the phone for 3 hours with techs. They came on transferring me to a fire tv tech. I new it was not my fire tv because I also have an echo dot. So I connected my echo dot with the same fire tv unlinked my echo and linked my echo dot. Everything worked perfectly. So it has to be my new echo with issues. They had me try everything but nothing worked. Even one tech said I just need to use the remote control. Reall??!!! I'm suppose to be able to control my fire tv hands free. Anyway I believe the echo is broke. So I will return. Very frustrated!!!

Got as a gift. Really nice. I hated that it wasn’t compatible with Apple Music but I found an app to transfer my playlists to Amazon Music. I use it solely for that. I don’t have a smart house let alone a TV. But its a great speaker and I like that I can tell it what to play. Would recommend for yourself or as a gift. I gave it four stars because it’s corded. Come On Amazon, Make It Wireless!

I received the Echo as a gift and I absolutely love it. I use it on daily basis. In the morning I simply say, "Alexa Good Morning" and Alexa will respond with my pre selected 'skills' (CNN news brief, local weather and the subreddit of the day). You can choose from 100s of skills and customize your Alexa however you'd like. For entertainment Alexa can play games like Jeopardy or 20 questions, as well as play music on command through Amazon Music, Spotify, ETC. I personally use Apple Music so I simply connect Alexa through bluetooth and play the music on my iPhone or MacBook, the one single speaker is enough to play music throughout my 2 bedroom home loud and clear. Alexa has 100s of skills and is been developed more and more weekly. I would highly recommend the Amazon Echo.

It is nice to be able to do things like play music and set a timer hands-free, especially in the kitchen. I just find it a bit limited compared to the google assistant on my phone. Alexa often gets band names or radio stations wrong and she has trouble answering some questions.

Love this have in the kitchen and am able to ask questions, hands free, as I am cooking about how to do things as well as what foods are safe for my dog. Also enjoy having the music right on my counter and being able to reduce/increase volume. I got the light color as I do not like things on mu counter so it blends in. I tucked in the corner near the coffee pot.
The functionality is really good, I have one in each bedroom to communicate if the kids are in their room doing something. I like all the features that come with it and the ease of use.

It has been a big hit in our house. We use it mostly to play music, and the fun part of it is how easy it is to play songs we haven't heard in years. The sound is very good, and responds to most of our commands. However, I was surprised when I asked it to play Dixieland jazz, and it no idea what I was asking for. Eventually, it tried to play some soft jazz, that clearly was not dixieland. Still, a lot of fun to have in the house.

Endless Features and the whole family loves to talk to Alexa. The Echo is the center of family gatherings when it comes to playing music and asking random questions through out the night and the audio quality has far improved from the Gen 1.

Sound quality is great! I LOVE Alexa! I’ve bought so many speakers in the past and she is by FAR my favorite. I’ve bought the echo plus and the echo 2nd generation. So very pleased. The priceless family moments we’ve had with her games, jokes and dancing, I feel like we’re living “Alexa” commercials. Thankful for a wonder product!!!☺️

While I own the original Echo and love it, I actually purchased these as gifts for out of state family members, so I don't have personal experience with this model. However, the feedback from the gift recipients is nothing less than stellar! Everyone loves everything about them, especially the sound quality. They're also having lots of fun learning and using all of Alexa's features. I think these were great gift choices which I know are being enjoyed! I'm sure they'll end up on my gift list again .... 😁

I was totally disappointed with this item. My son has the 1st generation one and in my opinion it is way better than the 2nd generation in terms of sound and looks. The claims were that the 2nd generation would have better sound....so not true, it is half the size and in my opinion offers half the sound quality. My husband and I did a side by side test...we played a paticuliar song on ours ( the 2nd generation) then played the song on my son's echo and his blew ours out of the water....if you are looking for style and the best sound quality, save yourself some money and purchase the 1st generation...we sent ours back for a refund...

Sound is good on this one but it has problems hearing you from across the room. The smaller dot could pick up speech must better. Don't waste your money, you have to scream at this one for it to do anything. It's supposed to be able to pick up your voice and commands even in a noisy room, this one doesnt...They need a software upgrade to fix this is something.

It looks great. It more or less does what my dot does. When I ask it to stop playing music it stops, then starts again for a second, then finally stops. My eco dot does not. Overall it doesn't meet my expectations because frankly it doesn't sound that great. I mostly got it to listen to music while in my kitchen. I would simply say the sound is disappointing and underwhelming. Wanted to love this. Just not loving it. I am running the second firmware as mentioned in other reviews. Debating a return....

Really enjoying it still figuring things out there are many useful skill and some really fun ones paired well with the dot and the hue lighting. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is that I see room for improvements doesn’t always recognize commands if there is loud background like a tv placement is import the more central the better had it in a corner did do well and if your playing music through it sometimes does hear commands but over all li am liking the echo and echo dot a lot looking forward to seeing what the future of this is going to be

Like everyone else I must agree the sound is lacking it does get loud but full range sound not close .. If you put against the corner of a room against the wall maybe it resonates for some bass but... why would. you take a step back and also advertise better sound it has almost same drivers from the gen 1 version ..? I am hoping this gets fixed from so many poor reviews of this speaker... I also sold mine and my tap that by the way does sound less then gen 2 echo so i guess good job on that..?... Aaaaahhhhhh... S99... COME ON GUY...

Amazing sound, still learn something new every day! I ordered a day late so I didn't get the amazing deal that ended on December 31st, but I'm still very pleased with the product. Was able to tell me how long it takes to get a perfectly hard-boiled egg and then set a timer for me to ensure that perfection! Actually keeps me company and makes me chuckle at times. Well worth it!

I was introduced to Echo [Alexa] by a friend who raved about her. I now know what all the buzz is. This device is all that it's cracked up to be. I'm just getting to know her and her capabilities and enjoying every new thing that comes my way. Fantastic!!!

Great product. Love everything it can do and how it integrates with Fire TV, Amazon Music, and Audible. Would have given a 5 if local business search was reliable. Google Home is light years ahead in this area.

It doesn't recognize my commands well. Takes 3 times and I have to end up yelling which is counter productive to having a convenient voice activated device. Software needs upgrades and you should be able to name it something else. I could go on and on.. Its a novel gimmick.. Not a technological breakthrough.. You have to realize it before you buy it.

I bought these as gifts for Christmas but ended up taking one for myself. I do not know why someone would need to use a hub as this system seems to be usable with other devices. I especially enjoy telling it to play music, different music types, different singers and well, I have not yet discovered all that it is capable of doing. Easy to setup and use.

ProsVery good speaker quality and I love the way this links to Amazon. Cons are that I bought it for my father to have the ability to order things he needs but he stutters and Alexa doesn't wait for him to finish He did much better with the Google assistant. Also, Alexa doesn't know much. We get more answers from the web with Google.

I have both the first and second generation of the Echo. I believe the sound quality of G-1 is better than G-2, although this is subjective. Also, I like the ability to decrease or increase the volume on G-1 (by rotating the top of the unit) better than G-2 (by pushing the + or - buttons). Both units serve their function, which is primarily to play news & music. Both units are simple and straightforward to set up.

plays wonderfully. My mother bought one from fingerhut that she can't seem to get running. However this was extremely easy to get off the ground. The volume is perfect as is the range. It effort moves from one task to another, is comely accurate in weather, news and the like. I absolutely love my echo 2. So does my mother which plans to buy one from Amazon don she can use it as well.

OMG we have several of the echo dots but the sound quality this little unit is well worth the price! I purchased this when it was on sale during Christmas and have placed it in the kitchen where I spend much of my time and I love music! I love this little speaker! The sound is amazing! Volume 4 on this Echo is equal to Volume 10 on the echo dot.

I found the quality of the sound/volume to be exceptional and I'm picky when it comes to music. Makes me laugh when I think that back in the 70s I had a $1000 sound system, the lightest tracking turntable and clean each surface of the record before playing and NEVER stacked. Now I just say "Alexa play...." For the times they are a changing...

Fairly powerful speakers that can easily fill any room. Setup was a breeze. The biggest gripe I have is the simple fact that the Echo does not interface with my amazon fire stick. Sure, the fire stick can connect to the echo via Bluetooth but only provides audio/speaker capability. It does not allow for voice commands. Definite oversight by amazon in my opinion.

The directions for this sophisticated and complicated device are abominable. But, the real issue is why. The Echo at this price should be self-starting and able to connect to any WIFI automatically. I would urge people who are not nerds and computer gurus to avoid this product. Amazon's tech team should be ashamed of itself.

There was life before Alexa and life after Alexa. I use Alexa for music, the weather, and for the sleep sounds. Having a small baby and working Alexa by voice controls when your hands are tied up rocking a cranky baby to sleep or changing a diaper is essential!

Sound is much better; other than that it is not much different than the original Echo. Placed the original Echo in our bedroom, placed the Echo Dot which was in the bedroom in the office and placed the Echo (2nd Generation) in the living room. We are very satisfied with our purchase.

Great product, was leery about getting one with all the negative reviews but the bugs are fixed. I can’t hear my 1st generation dot play music while I’m in the shower or having other stuff on well bec it’s so underpowered (not so stylish either) so I pulled the trigger and got a second gen echo and I am very impressed. The sound bugs everyone is complaining about are not there once it updates and reboots itself upon set up. The sound quality is MUCH better than the 1st gen dot however a little less than the echo. I own 1 first gen dot and two echos and this has 50% increased in volume from the original little echo and is a legitimate music player. It is a little less basey and clear than the 1st gen original echo in side by side comparison but not too noticeable where it’d really matter because it’s still half the price and looks waaaay better. That’s the second best thing is the style really is something that looks premium and high quality and blends into any space. With the selection of colors it’s a great option for any room or environment and fits better than the 1st gen dot or echo and isn’t an eye sore. I’m definitely buying another soon for $79 that’s a great deal and the performance it gives in comparison to the echo is worth the price especially with how much more eye friendly and stylish it is. Pros: 1) Price, 2) Far louder and better sound than 1st gen dot 3) Sound quality is great, bugs are fixed 4) very stylish and looks great Cons: 1) little less crisp, clear and basey than the original echo Opinion: this is a great investment. It’s waaay better than the original dot. It’s a legitimate speaker and great for bedroom or living room, especially in an apartment or smaller room it will fill it up. However, I’d invest in an echo or even better, a designated speaker designed for music if your looking something exclusively for music for a larger space or for those who want a premium quality for listening as bose/other brands have better sound playing devices for $100 price range and then just use the dot/echo for your lights, information and commands.

Sound is good, I think people give it a bad rap and expect the sould to be like a pair of Bose speakers. The one issue I found is with the Microphone, when I use the calling feature people are complain I do not sound clear and I have no issues with my dot and other echo. Even tried moving it to a new room.

I really like the device. It keeps me entertained and I hope it will become more useful in the future as I integrate a smart home system. So far it has done a lot in answering questions, I just think it should pull its information from a different source than Wikipedia (It not the most reliable source)..

Great smart speaker. My only complaint is that Alexa occasionally can’t access the network and asks me to try again later. I have her connected to wireless over ATT Gigabit, so it’s kind of weird. I’ve found that leaving the Echo plugged in ameliorates the problem. Turning the speaker off seems to make it have network issues when I reboot.

Great upgrade from gen 1! Love the sound quality! If you are a true audiophile this is not a product for you, but this should be obvious as it is a tube style speaker system. Therefore, if someone knocks off stars for sound quality I would discount his/her review. I’ve placed mine in a corner that allows the sound to reflect and give it a larger sound.

I picked this up on whim while it was on sale one day, and I am glad I did. Not only do I play pretty much any song I want on it, but she reminds me of things and keeps my shopping list handy. I have not even begun to discover the many things Alexa will do. I would recommend this device to anyone.

Love the heather gray fabric wrapped Alexa. Looks simple and elegant. Easy to setup and start using Alexa to control some of my smart home equipment, such as the light bulbs, smart lock, Ring door bell and the Nest thermostat. Alexa is very responsive and definitely recommend for the smart home. :)

Along with the Sonos 1, I own an Amazon Echo. I was really surprised and impressed with the sound quality of the Echo, but I wanted to add additional Alexa capabilities to multiple rooms, thus assumed the Sonos would be an upgrade. Unfortunately, the sound differential doesn't justify the additional cost of the Sonos. I'm about best bang for buck...the Echo's sound performance is just a notch under the Sonos, and for $85, the Echo is much easier on the wallet.

I’m very frustrated with this product. We have a Google Mini we got as a gift but always wanted Alexa because of our Fire TV. There is no comparison between it and this. It is extremely difficult to use, does not work half the time, and will not connect with our Fire TV, which was the main reason we got it. Google has amazon beat by a long shot on this one.

Disappointed after waiting for release. The jack to my exterior speakers (which works perfectly on my Echo Dot) does not work. Very little room for speaker jack from speakers and it wouldn't go in straight. Having to use speakers because sound output from new gen2 echo isnt great. Between this new realease that touts better sound and the new Fire TV upgrade, which is just a fancier Fire TV STICK, not a true upgard of the Fire TV, I feel amazon is shortchanging us...I believed both new releases would be better but they are not. Get with it Amazon, we are smart and demanding customers.

It took a while to figure out how to get it connected, but once I did, it is simple to use. I listen to prime music, get the weather, ask for recipes. She pauses the music for me with a simple request (or turns it down). I am still learning all the things she can do. I love her.

Works beautifully and really excellent sound. I'm just beginning to learn all of capabilities. I start off each morning asking Alexa to play whatever music I'm in the mood for - Broadway, rock, Christmas, Sinatra. She has it all, plus the weather report! And she never complains.

My husband and I purchased this for our medically fragile daughter. She LOVES music and this has been an AMAZING asset to assist her stimulation and focus.
