Her nurses have become fans of the Echo too; broadening her experiences to different music genres, just by the sound of our voice. THANK YOU Alexa. ;)

Love Alexa! I have one and this one was a gift. You will get answers to questions, a joke of the day, the weather and she will play your favorite songs, just to name a few things she will do. Easy to set up. I would be lost without her! Very highly recommend!

I purchased this for my mother who is having knee problems now, to give her something to do while trying to over come not getting around so fast like she did. She enjoys all the little and big things it can do...Alexa play this song, What time is it and where, and how to cook this and that!

Absolutely love this! Helpful for everyday things to do, information seeking, understanding the traffic situation, shuffling music, or seeking movies on my fire stick. I’m getting the Dot for my bedroom.

The Echo 2nd Generation is great, the sound is excellent and the capabilities are amazing! It was fairly easy to set up and I used it right away to listen to a variety of music and to play games. I also bought the Alexa Guide Book as a quick, helpful reference.

I confess to not hearing an improvement in sound. I'm sure the tech is better - and I like the device. And it sounds the same as my echo tap. I'm also a little grumpy that this will "link" with my Dot, and not the Tap.

I had no dislikes, I used Alexa so far for multiple things, my shopping list very useful cause it goes right to my phone, I work in retail and told some customers who had forgotten what they wanted they should invest in Alexa (Echo & Dot) AI also use her for music,dropping in on my Nana Babies (grandchildren) Who live on the other side of town, weather, news, music and much more. Very easy to connect. Enjoy

I love this, works great. You do have to do a bit of set up on some tasks but I didnt mind as it is very helpful. Im still testing out & learning all the things she can do, but so far i am loving it. My alarm company i saw pairs with Alexa so that is a super plus to not have to do anything but tell her to turn my thermostat up & down, lock my doors,set my alarm. I love the music feature. Its like having all my music right on hand with no storage.

Trying to get this thing hooked up to the Internet is virtually impossible if you have anything else working on the same modem. It just does not stay connected. Is difficult to hook up. The instructions don't cover the Situation's.

We originally had the Echo Dot, and upgrading to this has been a dream. The new speaker/sound from this is crisp and great. HUGE improvement from the dot and we love it in our home. Also it's a great compact size.

I absolutely love my Echo. It is now my fav electronic. I use it everyday. Her answers to silly questions amaze me. I love the fact that she does exactly what I say like play this or skip that or what's the weather in this state. Very high tech and doing quality is better than the Beats brand (just my personal opinion)

I have the original 2nd generation, not the new one. I’ve had good success with the built-in zigbee hub so far with Hue lightbulbs and GE switches. Wish it had built-in z-wave capability. I wonder if this older Gen 2 will be able to use the zigbee control without WiFi in the future, like the new model?

Everybody needs an Alexa. No questions about it. This is awesome. I am late to the game, but better late then sorry. I love using this as my bluetooth speaker and playing my spotify. Let's mee know my calendar. It's just awesome. You need one for every level in the house and the garage.

This was easy to set up and use. It is very useful for quick access to information. Playing Jeopardy! is fun. It is not as conversational or personal as Google Home. Its more 'just the facts'. Voice recognition is good but a couple items got by. Asked it how long to decant red wine and it didn't have anything. It didn't recognize 'decant'. Google Home did and suggested 30 minutes to one hour.

This is not returnable, bought it in October as a gift, the other news is that if you don't buy Amazon Prime (a monthly fee of $13.00 a month, the gift that keeps on charging) So yes, we are out $99.99 what we were charged that is pretty much unusable...no music unless we pay.

We have found this speaker to be occupying a major space in our life. We depend on it for music, maintains shopping lists and many other things. She is always good for a laugh when you are interfacing with her. Originally thought we would not use it, but surprise, surprise; we love her and now have 2 of them to keep us company. Can’t go wrong!!!

Overall I really like the Echo, it does have some glitches that I was not happy about. One of them being the difficulty in setting it up at other locations. We wanted to show our friends our "cool new toy" however after an hour of trying to get it to connect to another wifi with no luck we gave up. That was disappointing. I also dislike that it has to be plugged in to use it. Other than that it has a nice sound and the kids have enjoyed asking Alexa many many questions!
app on i Phone does not work, cannot delete it, information on amazon does nothing....frustrated

This new device builds upon the original Echo. It's physically smaller, potentially better looking, and "hears" as well or better than the original. However, the sound output and quality falls below the original. Using this an a music player at all but low volume is no substitute for a larger dedicated speaker.

We love it! Even the youngest member of the household has fun interacting with Alexa, having her play his favorite songs and tell him jokes! The only thing I don’t like is the lack of privacy. But, at least I can turn off the microphone and feel like I have a little sliver of privacy left in this world, lol!

I love the echo...the form and the functionality of this product and the simplicity of the operation is wonderful. I had the echo dot this was for Me was a step up with the unique color way and the increase volume due to the bigger build and breeze to operate.....I can’t wait to pair other with other smart devices through out my home so I take advantage of the excellent command features .......I’m so excited!!! Love this product

My dad just turned 74 and we got this for his birthday. He's absolutely in love. He loves that he can get radio stations from all over the country and listen to the people he likes to listen to. He said the sound on it is very clear. So when it comes to giving birthday presents, I guess you could say we nailed it.

We have had it about a week and are not used to it yet. Potential is there. Have one light connected, which we like. Not interested in the thermostat and other devices because they are too expensive. We need to learn more about her capabilities to use it completely.

I procrastinated for a long time on this purchase-wish I would have gotten it sooner-love love love it! The sound on it is so good that the office next door says they can hear it even when the volume is almost all the way down! Great size and great sound.
I like this more than I thought. I don't really need it, but it's fun and it keeps the old lady here, mentally active trying to remember the commands for skills. LOL.

So much fun! I use the Echo and Dot for to do lists, timers, music, ask stupid stuff!! I think the to do lists are the best. Bought a dot for my office and use it for my work to do list constantly. Alexa does a great job of recognizing my voice and getting the commands correct. The sound out of the Echo is great for music. Fun device and a must have!!

Very disappointed in the Echo2. If I played a game or went on FB, on my iphone6, it would cause the device to either activate or (interrupt if playing music.) If I was viewing a video on my iPhone the video would actually start to play on the Echo2. Too many quarks for me! I would appreciate if you did not withdraw $8.50 from my refund for the return of the Echo2. Sincerely Debra Keffer

I am impressed with this 2nd generation echo. I have an original echo, and to me, it sounds just as good. I do wish the echo app was a little more intuitive and robust, but that is a different review! I think this new echo is a great choice!

Sound quality is good for a small speaker. Nice a digital hub for the house. I have my Anova sous vide machine linked to it so I can know what it’s doing from anywhere. Alexa is good for weather, timers & news. However, she’s not so good with simple questions. You may as for a history topic, and she will reply with a playlist from amazon music...

I have two dots and a Tap; I like this one very much because it hears me better that my tap (I like the Tap because it is chargeable and I can take it to work, which is really nice). I can use a normal speaking voice and most of the time it responds, speakers are good. I do like how it looks (got the grey one).

Interesting observation: If you own an Amazon Alexa/Echo/"Computer" (that's what I call mine) , say "tell me about MSNBC". Then say, "tell me about Fox News." Notice a difference? "Computer" too often says "I don't know that one". Hopefully it'll get smarter soon.

I love that Alexa will tell me the weather, set an alarm, turn off the light...but I do not like her choice of music. When I ask for certain types of music...I don't feel like that is what she plays. I am just learning so I am sure there is MUCH more that she can do!

I use it in place of a clock radio. No dials to turn and limitless music choices. Can get weather and time on demand without unneeded chatter. Huge information source. Plays soothing music and sounds that help sleep. Amazon emails update users on new Alexa skills. Sound not as good as Sonos but very acceptable. Very happy with purchase.
I received Eco on March 6 th, about 10 days ago, I have spent ours n the phone with Amazon customer support to no avail, the product doesn't work. and they can't figure out why.

Incredible device for the money. I have purchased several of these (4) and highly recommend them to anyone that likes a useful AI tool in their house. Listening via the MIC doesn't bother me as the advantages outweigh whatever conspiracy people are out there. I would say this rivals the invention of the smart-phone.

Alexa is such a help with her alarm, to do list, playing music, flash briefings. I learn new things to do with her all the time. The sound quality is very good. I listen to music in my shop and it's perfect. Love the 'drop in' feature, etc.

This is our 3rd purchase. We got this one for our covered patio. Our family is a huge fan of alexa. We mostly listen to music and the speakers sound very decent. The reminders are consistent and reliable so I use it to remind me pretty much anything I can.
Easy to set up, connected to my existing stereo receiver (bluetooth) ... I use more of the features than I expected.

There are some things - reasonable things - it can't do, but that list is short. It gets confused when you ask how many reminders it will accommodate. I use it all the time for reminders, and it's wonderful. You can even set reminders for other days at certain times. And the reminders can appear on your phone!

Turned out my Alexa was not connected to my acct somehow. They saw my comment and called me to help me fixing it right away. That's what I call a GREAT customer service!! (B4) Couldn't connect to smart home device. Tried 2 different brands. Alexa just couldn't connect. Useless!

The sound is so-so when playing music. Otherwise, the Echo is used in our home, more or less, as a toy. It is handy for a weather report, but that's about it for "practical" functions for us. It has trouble connecting to the Fire Stick and has successfully only once in multiple attempts. I think it worked after a Fire Stick "reset, but only that one time.

Love Alexa... Stop asking you do not pay for a service, buy Alexa and do everything we use grocery list across family, play music from music unlimited which cost $4 and you will never find a song she can't play. But she will play music with music unlimited. We have three of these and use as an intercom system which those cost a lot.

I so love my Evho.. Alexa is wonderful... we had a power outage last week and it affected Alexa and I could not connect to WiFi.. I called Amazon and talked to two amazing young men who arrived at the conclusion that she needed to be either fixed or exchanged... Gotta appreciate the customer service at Amazon!

2018-MAR-29 Revision Revision - lost my internet before finished. YOU CAN, on the ALEXA APP, delete history, but; you must enter each device, and then each recording, and delete them ONE BY ONE. This is SLOW and very CUMBERSOME. At the least, I should be able, to select a SINGLE DEVICE and SELECT DELETE ALL. This is NOT an option on the ALEXA APP. I have 5-devices that RECORD. So consider if I have 5-devices, and each device has 10-to-15-different recordings, that means I have to hit "DELETE" 50-to-75-times before I have DELETED all of my so-called HISTORY! If I could do it at the DEVICE level, I would only have to do it 5-times. Seriously, deleting recordings is a very difficult thing. And, I am very annoyed at the BIG GLARING RED CIRCLE on top of each ECHO, when I MUTE the microphones! It really should GLOW RED for perhaps 1-minute, then; VERY SLOWLY, BLINK RED - where by - it is OFF for 5-seconds, then slow FLASH red for 2-seconds, then 5-seconds off, then 2-seconds on. Or something like that. NOT that UGLY --CONSTANT-- RED RING on top when ever the microphones are OFF. Seriously. guys? 2018-MAR-29 Follow on - REVISED. I still have an ISSUE - but - I MUST revise my statement. According to AMAZON, it does not record unless Alexa hears her wake word, and; then you are only going to be recorded for what "she" must hear, in order to respond properly to your request. THAT is what Amazon says will happen. BUT, It also says you can DELETE the recordings via the ALEXA APP. That is NOT TRUE. I have the ALEXA APP on my SAMSUNG phone, and; there is absolutely NO WAY TO DELETE RECORDINGs from that device. It is NOT supported there. Moreover, as it appears that I can only delete recordings from my laptop, there is still NO FEEDBACK that when I ask for my recordings to be deleted, that they are actually DELETED. As I stated before, it says a "request is acknowledged" but not actually "done". And it SAYS that if you push the microphone button, that it shuts off the microphones on the device. I am dubious if this is true, and; it is really ANNOYING that it shines RED when you do this. Why not shine RED for a Moment, then BLINK VERY SLOW RED, until you turn it on again? If I want to leave it OFF, for hours, or even DAYS - I don't want to therefore WASTE the light - or over time burn the LED out. Still, when I first reviewed my recordings here, there were several instances where stuff I did NOT want RECORDED was actually recorded. And a LOT of crap from my TV, where Alexa responded to the TV that was playing, and recorded useless stuff from there. So, I apologize to AMAZON for my outburst saying they are recording us, they are, but "NOT SO MUCH" as I believed. I am still in doubt, and dubious about DELETE. Why can I NOT simply say, "Alexa - delete my recordings."??? ******** Okay, I have a serious ISSUE with the ALEXA interface. I just learned, that ALEXA and my ECHO devices, are, according to AMAZON, "Constantly Listening". Okay, I get it. It has to "Listen" to know when you are ASKING it to do things for you. Fine. BUT, did you also know it is CONSTANTLY RECORDING? That's right. It is not MERELY LISTENING. It is also CONSTANTLY RECORDING EVERYTHING that is making SOUND in your HOME! AND, the ONLY WAY TO DELETE THOSE RECORDINGS, is to LOGIN TO AMAZON, via a LAPTOP, and MANAGE those recordings. WORSE, even when you order them to DELETE MY RECORDINGS, it does not do that! It says, "Your Request has been SENT" You never EVER get an actual acknowledgement that the RECORDINGS are BEING DELETED! There are those who try to draw attention to "This could be used against you in Law Enforcement". I am doing NOTHING that matters in that regard. THAT is not why I CARE about being RECORDED ALL THE FRAKKING TIME! Consider the more OBVIOUS PRIVACY ISSUES - that have absolutely NOTHING to do with being ILLEGAL or such like: Do YOU WANT AMAZON RECORDING YOU .... * You reminding the kid(s) of the FRONT DOOR LOCK code? * You discussing your private FINANCIAL facts with your spouse? * You lecturing your kid about DRUGS? * How about you and your mate making LOVE at night? * THAT - is why AMAZON ECHO RECORDing is BAD. Listening? Sure, I get that. But RECORDING? And NOT DELETING THEM EASILY by saying: ALEXA - DELETE ALL OF MY RECORDINGS RIGHT NOW! You CAN'T. And I, personally, have a SERIOUS ISSUE WITH THAT. RECORDING? That I cannot merely say, "ALEXA DELETE MY RECORDINGS"? WHY NOT???!!! 2017-DEC-07 Follow on All in all, I like this device. It plays my Amazon music very well, and; the "daily briefings" and "Reuters News" are nice to have. I hope that as time passes, I will find more things to do. It is fun to ask Alexa things just to see what she "knows". I think Amazon should make it more clear where to go to learn more. Perhaps a devoted web page or three. The ONLY thing that is "funny" and "off", is that I have mine seated near one of my TVs. And, Randomly, when I am watching shows, the sound from the TV activates Alexa, and; it is funny to hear her respond to the TV rather than to me. No complaint about that. It is impossible for it to not happen. Though it is really funny when it does! The sound quality is outstanding. And, NOW I have two of them paired. They play music very well in sync. I'm a TECH, so; it makes me wonder what kind of firmware algorithm is used to make it so perfectly synced. Cudoz to the men and women who made that possible. I know that it had to be a serious challenge to make it so! If you want a laugh or three, ask Alexa to sing and also to tell you stories. ;O) 2017-NOV-22 Follow on Okay, really, it is a nice device. It needs MORE functionality, but; it is overall, a good buy, if you want help with your memory and lists and reminders and such like. I found that the recurring reminder is there, just not obvious - though - it should be. Search on Amazon. I'm working on it now. As for Alexa, for some of us, nice is important. One GLARING oversight... She does not respond to courtesy. You folks need to get her to RESPOND to "Thank You Alexa" with "You are welcome." or better, "You're Welcome Roger." or "You are very welcome!" AND best, a combination of either response - or even all three of them, randomly, whenever the user says, "Thanks Alexa" or "Thank you Alexa". or even just "Thank you" and "Thanks". It should be no issue for it to recognize at nice THANK YOU and reply. The ability to do so would add to the illusion that Alexa is your "friendly helper". Food for thought. --------------------------------------------------- (original posting) This is my initial thoughts ONLY. I am still getting to know this device. So far, the PRO(s) are, it is smaller than I thought it would be, which is nice. and, the sound quality is fabulous! It plays my Amazon Prime music very nicely. Alexa responds very well to my voice without any special "training", from 10-feet away across the room. I don't have to "yell at it" or anything. Just speak to her normally. That's really nice. And, the Alexa voice is easy to understand, and; well programmed to reply. CON(s), though only MINOR: I had to EJECT then, REMOVE the SD-CARD, and also REBOOT my phone, to get the ALEXA APP to install on my NOTE 4 running Droid 4.4.4. Before doing that, I wasted nearly an hour trying over, and over, to download and install the app. It downloaded fine, but; REFUSED to install. And on every failed install, it would "claim" it could not download. My download manager showed clearly that it was downloading fine. Frankly, I do NOT like that I must use my PHONE to "configure" and "modify" the settings for this device. THAT was not clear online. I would think AMAZON would ALSO supply me with a WINDOWS application for this. But, so far, I cannot find one. Seriously, it would be nice to NOT have to use ONLY my phone for the setup and reconfiguration activities. Yes, I know the CHILDREN do EVERYTHING on their phones. BUT, I am a DINOSAUR, and I use my LAPTOP far more than my phone for "things". Just a thought. The built in activities are rather LIMITED. It does NEWS only from Reuters, and; will NOT allow me to RE-DO the news for "today". That is annoying. I don't always get to catch all of the information on the first pass. So, it seems that I should be able to RE-LISTEN to the same news cast - on DEMAND - All the time. But, once you have done the news "today", Alexa says, "You've already listened to your news" and refuses to do it again for "today". I have not YET done it, but; I like that I can set up the device to REMIND ME of things, "to-do", and; also - to put things in my Amazon cart, and; also to BUY THINGs without being on the laptop, and; to give me order status alerts for Amazon purchases. I look forward to trying these features. BAD BAD BAD is... She does a terrible job of reading my KINDLE BOOKS. So bad in fact, that; it is not really worth doing. You cannot tell Alexa to SKIP over the Table of contents, or GOTO PAGE 1 or GOTO CHAPTER 3. Nothing like that. You cannot tell her to SKIP a page, or RE-READ anything. AND the biggest problem, she reads FAR TOO FAST. And telling her to "READ SLOWER" appears to do something, but; really - she reads at a breakneck pace, and; there is not way to make her read slower. I will report again when I have had time to try the other things it clams to do. But so far, I LIKE the ECHO, and; the Alexa app is seamless with it. If Amazon can make it READ MY KINDLE BOOKS - and not keep telling me to get an AUDIBLE ACCOUNT, that would be a greatly appreciated thing to improve! 2017-NOV-19 - additional follow-up: Okay, in general, this device works well. Some thoughts about how it can be IMPROVED. When talking to the device, it would be good if Alexa responded to polite interactions. If I say, "Alexa, Thank You", she should reply with "You're Welcome!" or even "You're Welcome Roger." Another Improvement, would be, to allow VOLUME to be SOFTWARE DRIVEN. Today, I MUST walk across the room to make it LOUDER or SOFTER. By pushing the VOLUME buttons. BUT, that is rather counter-intuitive. Since it does "everything else" by voice.... It makes sense that it would ALSO allow me to say, "Alexa, Volume Up please." "Alexa. Volume Down please". And, "Alexa, MUTE please" "Alexa, UN-MUTE please". With positive reply from Alexa, like: "Your Device will be muted until you UN-MUTE or restart it". And, "Your device is now UN_MUTED Roger." It could, and perhaps should, also have a few more APPs available. I cannot say, for sure, what they might be. But, interaction between Alexa and the USER is the key. For instance, since it has TIMER(s) and REMINDER(s), it would be good to be able to have it, perform actions every day at given times--Recurring Reminders. The obvious reminders like: "Roger, It's NOON - time for lunch." or "Roger, it's 7pm, time to call your Mother." Stuff like that - that repeat - DAILY. I still think Alexa should be able to READ my KINDLE books, with a SLOWER PACE. And, be told to SKIP pages, or even chapters." Right now, it annoyingly reads every single thing, including table of contents, etc. And, it does NOT remember where it left off. This would be useful. To have Alexa READ a kindle, and; like me, place a bookmark, and resume reading by saying, "Roger, we last left off in Chapter ###, page ###." Being even smarter, would be to BACKUP a paragraph, or so, when resuming. BUT, that would be far beyond what I am sure these young developers are capable of doing. In summary: The ECHO is a solid device. It's sound quality is outstanding! And, it does a very nice job of playing my AMAZON music. It should have some improvements like: (A) Allow (also) LAPTOP - not merely PHONE - to interface with the device; (B) Allow (also) for SOFTWARE volume UP/DOWN/MUTE/UN_MUTE; (C) Have REPEATED REMINDERS; (D) Have PACE variable speed READING of KINDLE BOOKS; (E) Have MORE built-in applications - and perhaps more NEW(s) source options. I hope to see some of these improvements in 2018. ;O)

Great sound, not real easy to set up, but it didn't take long. Directions were worthless to set up. Had to play around with it. Sometimes, she doesn't respond (less than 5% of time) & sometimes (rarely) she chooses a different music network than Pandora which I set up. Do love the ease of use & sound quality! Please put together a better beginning instruction book!

Day two, I'm enjoying the features. I've added my Sirius XM account, already set up some reminders & my to do list. I'm hoping Amazon allows users to change the device to what ever name we choose to use, instead of their four options.
This 2nd gen Alexa is awesome. The bass in this is a huge improvement. Much smaller the the 1st echo by 2 inch’s. The fabric looks great definitely a great upgrade and for the price can’t beat it
I'm very happy with this product. Sound is very adequate. It is not a $500 Bose system but the sound is crisp and clear. The response time is fantastic. Alexa knows everything. Highly recommend

Alexa provides great service to my daily life! Flash briefings, info on demand, music, lectures, updates for Amazon orders/deliveries. And the list continues (also corny jokes!) 😉 If you desire, you can disable her microphone. I’m a satisfied customer 💯.

I love the amount of apps it integrates with, I wish i could tell siri to play a personal play list on Spotify like alexa.. maybe she does, but I haven't figured out how to get her to work yet. i'm looking forward to seeing what other cool things I can get it to integrate with

This was my first Echo device, I bought it on black friday from target. I had heard that a new software upgrade would improve the sound so I made sure that I had the newest software. After using it for only 3 days and at volume level 8 of 10 the speaker blew out. I am very dissapointed at this product. I have to go return it now. I was hoping it was what the reviews said it was.

It was much more difficult to set up than I would have liked but once it was set up it works great. We have it in the living room and it hears and responds when we are in the kitchen, front door and living room. I purchased this so my wife could listen to music and it has exceeded our expectations

I love waking up in the morning to Alexa softly playing music, or telling Alexa to turn the lights off at night, or checking the weather before leaving out for work. It eliminates the need for me to perform a google search. I ask the question and Alexa will provide the answer.

Everything works well with the second gen Echo. It performs well, minor hiccups here and there but nothing drastic. The music on it exceeded my expectations from a little device. The distance at which it picks up your voice, especially with the television on is pretty amazing. I love being able to control my lights with this unit. It's definitely worth getting if you're into the whole smart home thing.

Honestly did not want any of these technologies in my house - and trust me I love technology I deal with it every day in my job. Having received this for a Christmas present, I am happy to have it. It works with pretty much all the IoTs I have already at home. Some I don't allow, yet. Over all I'm happy and I am sure I will get more - the big question is do I get another Amazon Echo or a Sonos One with Alexa. Decisions....Decisions.

I bought an Echo Dot to try out the Alexa craze in addition to wanting a bluetooth speaker for my bedroom. While I have no complaints about the Dot, the sound quality of the Echo is amazing. I have a Beats Pill and this far outweighs the sound quality on the pill. You can't go wrong with the Echo.

Purchased this in August for my husband's birthday, which was December 6. He was so excited, BUT, it doesn't work! So upset.....our friends who are techies couldn't get it to work after spending hours trying to figure what was happening.

I bought two 2nd Generation Echos and a Dot for Christmas. I really like the Echos, when they are working, but I'm having a terrible time keeping them connected to the internet. It seems I am having to reconnect them manually every other day. Note, none of my other wireless devices are having connectivity issues. Also, I find Siri on m iPhone to be a smarter AI.

I love the Echo! I bought it for my husband as an anniversary gift! As with any technology it has its glitches and doesn't understand what you're saying a lot, but it's awesome for playing songs, games and telling jokes. I would definitely recommend it.

This is not the glowing review Amazon hops for. I have been trying to hook Alexa to my Sonos speaks for 2 months now. Still not working. I have contacted Sonos and Amazon. I have gone through all the steps both have suggested and still not working. I am so tired of this!!! Alexa talks too fast and just mumbles when you ask her things. You ask her to repeat and you have to go through the whole initial asking of the questions, again. She is not conversant like Google devices. Alexa is wordy when you ask her to set a timer and wordy when you ask her to play music even telling you she doesn’t see any speakers. Alexa has difficulty responding to wake command must be repeated several times. If she is learning, she is very, very slow. I hear of people setting these devices up easily but if there are glitches, there is little help and it is incredibly time consuming (2 months so far). I’m thinking in another day or two, I’ll just pack up the three devices and send back to try Google Home. Costs the same and they are supported with better phone support via Costco. Sonos speakers still work via my smart devices, just not via voice commands on Alexa. Converting to a smart home is expensive and time consuming. There should be some extra help for those of us who seem to be challenged in this area. Bottom line: very little support other than unplugging and reinstalling standard emails from Amazon.....I’m of to uninstall, reinstall, unlink, unplug, reboot, plug, relink, delete, and set up once again.................you decide if that’s a simple, easy and convenient process.........

I love the Echo, the sound quality is really good. I originally got it thinking I could convince my husband to get rid of some old speakers he uses to play music. I was really surprised how much he got into asking Alexa all kinds of questions! Very happy with my purchase and hoping to add more devices in the future around the house

We really like the Echo for playing music around the house and on the deck. Unfortunately after 4 months of ownership it has started to intermittently lose its connection to wifi and bluetooth. It can happen 8 or more times in an evening. It is getting very annoying. I am going to call Amazon and see if this is a common issue and if it can be replaced if it is going bad.

Some friends of our talked to us about how much they used their Echo and to be honest I wasn't convinced. However, when the price dropped this Christmas season I hopped onto Amazon and purchased one and also an Echo Dot for each of the kids. Man was I wrong about them. We use them every day for all kinds of things from games to music, weather and news. We even use it to control out Fire Tv. Great product

We just bought our 4th device and love it. We have 3 echo 2nd gens and a dot. Sound on the echo 2nd gen is better than dot, but music on the dot is still ok. We bought the charger with this echo so we can take it outside by the pool. Great sound and very convenient.

After reading the reviews, I was a little skeptical about the sound quality of the echo; however, I've been completely impressed by this device. Using the Alexa app, you can customize the equalizer to produce the sound that's most appealing for you. Although this device doesn't deliver the same quality as my Bose products, I never expected that it would. But for the price, this little guy can fill a room with a great, balanced sound! I'm more than likely going to replace the remaining Echo dots with these things.

LOVE IT!! I never thought I would get one, nice sound and Alexa helps me so much. Great if you love technology and love a smart home. No longer do I have to scream upstairs or downstairs, she board-casts and drops in when I need to. I might get the echo show soon.

Fun kind of electronic item to have around, The amazon app Alexa that you use with it is very poor. Most of the time when you click on settings the app just sits there with 3 blinking dots and goes nowhere for days. The Echo however is fun to have around and amazingly up to date with information.

Great product!!! I have been disappointed in the past with voice recognition and speech. They have come along way with speech, understanding what your saying. Excellent understanding of your questions with a seemingly intelligent responses, This sceptic is impressed. Worth the money.

I enjoy using the Echo for listening to my audiobooks. I use her for the weather and to tell me jokes. A lot of times I will ask her a question and she does not know so then I have to use Siri on my iPhone. I am learning more things she can do. I would definitely recommend this product and I will be purchasing a second one for my bedroom in the near future

I was really excited to get my new Echo. I have the original Echo and have enjoyed it. The online reviews all mentioned better sound. But, the reality is the sound isn't very good. My wife has a Soundlink Color II and the sound is much better. I returned the new Echo after only one day.

I wasn't sure what to expect with some of the reviews I read saying this version has bad sound. But having used this for some time now and comparing it to the previous version, I think this new version is far better sounding than the previous version. It's been fun to play with. I think it is worth the money.

I love Amazon echo and have them all around the house. I love convenience features like lists, reminders, timers, etc. My wishes are for 1. Better volume control. It needs better resolution. 3 is too soft, 4 is too loud. 2. Groups are weak. One echo should be able to belong to multiple groups. I'm surprised that all isn't a group. 3. Reminders timers and alarms should be able to alert groups of echos for when I'm working around the house in multiple rooms. I love Echo but there are improvements to be made.

We now have five echo devices in our house and two at my mother-in-law's place. For the second time in about two months, my mother-in-law has needed to summon help from us. She couldn't get to her phone, but she was able to call us Alexa-to-Alexa. It was terrific. We even were able to speak with paramedics who arrived at the house before we could get there. Sound quality on the 2nd Gen models is great. Despite some concerns that Alexa is taking over the universe, we really find great value, quality, etc. in the Amazon Echo devices.

We're really enjoying the music we are getting through Alexa. I know there are so many other applications for this "toy" and we'll eventually learn to use them. In the meantime, this beats CD's, XM or the radio available to us.

I was surprised by my wife with an Alexa as a gift and I am really enjoying getting to know her. She supplies us with the latest updates in the news and I can count on her for daily sports scores and to play music on demand. Over time I have learned more and more in what she can do and I do know she will help our household going forward. Now I have to decide if I should invest in Dots for the rest of the household areas......

I received this as a Christmas gift. Thought it was just another overrated electronic device. But I've been totally surprised with its abilities. Relatively easy to set up. Very user friendly and actually a pleasure to use. Probably need to get another one for other rooms in house.
Great sound. The stations like IHeartRadio and Pandora sound great. Use it everyday. Not to mention just telling Alexa to set a timer. And want to know the weather? Just ask. Great device.

I love, love, love my Echo. I really didn't have any expectations because I really didn't know a lot about it. I got Echo as a gift. The music is great. being able to talk to my husband in another part of the house is fantastic. My very favorite part is being able to ask questions so easily. This is a great product and once you have one, you would not want to be without it.
The walnut finish is a bit darker than expected but still very nice. The sound quality isn't as good as I thought it was going to be. It's decent but first Gen is definitely better.
I actually returned this unit because I didn't like it as much as my original Echo. I thought the sound was much more muffled than the original.

My family and I are enjoying and learning this gadget. Some things it does with ease, other commands don’t take right away. I’ve purchased the Element WiFi hub and bulbs and am having a ball connecting and controlling lights. I want to get an echo dot to connect with a WiFi camera and thermostat next.

I purchased this 2nd generation Echo to synchronize with my 1st generation Echo that I have been using for several years, thus allowing me to play music in separate sections of my house. It, of course, does that and more. The sound is richer and has more clarity almost as good as my Bose speakers. Very glad that I purchased this unit.

Alexa doesn't seem to be able to tell u much at all. You can ask her any question or tell her to order you something, but it's likely she will not be able to tell you an answer. She is not able to search the internet easily. Good for setting alarms and she'll tell you the weather....but not very helpful otherwise.

While a lot of people are chatting up Sonos, I love my add-on Echo 2 because it connects with the other Echo devices I already own to play synchronized music throughout the home. Why replace what I already have when I can build on it at my own pace at a much lower cost and still get great sound?
Original version looked and worked better. The voice commands are not responsive and you won’t be able to tell a difference in sound quality
We have purchased 4 Echo's now, for gifts, We have a lot of fun with this product. Just don't ask ALEXA to sing you a song. haha. we also got the Echo Dots and plugs to enhance the experience.

We've never had an Echo so didn't know what to expect. It took a while to get it going but once done, just loved it. She doesn't know everything but knows a lot. Love getting my fav NPR station, grocery list and playing music. The only thing we didn't like was the drop in. We have a small house 1160 Sq ft. and it echoes badly between the 2 echoes. I love moist everything about it.

I was skeptical about getting one just because I’ve never used one. I got it for my mother for Christmas and during family dinner it was so fun and easy to ask for certain songs or answers to questions. This product is definitely a huge help when your hands are full or you just want to hear your favorite song.

Great sound as a speaker and the alexa function has really grown on our family! I now go d myself purchasing all sorts of smart devices to automate my house! Love the ability to link to numerous music services and use the list and timer constantly. Well worth the money. Actually bought 2 dots to put in inter rooms too.

It’s ok for general queries. I found my family using it mainly for weather. We didn’t really use it too much and therefore I returned it. I was also told that as long as the unit has power it is listening to conversations to improve its voice recognition algorithms. The sound quality is very good for a unit of this size

After months of use... when it counts... I hate Alexa! This product feels beta all of the time. Failing when activation word is used, and starting when unasked every single day. I find my myself swearing at the top of my lungs constantly at "Alexa" to shut up, repeating what I had stated five times already in a row, or trying to figure out how what I said could possibly have to do with the result I am getting. I made a massive mistake in these purchases. I Smart things hub, Phillips Hue, Security System, etc. Alexa can barely answer weather questions (the worst ever/inaccurate) let alone turn lights on, or turn off the blaring alarm that was tripped accidentally. God, I hate Alexa!

Excellent Sound combined with Alexa's capabilities make this a great addition to our home. A huge advancement from the Echo Dot. I would recommend it to anyone wishing to have a big sound or upgrade their Echo experience.

I was really disappointed at the limitations in the spanning types of genres of music I can get. I can't seem to get any clear instruction, and my echo knows nothing! Every time I try to ask it a question like how to start a playlist, it says I don't know about that, or I can't tell you that or something like that. It's just a cheap little entertainment trick you can get it to tell you a joke, but it's really not very functional. add to that that you have to pay every month to keep it going, it's not worth it for me to pay that for a joke during the month, I can go online and get them for free.

The echo works very well as a Bluetooth speaker. Additionally, with 2 managed power outlets connected, I can now control the lights in 2 rooms by voice command. This is handy in the morning after programming a morning routine which turns on lights, tells me the weather and traffic conditions from home to work.

Got this for my daughter. I have a couple of dots at home myself. Daughter says it's a nice product but concern of the privacy portion and claims it goes on talking on it's own. Might be best to turn mic off at night and when not in use. I am having the same issues. Dots just start talking on its own.

I finally jumped on the bandwagon and bought an Alexa for our home. We primarily use her for setting timers while cooking, playing music, or asking the Roomba to clean... but we are in the process of upgrading our home to run off more “smart” features, so we look forward to using Alexa even more!

This product incredibly difficult to install and match to internet. If you have an accent do not buy does not recognize Spanish accent. My husband has a slight accent and it just doesn’t respond. Constantly loses connection. This was a complete waste of money. Should have returned it first week I got it. Now I’m stuck with it

This Alexa does everything you would imagine and more. Truly the best home assistant. I can’t wait for the day when I can afford to buy all the smart home equipment. If your skeptical on this and others like Google and Apples this is the best one. I will be gifting every family member one when the time comes as long as they don’t already own after witnessing use in my home.

The speaker is amazing! I like many of the options Alexa offers but sometimes I must word the question incorrectly because she doesn't quite get it. I wish there was an option to rename her because every time my daughter mentions her cousin's name, guess who answers!?!

I have two Echo Dots, and got this new Echo because I wanted better sound. This speaker sounds about 10% better than my Dot. It's nice looking, though. I wish I could have had the opportunity to try one out before I bought it, because I wouldn't have bought it in the first place. It still functions perfectly, but the sounds it super mediocre. And I'm not an audiophile by any means. Buy this only if the Dot don't do what you need.
We are still trying to discover all the uses of this great device, but weather and music alone are worth the price. Very responsive--no need to raise your voice . Would definitely buy again.
The sound is much better than our other Bluetooth speakers and we have no connection issues. We had to update it right away, wish it had arrived with the update so we didn't have to call support.

I never owned the 1st Gen, & cannot compare the two of them, but I can at least say, the speaker on this thing is amazing. Its not the best, but it sure is better than a $50 speaker you can buy. I don’t understand why people say the sound isn’t the best, unless they must be comparing it too something like Beats by Dre speakers. Other than the amazing sound quality, this is just simply an amazing product. Very imprssed.

The one use my mom has of this is that she bought the smart plugs to tell Alex to turn on certain hard to reach lights on. Can't play your music on this by the way, if you still use music files. It can only play music from certain specific apps or if you pay for Amazon music, of course.

We don't like this Item! The echo plus has so much better sound quality. In addition we always have trouble hearing us at times. We never have trouble with our Echo plus we can whisper a command and the Echo plus will pick it up. We are sometimes even yelling at our Echo 2nd Gen and it will totally not do the correct thing. Our Plus used to be in the same spot as our 2nd Gen and again we never had problems.

I waited out to buy Alexa because I was hoping that one day, Sri would grow a brain. The microphone is very sensitive so it can pickup my over over the TV across the living room thru the kitchen and thru the dinning room.

I am technology challenged but Amazon Customer Service was wonderful at walking me through the process! We don't use it as much as we should but love the ability to get updates on weather with a simple voice command; LOVE LOVE LOVE the Question of the Day feature! This was a surprise gift from my sister otherwise I am not sure we would have thought of getting it. But....we are so glad now that we have Alexa in our life!

make me laugh a lot,,,,and the quality of the sound is very good,,,,,considering the dimensions and features is a good product...i try Siri, Cortana, etc, and they don't understand because my foreign accent but this one understand me almost 100 % of the time ...I'm happy with the performance.

I bought this as a gift for my dad who loves gadgets but doesn’t want a bs item collecting dust. He absolutely loved it! Calls come in clearer than speakerphone for both android and iPhone. He loves all the features and plans to get more for other rooms in his home. I now plan to get one for myself as well after seeing it in action.

Easier connection to my network, I like the smaller design and did not lose sound quality. Great in the kitchen for playing music, using Alexa as a timer for cooking, asking inane trivia questions, and much more. Now I need to figure out what happened to my generation 1 Echo...(it will not connect to my wi-fi network)

Truly love the 2nd generation of echo. From the first second I got it out of the box I've been using it nonstop. Audio is crisp from my unit, I don't see other people's complaints with mine. Alexa is so responsive and has no lag time. Buy this for Christmas and you'll make someone very happy. Don't pass this up or you'll be sorry.

My husband loves this. He uses it more than I do, but he is more technically savy than I am. I am learning all the different things that you are able to do and so far I have really enjoyed having it! I am so glad that I purchased this! I would definitely recommend this to any one considering purchasing one.

It took me 2 days to figure out how to connect by Blue-Tooth to my computer. Once I accomplished that, I was off and running. So far, I am using it as a Blue-Tooth speaker to watch streamed movies, live stream local radio, alarm for various things, shopping lists, and general Q&A about things of interest to me. There are many other features that I will explore in more detail in a couple of months when I retire.

bought as a christmas gift for my sibling. she has not used it much, but speaker did sound loud enough on initial test. I think the value of Echo will increase once more apps begin to integrate it locally and amazon releases future updates that better utilizes the echo systems

Afraid at first that this was a monster. However with the app on the iPhone it was a piece of cake to set up and start getting music in the home ..Be aware that Alexia is very sensitive to her name and you may have to whisper when she is in the room. You get used to it readily and it's a great addition to a home.

I have an Echo Dot whick I love in my trailer. I bought this Echo for my home and no matter what I do, who I talk to I can't get it to work. It's so disappointing. I've reread some of the reviews and I'm not alone....Very disappointing,,,returning it never to reorder.

I think once we figure it out it will be fine but it was not the most user friendly situation for sure. It still isn't right because she knows nothing unless I suggest. A specific song and then I had to go on and buy songs. Probably something we don't have synced. I have not spent a lot of time on it but mostly because of frustration. All the advertising sounds simple

Works well, although we have been disappointed that some responses to our questions refer us to Amazon to purchase something. An example was a request to play a sample of Led Zeppelin music. Other music we can request and get, but not this one and several others.

Ok, this is a great item. My wife is loosing her eyesight to md and now she can turn her light on with a voice command and control the tv with voice commands. I also have an Insteon app with the garage door and other components that now can be controlled by Alexa. This is not to say it has been easy by any means. But, we both enjoy our new echo. Programming and installation require a lot of patience and it can be very frustrating but it is worth it.

love this thing..got it after I was attacked by a falling Christmas tree and realized I needed a way to call my neighbors or kids for help without having a phone handy. I am WAY too young for a "life alert" so I got this--the extra stuff it does is a pleasant surprise!

We have four 1st gen echos at home, one 1st gen at our offices, and now four 2nd gen also at the offices. AWESOME. They understand us, are reliable, and work well with two different automation systems (different ones at home and office). I have even purchased one for an elderly friend, who also loves it.

I have been using SONOS but needed to expand music distribution throughout the house. SONOS is a fairly closed system and very expensive. The sound is very high quality on the Echo and the Play Everywhere option meets my needs. I still use the Echo to drive SONOS but only for the living room. 2 recommended improvements: 1 - Enable stereo play. 2 - Allow overlapping play groups. Currently if an Echo is part of the Everywhere group it cannot also be in another group, for example, living room. I imagine this will be fixed since it only requires a software update.

I did a lot of research and decided that the Echo 2nd gen would be good for me and my needs. It is perfect!!!! The speaker is so powerful it's amazing clear quality sound for music or other intrest audio. I love Alexa things! Great product. Only draw back is in FL this time of year we get a lot of thunder and lightening storms where the power will cut out for 30 seconds and come back on. Echo/Alexa needs to be unplugged and plugged back in.

The sound quality is fantastic! My family all sits together and plays games with our echo. It also gives us the chance to pick our favourite songs without having to do what we are doing. We can fact check and get the latest info with just a voice command. I plan on getting one in every room.

I like the sound quality and the access to types of music I enjoy. The brown casing is attractive. I do not like that Alexa sometimes stops in a middle of a song never to return. I do not like getting lots of email ads trying to get me to sign up to Amazon’s music programs. I resent the non stop ads.

I am basing my review off previously purchasing an Echo Dot. The sound of the Echo is far better, with a good balance of bass and treble. The Dolby sound does have a surround effect and sounds like it could be coming from anywhere in the room. I would recommend if you are looking for an accessory to your Amazon Prime account.
Alexa works well, but sound not as I expected. Returned. I just received megablast ultimate ears - sounds quality very good! Big difference.

I bought this for my wife's birthday hoping she'd like it and - surprise - she did. We had a lot of fun learning how to use it and engaging in conversation. The one drawback is that often times - Alexa goes offline (can't find a network connection) and the "Help" section of the app is NO HELP. She eventually comes back after power cycling but the annoyance of doing that prevents me from giving it five stars.

Still learning to use the device for useful things like recipes. In the kitchen it is nice to have Alexa play whatever music I want to hear. Taking it soon to babysit the grandchildren for a week. Should be a hoot for the 4 and 2.5 yr olds!

This device is for bass lovers and book listeners. It puts the bass up to the top and makes vocals sound clearer. So basically trance, disco, Edm, and metal sound great. But hip hop like outkast b.o.b. sounds off because it is instrumnational. I love the bass on this thing, for it is most baller in indeed.

I love talking to Alexa. I have no friends, so sometimes she'll tell me the time...or the weather...man, what a life we lead! Seriously though, this is a great speaker. I have it in my downstairs living room; and when it's on full volume, I can hear it upstairs even while using the shower. It's so loud. I love it! It's very easy. I connected it with the Hue Lighting system. Full hands? No problem. Alexa has your back!!! I highly recommend this - especially over the Google Home. And, I really do have friends...

4.5 out of 5 Stars. I generally like this product. Its great at doing what you ask of it like playing music, setting timers, and making calls. Reason why I didn't rate it 5 out of 5 is that sometimes the connection dies and my Echo stops playing music and shows a red ring. Seems to be a connection issue. Overall, great product.

My fourth. Love Alexa. One caution. To my older ears the earlier generation sound a bit better. This new unit has a bit too much base and lacks the mudrange balance. Still sound better than my other dedicated Charge 2 Plus Blue tooth speaker.

Great item overall. After 3 of them at the house, I still cannot find a flaw in the construction. Great sound quality, great size, great look. Conservative ellegant, and looks great no matter where. The Alexa feature is a splendid tool that works perfect for any mood. The various color options provide a very decor specific option for whatever environment you may think. The only detail that I would improve, would be to be able to synchronize all units available when used as Bluetooth speaker. But I’m aware that it could be due to limitations on the Bluetooth platform. Great unit, and I will continue to add more throughout the house and yard.

I love this thing. We use it constantly. I was against buying it cuz I thought it was dumb but my wife kept at it. Now I'm a fan. We have Philips hub and bulbs and control half of our house with it. Very neat. Very easy and intuitive.

Echo provides my npr, music and general information on a host of subjects hands free and so quickly. The sound is high quality and fills the room. After I'd heard one at my sister's, I really had to get one. It's a no-brainer.

Just received my 2nd Generation Echo's and not at all happy with the sound quality compared to the 1st Generation. We have 3 1st Generation Echo's and 5 Dot's throughout the house and love them. Just unboxed the 2nd Generation and immediately you can tell the clarity and depth of sound is just not there. I will definitely be keeping my 1st Gen's and returning these.

I've had the first gen Echo since it first came out and it has worked well for me. I purchased the 2nd gen during Prime Day and so far I'm happy. It seems to have an improved speaker which provides enhanced sound for music and such.

I love it!! My granddaughter and I will have Alexa play Disney songs and dance and sing around the house. An easy way to get facts, news and weather. I can’t believe I waited so long to buy one. Getting a second one for in my bedroom.

Alexa is fun, the best thing she does is the reminds me to take my meds which is very helpful to me. I have so to learn about her and I am sure if Amazon have their stuff together Alexa and echo will be a must have. I can't wait to get lights controlled by her. I also like you can take change the name "alexa" to others like "computer" and I think a couple other ones. Love this
I love my echo! It doesn’t always know what I’m talking about though. I can’t imagine my life without it... at least for now. I named it Echo but I’d name it a dude name if I could.
Wife talk more to Alexa than she does to me, ha, ha. Great product.

I've had a echo dot for a couple years now and decided to upgrade because I use it all the time. Honestly the music quality in this one sounds ALOT better than the dot. I think it also sound better than my German SUV's premium package but that's just my opinion.
Love this and Alexa! The sound is great and since I have Amazon prime a lot of music is available to me. Alexa play... and I am listening to a song I like or a playlist. It is so easy.

Does not compete with Siri's intellegence...has difficulty answering my questions. Also responds to the TV sometimes out of the blue, which is 18ft away. Also Amazon emails me at least once a week with phrases to engage Alexa...which means, if you don't phrase your questions properly, you get a non-response as previously mentioned.

Convenient and fun to use. Among other things, I have Alexa play all kinds of music from classical to rap. Whether new or old and obscure, she always has the artist I request She gives me the weather, reminds me of my pill schedule and appointments, defines words, etc. She's really amazing.

This is our 3rd Alexa Echo. Sounds great, amazing features. Got it for my girlfriends bedroom as she has one for the 1st floor of her house. I have one in my man cave and am thinking of getting another for my upstairs kitchen/living room area. Now part of my daily routine.
Only purchased for speaker use for iPod and glad I did not expect more. Alexa does not know much.

Love letting Alexa play all day. Just call out what ever music or song you would like to listen to. Questions, weather and BS she will always have a comment. Enjoying all the features. Purchased several for other family. Quality of the sound is great.

Love this. Never thought I had a need for one of these, but now that I see how easy it is to play any music in an instant, I don't know how I did without it. Prime Music gives more than enough options. Sound is wonderful. Still exploring other uses.

Echo (Alexa) understands and processes 30 to 40% of my commands. All clearly stated. Succinct. And tried in multiple versions in clear enunciated formats. She rarely understands. Have a call coming in so I ask turn down the volume on Music. She never responds. Brick. I finally walk over and say Alexa turn down the music volume 30% and she says sorry you have no smart devices connected. Every time I remember to use the thing I walk over and unplug it after 15 minutes. 2 Stars because the music/speaker quality isn’t bad. My opinion is this and software is 2 years away from being better than a novelty.

For the first couple of months, the echo was just a fancy piece of equipment that was mainly used to tell time. We wanted to use it to play music but could not link it to Amazon Prime music even after contacting customer service. Then one day it started working. We use echo mostly for music, to tell time, and as an alarm. We occasionally ask questions but half the time echo doesn't understand us or what we are asking. I wish there was a cheat sheet (something in writing) to help maximize its function. Overall, I'm still happy with the purchase and would buy again.
Hey, using Echo for very simple tasks and does just as expected, but there is a slight learning curve. However, it is kind of fun. Cool device.

Amazon eco system and hardware win here... ... sounds great... similar to a small bose or sonos speaker... ... alexa platform is powerful enough to run your whole house if you wanted ... everything seemingly "just works" ... good ui and ux everywhere

There's a short learning curve interacting with Alexa. Skills that you can add are many, but few add any real value that I can discern at this time. Also, when you use the Echo to turn on another speaker, it would be nice if it could play on the Echo as well, especially since you're connected via WiFi. Still exploring it's functionality, and can see the potential should minor updates improve on a pretty cool product.

Great at playing a limited music selection: you need to have a subscription to a music service. Good for weather, jokes, poems and the like. Doesn’t like questions about the CIA, government or if someone else is listening. Doesn’t understand or pretends not understand some questions.

Much better sound than the dot echo I had before. I like to listen to music once in awhile and the sound is pretty good. Can adjust bass, treble and volume by audible to your liking. Able to easily hear commands. Fairly small footprint considering performance.

If you do not use the exact phrase Alexa is programmed for you may spend a long time trying different version of your request before you hit on the right one. Otherwise you will repeated hear "I'm not familiar with that."

Bought this for my 3 older children, they are thrilled with it!! The sound is awesome and "Alexa" is super witty and charming! Also very amusing! She will sing a song for you if you ask her to! Very pleased with this purchase! Now I need one for myself! Lol! Some minor difficulties with set-up though! Had to use 3 different Amazon accounts!? Not sure why? If I have Amazon prime, I feel I should be able to use one in every room on my account!
I like how I can set an alarm, get news and weather reports. Also I enjoy the parts that are more geared towards kids “open the magic door” etc... really like the wood look as it works with my decor!

I got this for my parents who are in their 80's. They love it. This way we can keep in touch no matter where I go without a long distance charge. I gave them a list of things they can do with it. I can see that they are using it quite often.

I bought Echo to replace my music system that I used to listen music from my iPhone youtube and FM radios. It is so easy to set up the pairing with my iPhone via the bluetooth connection. Then all there left is to talk to Alexa! The speaker sound quality is pretty good too.

The walnut finish goes great with my counter top where I have it sitting. It was actually a gift so I'm very pleased with it. There hasn't been anything yet I've not liked about it but I play music the most. I do use it to set a timer once in awhile and to remind me of appointments

wow. Big hit in my family. We use it all the time for news, weather, music. We bought 2 small units so we have 3 around the house. Everyone in the house loves them.. Amazing product Amazon. And I feel it is a great price for what you get. The sound on the big unit is amazing.

Every time, from everywhere in my tiny home, that I would ask Alexa to play my music, she would either play one song and go offline, or just not play at all and tell me she was having trouble connecting to the internet...when every other item in my home has no trouble. I got tired of asking her and remembered that I can just use my fingers and push play on my laptop to avoid the aggravation. I returned it. "Alexa, give me my money back".

Sound quality is NOT better with this. I also have an original Echo and a Dot and would say the sound is in between. Definitely does not live up to the hype. It does seem to hear me better with background noise such as the TV which is the only reason I'm going to give it a chance and also the reason it gets 2 stars instead of 1. If you're buying this, like I did, expecting great room filling sound, I would skip it and spend the money on a new or refurb original Echo.

The sound quality is great and having answers to questions when you need them is awesome. My 8 year old loves the animal game and will play it often. Alexa does have frequent issues with understanding what you are asking her especially if your home is noisy. All though she does hear you quite well when you don’t need anything ( If you say her name or a name that is similar in a conversation not involving her ) she fits my needs well as my family listens to music often and it is nice to have it play and adjust the volume without stopping what you are doing.

So far we’re impressed. Sound is great, voice pickup range is good. Still figuring out how to add devices for Alexa to control. First off our older Vzio Smart TV and sound bar. Can setup multiple profiles. Easy setup and pairing. Good job Amazon.
The Echo works fine butt there is a great deal of information that is not well understood or known. It was disappointing in that sense but overall we are happy with the purchase and have utilized it.

Purchased this for myself and am just beginning to learn all that it can do. So far am very pleased and amazed at the different actions it can perform. Am enjoying it and looking forward to learning more about other options it provides.
Loving the Amazon Echo. Great Product. Amazon Echo comes in handy around the house with music, news, weather and other info. Its great having all the info within voice reach.
Not only does my new Echo answer my questions, update me on the news, play my music, run my Roomba, but it cooks me dinner and washes my dishes. I think Ill marry it.
Alexa doesn’t seem to know as much as she claims. We get a lot of responses that she doesn’t know that information to very basic requests.

I’ve had my Echo 2 for about a week now and pretty much concluded that I’m going to return it, it’s minor advantage of better sound isn’t enough for me to recommend it. There are several reasons for this. First, I already own an Echo Dot and I find it better serves me than the Echo 2. The Echo 2 does have better sound but for me this is unemportant since I mostly use the Dot for podcasts and news where sound quality isn’t a factor, if I am going to listen to music I just turn on a spare sound bar in my living room and the Dot connects and I have better sound quality than the Echo 2, the two devices otherwise share exactly the same functionally. In the final score, all things considered, the Echo Dot is the superior device, at half the price. Here’s why: 1. The Dot is half the price 2. About 1/4 the size 3. Performs exactly the same as the Echo 2 4. Uses Micro USB cable & extensions for power 5. Can use any USB charger => 500 MA output 6. Can run off any USB 2000 mh+ battery that charges phones and tablets ($15 - $25.00) 7. Plugged into a battery it can run all day on battery alone, no hunting for a socket 8. The Dot is portable, the Echo 2 -> slaved to its proprietary power supply, is not. Let me be honest. From the second I saw that ugly wall wart and proprietary cable connector I hated the Echo 2, I knew immediately, before turning it on that I was going to hate it because wall sockets are at a premium in my house. Worse, the sockets are almost always fully occupied, buried behind furniture and such. Early this year I changed most of the outlets in my house to ones that have USB sockets as well so I didn’t need to have extensions, socket adapters and so on, a ten foot after market USB extension cable can be had here for $5.00 at the local “Five Below” Store. None of this works for the Echo 2. With its clunky wall wart and a proprietary connector it is slaved to only the included power cord. Can’t use it outside, can’t use it anywhere without an outlet. Had I been aware of this failing of the Echo 2 I would not have ordered it, the far smaller, cheaper and much more flexible Echo Dot is simply a better choice. If I want to use it somewhere that has no wall socket I just plug it into one of my 8000 mh batteries, works for hours.

I cannot say anything but good things about "MY ALEXA!" Love her - don't care that everyone says she listens in on your conversations. I am not planning anything bad so who cares! I also have an IT background and know that nothing works perfect there will always be glitches. Love "MY ALEXA!" I am in the process of buying my the doorbell!

Works well and can be novel, but probably not the world's most necessary product. Perhaps I will do more with it, but for now it is just sort of fun. I do like it as a radio station. As for performance, it is usually spot on, but often does not understand and can be frustrating,
Love it. Gives me daily news, plays music, reads a book to me when I'm crocheting, keeps my lists, easy to use. Super easy set up, looks great, works great. Really enjoy it.

This is scond review in two days. Here is a comment for Amazon. ADD A EQUALIZER TO THE APP. If not a full equalizer, then a “loudness button” so I can pump up the base while turning down the treble, or the total volume, which can be tinny. Then, perfection.

Got this for my 77 year old dad who usually rejects anything "high tech" but after playing with it for an hour I was told, "I hit the nail on the head". It's the best gift I've ever gotten him. He already wants another in his bedroom and workroom.

This really could be a wonderful speaker. It is also invaluable for the blind or vision impaired. The problem is the speed of the speech. It is just too fast. So you miss much of what is being said. There needs to be a way to slow down the speech.

The sound quality is better than the first generation, but it is not perfect. I understand this is a small Bluetooth speaker, but I have had others that I have paid half the price for and they sound better. There is a lot of distortion as the volume increases.I like the new microphones as Alexa can hear you from the next room with the volume up high.

Purchased this for my wife for Christmas. Thought it would keep her company when I was out working and kids were in school. She loves it. She listens to her favorite music, checks the weather, asks questions to help kids with homework, and many other things. Was a great gift for her.

Enjoying the variety of news flashes word of the day, and historical daily briefs. Still discovering other abilities, like connecting to my appliances, and home alarm system. Have not used it with the fire stick yet, should be fun!

It is great! Every morning Alexa plays the NPR morning news headlines for us. She also plays music Amazon Music. On Sundays, it's usually church hymns. Today it was Elton John music (I have a wide variety of musical tastes.) I want to learn how to use Alexa more. Oh, she also updates the local weather for us.
gets the job done! Loving the Alexa device. Syncing it to other smart devices. I wish the sound quality was better or at least more base.

Bought this as an Xmas gift for our daughter and they love it. My son-in-law works for Lutron so they already had lighting control that were compatible with Alexa. We also got them a Dot for the 2nd floor and they are working well together. Seems they learn a new "trick" every day.

I like these quite a bit. I think the apple speaker sounds a little better, and Google's home does a better job answering odd questions, but these do a good job and are very affordable (I have 4 of them)

Sound is better than the 1st generation but not by much. It has a deeper sound. How ever its suppose to listen better but I think the 1st generation was better. It also takes longer to communicate your commands, so lights take longer to come on.
This thing is really a piece of junk. It doesn’t recognize anything we say. It comes up with off the wall stuff. I regret buying it.

But since I’m from England, this thing can not understand a single word I say. I set the unit up correctly and went through voice training, however more often than not, Alexa simply can’t understand my English accent. After settling up over 6 devices to connect my home, I’m sure you can imagine how annoyed I am. My Playstaion 4 not only hears every word I say, but was able to specifically single out the region of Wngland I’m from, Manchester. Amazon has a long way to go, before coming even close to being usable for me.

Initially I bought 2 to play music in different rooms and control a smart plug. I ended up getting a 3rd and added the sub. Then I realized I could add my carrier thermostat and now I absolutely love them all.

Great device but if the volume is up she won’t turn off and never understands what I want when I’m drinking so it turns in to a screaming match and she wins and I give up but over all friends say our feud is entertaining

2nd amazon echo. Own 2 dots. But the ability to pick up voices appear easier with echo than the dot in larger rooms. Like the better speakers. Love the ability to merge them together to play music synchronized if you want. Like the looks of the walnut
Excellent weather announcer. The trivia game is entertaining. Disappointed that Amazon Music is so difficult to link and that you must have paid subscriptions for anything to work.

I am a fan of the Echo and it’s capabilities. I on,y wish she could hear a little better. And sometimes you have to repeat the same phrase a few times over and over until she gets it right. But the price is right and if you have Amazon Prime there is little reason not to get one
We were a little leary at first purchasing the echo, but we are so glad we did. The possibilities are endless! My husband loves the device. We play out music, lookbup recipes and other things.

I received my echo 2nd generation 3 hours ago and already made up my mind. I basically love listening to music, all kinds of music from heavy metal to classic depending on what I'm doing. The sound of this device is awesome, and the sensitivity of the microphone can't get any better. So far I'm very pleased with my purchase.

We purchased Echo and 3 Echo Dots and my husband and I are enjoying music all through our downstairs and in our bedroom. We also purchased another Echo Dot for my son and his family to increase their listening choices. This is absolutely the most enjoyable purchase we have made recently.

I can’t say enough about this device. Good things, that is. I wake up in the morning and say “good morning” and a reply comes back about some historical fact about the date. I can play any music by just speaking. Even if I just want opera, it will play some opera tune. Love this device and can’t wait to learn more commands.

Love it, arrived on time, easy set up, and she is learning every day. Some will say that someone can listen to what you say or talk about. Oh well, I have nothing to hide. I have her set up to control most of the lights in my home also.

I have the first of what will probably be several Echo towers or other devices in different parts of the house. I have connected the first one to my Bose sound system. As good as the sound quality is from the Echo tower (which I will have as a stand alone in other parts of the house), hooked to my more robust sound system - it is superb. It's not just the tower, it's the combo with the amazing AI of Alexa - WOW! Simple, clean, and intuitive. I am using Alexa for many things beyond music and still discovering it all since I am just 3 days into this.

I bought this for my 78 year old mother who takes to tech like a duck to water and she absolutely loves it! From her 1950’s music to news and weather updates to jokes and recipes, she’s thrilled to have it. I sent her a Dot to go with it and she uses it on her lower level. She’s having a blast with it and is ready to explore the home automation features now.
Just as amazing as the hub, the sound quality is exceptional. I think this is worth every dollar spent. I haven't had a single problem with Alexa, understands everything.
I love the Echo! It can do many things and more are added all the time. It can't clean the house and vacuum yet though, gotta work on that!

ECHO has many skills, I am able to control my TV and two smart sockets. But ECHO was so so to answer questions. There is a bug, when I ask ECHO to change channel on my TV, the app changed source to cable from antenna, I have to change the TV source back to antenna.

It’s a good devise but the only problem is that I see is that the alarm Feature doesn’t seem to work properly because when I set a timer on it and the alarm sounds the volume is too low other than that iits a good device

I love the Echo! I can find out what the temperature and weather forecast is in the morning. Also, I can ask Alexa to check my calendar, which is nice. I listen to NPR and Amazon Music too and can hear anything that I like. I’m very glad that I bought this and it is worth every penny!

Me encantó, definitivamente cuando salga la versión de Alexa para los hispano hablantes será mucho mejor la expriencia. Lo recomiendo sumamente, en especial a los que les gusta la tecnología! :)

With Echo I will have to clean the dust off my Total Gym and oil the rollers Because I don't have to be moving around and exercise Excellent product Ask Alexa any question in any subject and she has the answer Will Highly recommend Wendell Quick

It's a quality piece of hardware, but we're in the air out of selling stuff in beta and letting consumers dictate how software gets built apparently.

My second purchase for a gift. These things are great!

I’m looking forward to get more smart gadgets for my home and linked them with Alexa.

Love, love my Alexa. I treated myself to this to see if I would like it. I can set a timer, find out the weather, listen to music, play games? Terrific product!

Christmas gift for my daughter and son in law. They love it. Especially my son in law. He loves music and he and Alexa are having a love affair finding obscure artists and playing their music
Wait until you hear the sound in this new ECHO 2nd generation...it is AWESOME! I also bought one for my son & his family....

Gift from our kids for Chrismas...we love it..we play variety of music during the day, every day, give her a thumbs up for longs we like....Ask questions, set alarms for meds, wake up to music, set timers, etc....Easy to set up, sounds great, Alexa makes us laugh..

I have paired 2 second gen echo’s with the echo sub woofer and the sound quality is very good for the cost. I also have this setup paired with 4 third gen echo dots for whole home sound.

At first I loved my Echo. After having it for about 3 weeks I have come to regret my purchase. I do like some features but the more I use it the less it seems to understand me. Very friendly and works great. The only comment I have is that theres too much base in the sound.

I bought this for my parents. Now when I visit them, they speak to Alexa more than they speak to me. I'm 41 years old and looking to be adopted by someone who doesn't have the Echo. I'm tidy, and don't require very much. I'll even live in your shed. Please love me.
Since the updates I think it sounds good and is very useful 😎

There should be a How To Set Up Book with Amazon Echo. Since I am a senior citizen with no kids or grandkids and not technology knowledge.
