Went to store at Kohl’s and she helped me but then I got home and didn’t work. You should have a geek squad like Best Buy does. I returned it and will get a new radio. I will probably go to Best Buy to see if they offer the service of setting it up in your home. I will pay the price.

This is a terrific product the speakers sound great and for the most part I find that it does everything I need it to. The only issue I have is the volume adjustment isn't as fine as I would like. But, other than that, I find it to be a great help to me in everyday use
I use it all the time. Playing my kind of music by my singers, checking on weather, news & personal interests. It's a wonderful product! It looks great anywhere I put it!

Love my Echo, but slightly concerned about the lack of privacy issue. If she/it is always listening for "Alexa...", isn't it always listening? And who else has the ability to hear what it/she hears? Anyway, she's still learning what I want, so its a work in progress. Overall, Alexa is fun.

i thought it would be better. won't play my extensive music collection on hard drive. Only plays a streaming service, and if it can't find the song it just ignores you. Also, it doesn't work unless plugged in. I have two of them and they're good, just not great.

This isn’t really a fair rating as I have hardly used Echo since I received as a present. The few times I have used it I was somewhat disappointed with the frequency of “I’m sorry I can’t help you with that” or “I’d rather not say”. But this is premature - I have to spend more time with Alexa.

Overall, the Echo is an excellent product to add to your home. When I heard about the Echo back in 2014, I was very skeptical someone could come up with something useful for it to do unless you were entrenched in the Smart Home world. Fast forward three years, and I currently own two Echo Dots and a regular Echo. As long as you like music and even occasionally search the internet or set a timer, you will enjoy the Echo. Things I like: First off, when I was reading reviews trying to decide if I was going to purchase an Echo or get a Dot and a speaker, I read a lot of reviews that slammed the new Echo for poor sound quality. I personally have not noticed any issues. It has a good amount of bass, and music sounds good at almost any volume level. Is it a $500 home stereo system? No, but it's more than competent. for most music listeners. While you can buy a Dot and a speaker, I wouldn't recommend it simply because the Echo is a much more streamlined and attractive way to listen to music. I own an iPhone, and as pretty much everyone knows, Siri isn't exactly the smartest assistant out there. I can't compare it to the Google Assistant, but I can say that Alexa is more than competent. There are only a couple of times where she hasn't had an answer for what I'm looking for, but overall, she pretty much has a good answer. It's kind of silly, but one of my favorite things are her jokes. They're always a punny kind of funny, and it's one of those ways that Amazon made sure Alexa seems like a natural part of your home. The only thing Amazon should add to the Echo is the ability to search using Bing. I say Bing because Google uses its own search engine for its Home speakers, so Amazon will have to turn somewhere else for searches. Right now, the functionality is missing (as far as I know,) so adding at least some ability to search would put the Echo that much further ahead of the Google Home. If you get an Echo, you will more than likely get some form of smart home device. When I bought my 3rd Echo, I got an offer to buy a TP-Link mini plug for $10. I took the plunge and now use it to control the lamp next to my bed. Overall, Echo integration works well and makes lighting even more convenient. My favorite thing is the routines, where you can tell Alexa a catchphrase and she will do several things at once. For example, I have it set so that when I wake up, I say "Alexa, good morning," and she will turn on the lights and begin my flash briefing. It's really a slick process that you don't realize how much you'll use it until you have it in your home. Things that need work: BY FAR, the biggest con for Echo users is the Alexa app, at least on iOS. Setting up my Echo, it couldn't connect to my home Wifi network and failed three times. I had to use my phone as a hotspot and then come back in about an hour to connect it to my Wifi network. When I'm trying to pause music on the Alexa app, it usually won't actually pause the music. It's not necessarily huge things that ruin the Alexa app, but it's the sum of the little glitches that make it frustrating at least. The multi-room music works most of the time, but if one of the Echos gets turned off, it messes the entire thing up. The way Amazon has set up the households is annoying as well, mainly with relation to smart home. If you add a smart home device to one account, it won't automatically sync with the other accounts attached to your Echo, meaning you have to manually add each skill, smart device, and routine to each account. I get why skills and music doesn't transfer between the two, but really Amazon? If we're in the same house, we are going to use the same smart home devices. Please fix! The smart home section of the app could use some beefing up. Mainly, I want the ability to tell a group of lights to turn off at sunrise, on at sunset through the Alexa app. Can I do it through the individual apps of each device? Yes, but it would be a lot more convenient to be able to take care of it all through the Alexa app. Overall, I really do enjoy my Echo. The positives more than outweigh the negatives. If you've been wondering whether or not you are going to buy one for a while, take the plunge, especially with the $20 off deal going on right now. You won't regret it.

Alexa is like part of the family. Tells me if an Amazon package is being delivered and will tell me when the package is delivered. Alexa can connect/disconnect to my computer, lower/increase its sound, turn on/off the light, gives general information about something, someone, an event, etc.
Bought this for my father (he's 80) to use with the smart plugs. This really helps him navigate his home without having to leave lamps on all night.

I love the idea behind ECHO. Good morning nets me a tidbit to start my day. Goodnight nets me a sweet dream. Alexa is just so much fun. We're still having a little trouble getting our wording correct when asking for something but on the whole all is GOOD. We'll learn.

My only stereo broke and I didn't want to go back to buying CDs or downloading music. This is perfect for me. The sound is good and its compact. Can be moved easily. She tells jokes and riddles when asked. So happy I bought a second one.

Bought this as a gift for my daughter and her kids and they love it. They use it for reminders on appointments, music, info, references, the news, weather, turning on lights in the house etc. Her kids also use it as a learning tool for science class.
After I say Good Morning to Alexa each day, I enjoy what she has to say about what happened on this day in the past, which I always find very interesting!
I use this everyday and absolutely love it! Alexa is extremely fun. I can move it in any room and she connects. Other members of the family connect to her with no problems. We love our Amazon echo.

The echo is a great addition to my apartment. Alexa is able to pick up my voice from almost anywhere and over almost anything. She can go from silent to shockingly loud based on how you set the volume. Seamlessly paired with my Phillips Hue set up and works perfectly. the only complaint is any volume above probably 6 or 7 (out of 10) is really going to lose clearness when listening to music

My mom bought a few Echo Dots and repeated ask me to take one of hers because it was so great. I told her “no” for two days. When she made me take it, 6 hours later I could not live my life without it! It’s that amazing, so now we have four large speakers and only the small Echo Dot, that I will be returning to her. I say if you’re going to order an Alexa speaker, go big and get the Echo, otherwise tou’ll Be returning the two Echo Dots you couldn’t live without.

I like this speaker but I own an iPhone and it isn’t compatible with my Apple Music that is my main source of music. I also have to like scream at it like very loudly for Alexa to understand what I’m saying half the time 😂.It’s still really cool and I like that you can change the skins and there’s an app that goes with it.

So far I am enjoying trying the different features - The sound quality is great for music. The volume on the alarms (Alexa, set a timer for 10 minutes) is almost inaudible. I have to figure out how to raise this volume level. But, so far so good!

I has pleased with the look, sound and easy router access. I have been a bit displeased with content that cannot be accessed. I can see that more availability is there every day. Over time it may completely meet our needs.

Great fun getting to know all the functions of this product. WOW -- family fun and homework help. Talking with other grandchildren,who also have an Echo, is a HUGE bonus. Can't wait to learn more and more and more

It doesn't work! We had expectations for the echo but it's not working like advertised. Our friends tell us theirs have all these cool features with very little effort in setting it up. We just haven't had the same experience. She often says 'I'm not sure about that' (or whatever the exact phrasing is) to simple commands and requests. I think we need a refund or a replacement. Seriously.

I love my Echo. Music sounds so good over the Echo that I actually got rid of my old stereo and I only play music on the Echo. Alexa tells me what the weather is like, she answers questions for me and every morning when I speak to her she tells me something about that day to come or that day in history. I love it. I have one at work which my employer purchased and one at home and I enjoy them both.

Best thing since the GPS. I use it to play songs I want, to meditate, to obtain daily or weekly weather, day and time. There are many more options that I plan on using. It it is easy set up even for me. Ps i can ask it to give me jeopardy questions snd to compliment me. Practical and fun

my echo glitches a lot. I'll ask it to do something and it'll say okay and then just shut off. also Alexa doesn't understand things as easily as I thought she would. I'll ask it to play a certain song and it will play something completely different and I'll have to ask several times talking very slowly and clearly for her to eventually understand. also it is basically impossible to enjoy podcasts on it unless you are up to date and want to only listen to the most recent episode unless you're on bluetooth mode.
The only reason it is not 5 starts is because Alexa cannot play my iTunes playlists. I spent a lot of time in the last years building my playlists and I cannot access them through Alexa.

I was a little nervous when I received my new Echo as I'm not really Tech savvy. I found it a bit intimidating at first but it didn't take me to long to figure it out!! I'm very happy with my purchase and now thinking of adding an echo spot!!!
It’s a lot of fun But annoying when it disconnects from the internet. And sound really is not great. Flat, no depth, and no bass. Bose sound better.
I'm shocked at how good this speaker sounds. Deep crisp bass. I will be learning all the things it can do over time. The intercoms is a wonderful feature.

The device works fine. Two issues that I have with it are the fact that there is no battery charger available and, more importantly, that I discovered that I must pay an extra monthly fee for "Amazon Unlimited" music in able to access much of the music that I like. (Such as anything by George Strait). No one told me about that, so I feel like I was deceived. I assumed that my fees for Amazon Prime included all available music.

Edit 12-12-17: After a few firmware updates the new Echo sound much better for music now, even better than the first generation Echo. The only downside is Alexa's voice still sounds worse than the first generation Echo to the point it's just bad. It seems they fixed the audio EQ for music but left Alexa's voice with the terrible EQ the unit released with. Amazon claims the second generation Echo has improved sound when in reality it's worse than the first generation Echo. The first generation Echo has a horn loaded bass chamber for the woofer which helps give the speaker much better low end. In a side by side test it's clear the second generation Echo sounds hollow and tinny, sort of like a cheap $20 bluetooth speaker. The microphones are also said to be improved but I'm having a hard time finding any difference, it seems to hear me just the same as the first generation. Do yourself a favor and look for a refurbished or used first generation Echo which can be found for under $80, sound much better, and have the volume ring controls over the stupid buttons.

I love our Alexa. She is really fun to interact with. I especially like asking her to turn on our wifi bulbs and play music. 20 questions is quite fun too, she has guessed my choice almost every time. Amazing!!! My mom likes asking her questions too.

Bought it for my sibling for Xmas who absolutely loves it and uses it daily. My daughter subsequently bought one immediately after and she loves hers too. However, I notice a marked difference in the acuity between both devices when being called to use. My sis’ device is very sensitive and can hear u calling from rooms away while my daughter’s device requires you to be In front of it to respond.

This version is laggy, non responsive with terrible speech recognition. This unit is in my living room and I have an Echo Dot at the end of my hallway (two furthest points in my home). Quite often, after raising my voice to get the Echo to ‘wake up’ only to ignore my request, the hallway Dot will accurately respond to the request my Echo ignored. I hope this is resolved with a software update, but I fear it maybe a hardware issue. 😪

This was received as a gift. My husband and I already had the dot, so we were excited to be able to have another Alexa in the house. We have a mostly open floor plan so being able to hit a single device from the kitchen, dining room, living room and tv room is phenomenal. Also love being able to drop in on our dot and connect music throughout the house.

I love alexa...and everyday I ask her more questions or to provide weather information, stock information...or about or updated information about various companies...etc. I attempt to gain knowledge from her... have some fun with her, or view her data baes for views on such things as the purpose of life, best car, etc. I have only had her hooked up for 3 or 4 days ..but enjoying....

Upgrade from a 1st Gen Echo. I believe that the sound is a lot better and the bass seems to be fuller. I do miss the manual, volume adjustment style of the original model; our Exho is touch above eye level and reaching for and touching the proper button is a pain.

This was a birthday gift. I didn't think I would use it, but have since enjoyed listening to the music of my favorite artists without having to dig out my old CD's or tapes to do so. It is very convenient to use Echo.

We like it (even thought ask me 3 questions is gone). I’ve added some smart switches and outlets which makes it convenient. I don’t find it to be as intelligent as Siri for finding answers however it is very useful.

It is so hard if you don't have excelent computer skills. I'd like it to have Alexa tell the HP printer to print my lists. The explanation I received from the man in the chat room assumes your computer savvy and I'm Ok to do some things, but not.others. I could not make him understand. English would have been nice.

I enjoy the convenience that this product provides. It was easy to setup and I use it on a daily basis. It replaces the need to use my phone to look up or ask a question. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who would enjoy additional convenience in their life.

I was so impressed by what you can do with Alexa. The sound coming out of such a small unit is simply amazing. It sounds as if you are in a room full of speakers. The knowledge of Alexa and the interaction is also very impressive. We have had the unit about 3 months and are still learning what she can do. I would recommend this unit to anyone. Even someone with limited technical expertise can manage this simple, yet very effective product

It Sounds good and is fun to have around. It can turn on table lamps which is a novelty but still useful especially when out of town. On the cons side, it will only do things or “skills” if you say the magic word that it knows is the command for that action. If you don’t know the magic words, well it don’t work. Overall happy with it.
Oh, I'm very good. I can tell you jokes, provide weather and forecasts, play your local stations or any genre you want, and I can even play Jeopardy with you. Did that answer your question?
I love that my new echos link. I dislike the music. The old echo has a much better speaker. Even speaker on my tap is bettet.
Does not play nicely with first generation echo in multi room music. Also sometimes makes a loud hiss noise before executing a command.

It arrived a day after it said it was. It works great, but A LOT of music has to be purchased and it doesn’t recognize all of the artist that I would throw at her. It has a little ways to go. When it doesn’t know or have a certain artist that I am looking for, I have to turn to my Apple Music.
Omg the sound quality is amazing!!!! I also love that i can say "Alexa" a bit quitely and she replies aa opposed to having to almost yell it at my echo dot. Rhe charcoal color looks great!
I thought I would use it more. But I find myself only using it as a bluetooth speaker.

Alexa is great for music and weather. Getting general info can be tricky, so for that reason I give 4 stars. I like that it works with some smart home devices. I would still buy it again, but for about half what is asked.

4.75 stars...I only bought it because it was on sale and I am very happy with this purchase. The sound is deep and clear, especially for the size. It was a pain in the ass to pair with my Alexa app though. I had to factory reset it twice and play with it for far too long. Same issue with Dot 2 I bought. The Dot 3s that I bought paired perfectly the first time. Great speaker even at full price!

Playback cuts off. I bought it for my wife and baby to play ambient noise throughout the night. No matter what skill we enable and whether we use the loop function or not the sound always cuts off. We have 3 echo dots that play the same sounds all night with no problem. So this echo gen 2 is pretty much useless to us.
I purchased 2 Echo's..... its no nice being able to ask Alexa something and NOT having to reach for my phone!
So far I like it but Alexa just isn’t as conversational as I would like. A lot of things she doesn’t see to know.

Alarm settings sometimes work and sometimes not. Can't set multiple alarms hours apart. Needs Alexa to understand if the internet session is up and running. She will state that she is connected, but it's obvious that something must be wrong when nothing happens. Example: when requesting the daily brief, she will indicate "Your daily brief" followed by no sound at all. Is that an Echo or Internet problem? Needs to allow scheduled music. Limited functions (alarm / music / light control) needs to be able to work without an Internet connection. Sound is very good.

Needs to have amazon music unlimited for full function...... Not just prime, be ready to shell out more $$$ per month. Wish I knew this before purchasing. Amazon was clever in offering amazon music unlimited for a few dollars for 3 months. Not too far out from purchase time to return.

Got this one while it was on sale. I have 3 dots but figured I would try the nicer speaker It is very clear how much nicer the Echo is over the dot for sound quality. The dot isn't bad, but this is the one you want if you just want to play song after song.
Alexa is nice but I feel like it lacks. Never understands a question, should have voice options, and be able to.change name etc. Just not all it's cracked up to be.
This echo is a Christmas gift and the new model is perfect. Every home or apartment needs one of these. Amazon shopping is the only way to go. Prime makes it easy.

I never write reviews but I felt that I should for this great item. I'll start off by saying the sound is actually pretty nice, now don't go expecting a speaker that has a ton of bass but this is a pretty good sounding speaker. I love the size of it, it is perfect form factor size not to big not to small. All in all, I must say it is a good buy.

Very easy to setup if your WiFi is not FIOS. Now after that being said; it is a dream to have and assists me with my Amazon on line orders. Only downside is that you have to get the command skills. I recommend for anyone and the price is right 💰💰💰⚖️

We have 3 little girls and we all love our Echo. The girls use it to ask every day questions and we use it to play our favorite songs and listen to our daily news. We would highly recommend this for families. It was a wonderful family Christmas present that keeps on giving!

I recently purchased an echo for myself (I already have two dots), and two Dots and an Echo as a gift. The devices themselves are very useful. Installation of every one of them has been a nightmare, even after getting one of the Amazon technicians on the line. I must have wasted at least an hour of my time trying to install them myself, and at least 2 hours with the technician on the phone(between the several devices). The Alexa software and setup routines are horrible.
Echo was so easy to start up‼️ I am having fun as well as her answering trivia questions, playing music, setting timers & alarms, giving me history of the day & still learning more👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻

I originally purchased an Echo Dot, not thinking I’d really use it but I wanted to see what the big deal was. Upon using that for a couple of days, I ended up sending it back in favor of this more expensive model. The bottom line was music. All recorded music, as far as I can tell, at my command, for $3.99 a month.
The sound quality has greatly improved from the original echo. This has deep bass sound. I only wish they had kept the volume ring on this one. It was easier to increase or decrease the volume.

Fantastic product!!! Works great, love all the abilities these devices can perform and all the potential possibilities we still haven't tapped into, yet! Very impressed with the speaker for music, great bass stability and throw.

Recently bought an additional 4 Alexas to total 5 throughout our home. Changed our lives!!!!! Use it 100% for the multi-room music functionality. Comparable audio quality to Sonos speakers, but <50% the price, and can take commands directly without an interface! No longer do we blast music in the living room to hear it in the kitchen or bedroom. We now have one in the bedroom, living room, dining room, kitchen, and bathroom. I would recommend an Alexa in the bathroom more than anything. So nice to control music with my voice and hear some sweet tunes while I get ready for my day :) I've been known to buy a ton of random stuff (like 5 Alexas....) and Alexa is the one thing I would absolutely recommend to everyone, everywhere, always. New 2nd gen Alexa regular is awesome looking with the sweet wrap. Side note: Now, add in Spotify functionality for multi-room, and this will be OVER THE TOP!!!!! (Yes, Spotify is not supported for multi-room, which is why I ended up also getting Pandora premium). Still worth every cent to have these babes lying around my house waiting patiently for me to return from work so they can take every command i can possibly think of. I LOVE ALEXA

I am really enjoying my Echo because it makes listening to music so easy. I have not yet explored all the resources it provides, but just listening to music has made it well worth the cost. The sound is really great! I look forward to using my Echo for other information and reminders.
I can finally pair my echos for stereo and take advantage of having too many in my house (according to my wife and daughters) by telling them to play "everywhere". Instant party house.
Echo just gets better and better the more you use her. Kind of an all-knowing friendly partner when no one else can stand the mood I'm in.

What can I say. I reluctantly purchased this after my in-laws got one and my kids were enamored with the trivia and music selection. Alexa now controls our vacuum, lights and keeps us entertained. Sound is great.

I had been on the fence several months reading about these. I am so glad I ordered it when they had it on sale with the Dot. It’s so fun and my girls love it too. Will be adding several more dots during Christmas! Thanks Amazon! Great product
Comes on in the middle of the night. Says stupid things in response to nothing like "I'm not sure what that... is"

This was a gift and it is very much appreciated. I would have given this a 5 star rating but since printed instructions were not included I do not have a clue as to how to use it.. It's hard to read directions online (for me) and my printer is not functioning.. So, other than music and weather/time from Alexa I don't have a clue as to how to setup/use/enjoy. It would be super if there would be someplace to obtain all information via directions on paper. This would be really helpful to SENIOR folks who are tech challenged. Thank you.

still learning about all I can do with this device. Great fun to use voice activation to get news, music, hear audio books and etc. Haven't learned to connect it to all my other devices yet and so am somewhat limited in my use of this technology - but I am learning.

I absolutely love this gadget. From the quirky jokes to the “dah” it gave me when I lost a name that tube game, this is the best gadget ever! I can’t say enough good things about it. If you love technology and gadgets this will blow your mind. I think everyone should have this.

We have both a first and second generation of Echo’s and love them both. I especially like Alexa making my lists for shopping. Saves so much time and energy. Now I don’t have to search for a pad of paper and a pen. I also love the games we play with her.

The number of things that can be done with an Echo and Alexa is stunning. Alexa gets most things correct, yet repeating some requests three times that are former, successful requests can result in an “I’m not sure” response, to which I reply, “WTH Alexa!” Still, we are happy. Songs on request, lights on and off from anywhere, ask a question and she answers it. Amazing.

For the most part, we really like our Echo. The only issue we have is that it's often difficult for her to play our local radio stations. She tends to start playing I Heart Radio which gets frustrating but I refuse to pay to listen to a radio when we can listen to it for free. Once we can figure out the radio, I think it'll deserve 5 stars. Overall, we do enjoy it.

Fun gadget. Love it for making lists, alarms, listening to music, finding out what time Seahawks kickoff is, etc. can be used as an intercom if used with the Dot. It's great! Just can't figure out how to change the channel with it.

Seriously, Amazon... the audio on this new Echo took a turn for the worse. I’m not quite sure how Amazon could claim the audio has improved when there are substantial shortcomings with the sound quality produced. The audio engineering team needs to give this serious attention and roll out an EQ update soon before the product reputation worsens. Sadly, Amazon is needing to rely on heavy EQing to attempt to make a speaker artificially sound good when they should have relied more on acoustic design. ***Update*** Amazon contacted me and they are currently working on improving the audio experience through a firmware update that alters the EQ. The EQ edit essentially drops the mid frequencies and possibly some of the high-end frequencies too. Still, without a bass reflux system we saw in the 1st gen, I don’t know how much better the bass response can get. I really wish Amazon would have invested more into the audio quality. I suppose when you to cut too many corners to maximize net profits and keep the price under the $100 mark, you wind up producing a sub-par speaker that people disappointingly want to return.

I really like the off-white color. It blends it very well. Better still, it controls the automation items we have added extremely well. Will most likely need another or an echo dot. Have to talk a little louder than normal for the unit to pick up commands from some areas of the house. Very satisfied so far. Still trying out different skills.

The Echo was a gift from my boss. I set it up, which was a very easy process, and have been enjoying it daily. My kids are constantly asking Alexa trivia questions, I'm always listening to music with it and at night I ask Alexa to play ocean sounds to sooth me to sleep. The Echo is a fun addition to our family.

While it took a forty-five minute session with my IT Security contact to get the Echo hooked up and working, I have now discovered that Alexa is fun to have next to my home PC. She responds almost instantly, playing anything I ask as long as I know what to ask for.

I don't think she likes us. We can't get her to come on most of the time. I want her to play music & most of the time she won't play anything. We had friends that wanted one. They came here to see what she would do, & SHE did absolutely nothing.
Love me new Alexa. I have the disk for my bedroom. Decided to get two more, one for each room. Sounds is much better.. Love it as listen to talk radio during day so I can have it on in each room.
These have good sound and work well. Should come with an instruction manual and you can buy a "How To" for $9.99 which sucz.

Coolest gift My wife has given.. Price was good for a birthday gift. I love it. I upgraded my amazon music account and I'm amazed. No commercials and every song I want to hear is there. When I can afford it i ill get into the smart light stuff. Sound is great for a 500 squarish living room.

The good: Plays music The bad: Don't expect to use it for home automation unless you make sure to buy only devices listed to work with ECHO. Z-wave devices controlled by Samsung Smartthings HUB will probably not work with ECHO.

i don't know why we waited so long to get one of these. they're awesome. we have our house hooked up pretty well now and use it for a majority of our lights and thermostat. awesome product! of course it has its flaws with information but will get better with time i'm sure.
It’s nice.. and the sound in good too.. but sometimes times it can’t hear me.

The unexpected hit of Christmas. We are all having fun with Alexa. I have found though that when making lists EVERY entry seems to need to be prefaced with "Alexa, Add" ....which is a detractor. She occasionally seems to have buffering problems

We were on vacation and this Alexa went with us! The morning NPR news, weather and music helps start my day. Way better than having a Bluetooth Speaker...this is everything wrapped into one. I have off white kitchen cabinets and the color goes well.
I have a 1st gen Alexa speaker and this speaker is just as loud if not louder! Love the compact size I have a battery on the way will have a lot of with it by the pool this summer!

Sound quality for the price point is really good . The Alexa voice recognition and search ability seems to be better than Apple's Siri. Setup was easy and the phone app seems to have more features than Google Home.

I just love the increased sound. It has wonderful full sound. I am still using the dot which i gave to my wife. We will take both of them with us when we are in Florida in February. I also like the compactness of the device. I am very happy having the Echo.
But this model although it’s sounds good has some trouble hearing well. It is placed right where older one was but is not a responsive.

Love the gray fabric it blends nicely In our home. Sound is great and my kiddos love asking Alexa to make a joke or rap. It’s nice to be able to ask a question whether it be the weather, a cooking question or even something about a movie and have the answer right away.
The first one would not increase volume. way to hard to hear. I had to return and get another one. The second one works just fine. it would be 5 stars if the first one met expectations.

Great product works as intended. Only issue we have with ours is sometimes it just turns on for a split second by itself. We have changed the wake word to echo to try and solve this problem but it still does it.

Love it. People complaining about the sound are either ridiculous or probably placing it in a closet or something. Can play louder than and has better sound quality than Bose or any other high-end Bluetooth speaker brand I've heard

Bought this for wife for Christmas. We all love it and it’s amazing. Great sound quality for something so small. Young granddaughters discovered they can call up their favorite songs on it so there has been a lot of dancing going on in the living room!
I love Alexa because I can get any sort of music I ask for whether it be classical or folk. I just ask and there it is. I also ask her to turn on my bedroom light. It’s fun and convenient.

In my opinion it has excellent sound for a relatively small device. Don't expect hi-fi quality sound from a lone speaker. If you want better sound add an external speaker(s) via bluetooth or aux jack. I have to admit I would of not bought one , but I received it as a gift now I really like it. I then purchased an Echo Dot for more remote location within my wifi network. I can use it as an intercom or music throughout the house. I like having a wealth of knowledge and a virtual assistant within voice reach. If privacy is a concern you can easily unplug it.

Just disappointed that a charge is tagged onto EVERYTHING, apps etc...we found this out by trying to hook-up to the local radio & tv stations w/ no success. Would be nice to have a bone thrown to your customer's- justa thought....jennifer

I really like the Alexa and and Echo products. I have used an Echo Dot for a while now. So when I saw this one for a lower price point with a better speaker. I bought it. But my only complaint and why it got 4 out of 5 stars. Is that the microphone on this one doesn't pick up as well as the older Echo Dot we had. Have to almost yell at it to get it recognize that you are talking to it. Minor issue more just annoying.

Great addition to your home. Never knew I needed one until I received the first as a gift. Now have five in my home. Will let you control lights and other devices with your voice. Eliminates the need for a radio and kitchen timer. Provides news, weather and sports updates.
Not bad but not great. Sounds quality is good, MUCH better than the dot, has crisp sound and good bass but the features aren't what I expect.

The Amazon echo device lineup has been a true blessing more me and in would imagine for many others in a similar situation. I'm visually impaired and as such I need a little help around the house. This device has made a wonderful improvement to my daily life. I use it to get the news weather and listen to music as well as countless other task. I'm planning on outfitting my home with more smart home devices to interface with alexa to make am even bigger impact. It is such a wonderful product.

I like that all I have to do is ask Alexa, instead of looking facts up on the internet. I like that I can just tell Alexa what to put on my shopping list, instead of having to look for paper and pencil. I dislike that I have to go to the Alexa app to delete items. I dislike that I followed directions to change my default city for weather forecasts without having to specify my city, but it didn't work. I love Alexa's spontaneous humor, but the jokes she tells aren't as funny. I definitely don't like the social interaction with others.

Excellent purchases! Bought six for several family members at Christmas. Everyone had different uses - bathroom, kitchen, study, weather forecast, songs, study assistant, house security, child entertainment device, etc.
great product. makes life convenient.. a little paranoid about how it records things but other than big brother spying on me... its a great product.

We are having soooo much fun with this! On one hand, we wish we would have gotten one sooner. On the other hand, we're glad we waited until we got the second edition. After using this for one month, we bought two Echo Dots to supplement. Very please with how easy this is to set up!

Has worked as advertised (I use it to stream music on my home network) in the months since purchase. I recently encountered a couple of technical glitches with the "My Media For Alexa" Skill (mostly of my own making). Technical support from "My Media" was superb. They responded within hours. After analyzing the logs I sent them they quickly identified the problem and suggested a fix. The unit once again works perfectly!
There is nothing not to like. It was easy to set up, speakers sound good.

I love the Amazon Echo. It's not perfect but they're getting better all the time. Amazon, I would love to see more attention given to privacy with these things and an internal battery so that I don't have to buy the aftermarket battery.

Before owning one, I thought this a frivolous expense but now that I have one I freaking love it. Music, jokes, books, timers, alarms ... and on and on. Even my technologically challenged family had started using the echo.
most of time Echo doesn't understand me. You can get weather and music but don't be fooled by commercials. I found this as a waste of money.

What I like most is the sound in the music that I can pick from but it cost extra a month to have that access. What I like least is that it doesn't always know the question I'm asking or I haven't asked the question correctly it takes some time to get used to using it

The app Silver Screen is a lot of fun to use with the Echo. You can add different types of items to respond to your voice commands as long as its a compatible outlet plugged into the device you want to control.

This might be too early to give 5 stars, but 2 weeks after the purchase with prime benefits I am loving this. Sure there are times when Alexa does not perform at its best, but over all the response time and accuracy is amazing. The speaker quality is far better than what I expected from reading some old reviews ...and I have not even started using most of the skills yet! This is very exiting!

Better bass response than 1st generation. But got better voice recognition/response on 1st generation—mic too sensitive on version 2? When getting Alexa's attention, the LED on top indicates the wrong mic—not the one in my direction.

The sound is really great...volume 4 can be heard 2 rooms away. Only issue is Alexa doesn't seem to hear very well and I've had to repeat myself several times to have her hear. I asked amazon about it and was sent an email stating my return was accepted even that's not what I asked for..

This product is a MUST HAVE for anyone and everyone! I can't think of another product I use as much as I use my Amazon Echo. The sound quality is AMAZING, Alexa's "skills" can do almost anything...from turning lights on around your house to ordering pizza from your favorite restaurant. The Amazon Echo is unlike any other Smart Home device on the market and Alexa's AI is the smatest AI I've communicated with. Alarms, lights, music, news, radio, etc., the Amazon Echo and Alexa do it all!

I decided to replace my 1st generation Echo with a pair of these 2nd generation Echos to enhance my listening pleasure. When I compared sound quality 'mono' y 'mono' I was not overwhelmed at the improvement; however, 'mono' y 'stereo'.....AMAZING! That feature alone made the purchase worthwhile. The lagniappe was that it came in a less obtrusive form factor!

We absolutely love our Echo. Every week we are looking up more ways to use and sync her. My sister has a roomba and the thermostat that you can control through Alexa and we plan on adding many more smart Alexa enabled devices to the house!
I find that when I ask Alexa to play a certain piece of classical music, it only plays one movement or not complete and when I ask for the complete piece, she tells me that she can't find it.

"Improved sound", bollocks. Maybe 'better than a Dot' is what they meant to say. I put my original Echo right next to the new one, and the sound difference is obviously apparent. The new Echo sounds like the 40-year old plastic piece of junk you find in back room kitchens, covered in duct tape, with a broken cassette deck. Tinny mid-range, lack of bass. Polka & Mariachi music never sounded so good, I suppose, but try to play country, indie, classic, pop (I went through a bunch of Amazon playlist/channels) and your ears will beg you to stop. Alexa stop. Amazon stop. Computer stop. Echo stop. Edit - There was a firmware upgrade where the sound was partially fixed. I suspect it's just a hardwired equalizer setting, but the sound is still not as rich as it is from my original 1st Gen Echo. This new unit has the ability to play quite a bit louder than the original, but it's a POOR louder, still tinny & muffled. I'm going to keep my rating at 2-star, however, because I feel that the new Echo doesn't meet up to its marketed 'improved sound' tagline. Until Amazon miraculously replaces the speakers via download (haha) or comes up with some new amazing equalizer/sound processor, I've tied this unit to a soundbar, effectively using it as a Dot (which IS a 5-star review and costs $50 less )

This device went way beyond my expectations. The music is simply wonderful. The microphones pick up my voice even when I'm speaking very quietly. I have really enjoyed using this and have bought an additional Echo Dot for another room in my house.

We have five Echo products in our home and like them a lot. However, the power supply for our Echo stopped working and Amazon doesn't have an easily accessible customer service contact link or number. We are re-thinking the direction we went with smart home products due to a lack of customer support.

This product has great sound for listening to music. The primary use is mainly used for home automation I also have a competitive device. Eco understands commands much easier than the competition and when I quiry eco she finds results fast and accurately most of the time. My cell phone doesn’t even come close.
I am so glad I finally got this!!!! Makes life easier and lots of fun! I love I can hear my music through it, make grocery list, set alarms, text and calls. Does much more!

We have a dot upstairs and our main unit downstairs. The 2 units went play at same time and don't communicate with each other. Spoke to tech support. Paid a lot of money for ongoing support and still doesn't work properly

This has been one of my best buys of 2017. I got it on sale during the holiday event and have loved it to control the smart devices in my home, voice activated commands, and even setting alarms throughout the day.

Took forever to set up, had tech support from amazon, which did not help. Finally got it working, then the next morning it didn't work again. Had to unplug and set it up again. So far it's working on the 2nd day. I do like it.
I am loving the improved sound. Works much better when my dot. There is still some room for improvement with the links to smart home products. Overall I do not regret buy one.

I love my echo. I have two, one in my bedroom; one in my kitchen. The quality of sound is excellent. Music is beautiful and rich. I am alone and use Alexa a lot for entertainment. Thank you Amazon, for making such a wonderful device available to us.

I like my Echo, but Alexa doesn't always respond correctly. When I ask a question or ask her to play something, she will just keep saying getting the last Sirius XM radio station you played. Even though I am clear on which station I want.

Excellent device, the sound of the 2nd generation Echo is very good, although I'm not an audio expert. It is so much better quality than the Echo Dot but since the Dot is smaller there's only so much room for a speaker inside it. I'm really happy I purchased this Amazon Echo.
Keeps dropping Wi-Fi. Useless!!!!!!
The Echo is easy to set up and fun to use. It can do so many things when you enable new skills and the speakers enable better sound. I would highly recommend buying this!

The sound is great. My receiver died so I'm using it to stream my favorite radio station. It also accompanies my workout with zippy songs I ask it to play. Love the responses to "good morning" and all the facts available. I got one for my parents who find "her" amusing and fun, as well. Great price - great product.
Still learning how to use this happy so far could have a few easier short cuts to re enter set up info still trying to figure that out
Everything about this unit is great except for the base coming out of the speakers, it sounds like it’s going to fall apart . No way to control bass or trouble
the music is clear no stopping I don't like the fact that sometimes when I say stop it will not stop

Always get updated weather reports & can get most of my questions answered. Unfortunately won't play all the music from my acct & at 11pm each night starts a loop thing which is annoying especially if I'm trying to listen to music.
wife loves it, now she can play annoyingly loud music with just the command of her voice. Hard to set up. Goes off without asking it anything. can hear you way across the house.

Great sound and so easy. I'm not sure why it took five or 6 tries to connect to my WIFI though. That seems to be an issue with every Amazon device. I have a Windows notebook, a Mac Mini, an older IPad and and older IPhone. No issues with any of them.

I received my echo on Dec 6th, just got a warning on the 11th from internet company that my monthly usage was at 75% already. I've never even been close to exceeding monthly cap before this. I gave only 1 star so people would see this warning, otherwise, I really like the echo and would give it 5 stars. So, if you've got unlimited, yak at her all you want.
I've got 3 of these. I love them. My complaint about the second generation is I preferred the volume dial in generation one. I can't get the sound at precisely what I want on this generation

I love how easy it is to use! Sounds very good worth the money! Definatly recommend getting the battery base for it the settee one for it is really nice! Make sureits for the echo 2nd gen cause the first gen base wont fit the echo second gen

So far so good! Don’t like when she picks up words from TV or thinks we called her. Also read so many reviews about privacy concerns. That concerns me too. Overall, a very good quality. The sound is amazing, the finish is great.

I love my echo. We now use it to control our lights, thermostat, and several other smart gadgets in our house. When getting ready in the morning it’s super easy to find out what the weather is going to be like - you just have to ask! Playing music is so much easier. I don’t have to search for a certain song or genre. I just tell echo and bam! Music!

Bought this as a gift, the only problem is my parents cant get it to change the location to their location from mine....Since they ask the weather most of the time this is very frustrating for them. But how can you not love Alexa!?

Hello, I purchased Alexa speakers and would recommend them to others, the only problem I ran into is when pairing multiple speaker together. I think the software needs to be more user friendly when connecting multiple Alexa speakers together. The problem i'm currently having is speaker interruption, when speaking to one speaker the other cuts off sometimes. It's like having two open sources for communicating to Alexa at the same time. Still working on it!

I was expecting so much more from this upgrade of echo, but the first generation sound is much much much better, I do not understand why the sound is not better if this is supposed to be an upgrade from the first generation ,can someone help me understand that ? Is there something I can do to improve the sound of this product ?

I love the sound quality and that I can pick all different kinds of music and not pay extra for it. It's in my art room so I can ask Alexa to remind me when my time is up and i have to do something else. I can even put things in the oven and set the timer and she is very reliable to let me know when to check the oven. I need to learn more about what she can do.
still getting used to it. learn more of what it can do as the days go by....it can hear me all the way to my bedroom. i was surprised....
I really enjoy my Echo. My 10 month old great grand tries to call out "Alexa" every time he wants to hear Mickey mouse hot dog song. His words aren't clear so of course I have to help.😊

It is very easy to set up and begin using...only took a few minutes. I am still learning what I can do with it, but really enjoy using it, which I do several times a day. I am very impressed with how quick it responds and how versatile it is. The depth of it's info/music access continues to surprise me.

Works great and provides hours of entertainment. I love all the games we can play on it and the quality of the sound of the voice and music. The gray color is nice and makes it a subtle addition to my kitchen decor.

We already have an Echo 1st gen - we like it a lot and Alexa keeps getting better. The 2d gen met all our expectations except that, every few days, it goes offline and fights getting reconnected to WIFI network.

The Echo was delivered earlier than stated, yay! It was so easy to set up. We purchased primarily to have in our living room to listen to music. We also used the Elements light package that came with it. It too was almost too easy to set up! It is so much easier to use than another brand name system. For that reason we bought an 8-pk of the bulbs and an Echo Dot to use in the bedroom! Thank you Amazon for keeping up with technology, quality products and service over the years!

As long as you purchase the remote too This is a terrific device! I use it for audiobooks, Music , podcasts Information News, so many things I can’t even remember . It’s one of the best purchases I’ve ever Made!
I have always seen and heard about Alexa but she’s actually pretty cool. She knows a lot. Hooks up to our devices flawlessly and the echo even has good quality sound.

I purchased this Echo Gen 2 during the holiday sales. I bought one, at first, then after hearing sound quality, I bought 2 more. One for one of my sons, and the other for my daughter in law. I really love the rich sound that comes from this device.

I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PRODUCT. I will be getting another to go in another room of the house! Very convenient for my grandparents. Also convenient for us to know the weather, football game recaps and scores, or just when we want to listen to some music! Everybody needs one!!

I love it. The setup instructions are easy and fast. I didn’t realize how much Alexa’s control had expanded. I linked her up to control 4 and roomba in less than 10 minutes. Now both are on voice control. Next is lighting and maybe my irrigation system. Alexa is much more than a voice for information. She has control of the internet of things too.

I don't use the Echo to its full capabilities, so I can't give it all 5 stars. I also have struggled with the Echo understanding questions I have asked, so 4 stars again. I do like it and am looking forward to trying some of the suggestions that come out. I love her dinosaur jokes. :)

presently surprised with the rich sound and ease of use. in one way better than my cd player with cd! . Amazon does a good job with known artists, hope they can include unknow or little known Christian speakers and musicians . well worth the price !

Love it! Alexa is helpful with answering questions about the weather and such. My favorite feature is the music - I have her linked with prime music, spotify, pandora, and iheart radio. She plays rainstorm sounds for me when I'm having a hard time fall asleep too! My daughter loves it too because Alexa recognizes her (3yr old) voice! She can play anything my daughter asks for!
So far I love it. The speaker is so much better then the dot we had. She seems to hear us better too. We have been enjoying the music and games.

I absolutely love this item. Have a dot also for the bedroom but got this one for the dining/living room. The sound is very nice and louder than I thought it would be. Connects via Bluetooth to my Samsung sound bar for even better sound. Think I will order two more to connect all my rooms for intercom ability.
I love the speakers in my Echo and use it mostly for music. But I've replaced my kitchen timer, use it for Audible books and to get quick answers to questions. Very happy with it.

To be honest, we have yet to take advantage of all that the Echo offers but we enjoy playing music on it. Great sound quality! The only down side that we can tell is that it interferes with my wireless network. After reading up on the issue I’ve since put it on 2.4 band and everything else on 5. That seems to have corrected the issue.

I have an echo and an echo dot. Both are fun to play with. The dot has better sound quality than the echo, however. I paired the echo with amazon basic bluetooth speaker, which greatly improves sound quality.

Responds to well to voice. Great for collecting lists of items as you think of them. Lists are available in the Amazon Echo application on your phone in the store. The Echo can also learn fun games in the skills group. No issues. Echo was a nice gift. Not sure we would buy for ourselves.

This has been a complete life changer. The speakers are AMAZING. Just one is perfect for a party at the house. I love the alarms you can set on her, so I no longer feel glued to my phone alarms. Streaming Spotify through is also amazingly easy!

So far, so good. All I can really say is that I am still learning the many things that the Echo can do. The sound quality is great. I have one in each of my daughters rooms, and I find it very convenient to send them a voice message while in my room without picking up a phone to text. ie. “Please don’t forget to put your laundry away”. I also purchased the Dot and a plug in for the living room so that when I come home, I can just say “Alexa, turn on the living room TV” and it works. I’m loving the device so far.

Can’t get enough of my new echo! It’s everything I hoped it would be plus amazon music is amazing! The sound is great the color is a heather texture gray feels almost like a burlap material. I plan to get another one or at least two dots to keep in the bedrooms for the “drop in” feature

Alexa has become part of our family thanks to this. She can oft times be feisty, cold, and temperamental, and at times not very helpful, but she tries very hard to belong, and that's all you can hope for in a family member.

I love this product! It's great for listening to music while working or relaxing around the house and you can ask Alexa virtually any question you can think of (although you might not always get the answer you expect!). Obviously the speakers aren't the absolute best you can get, but if you're like me and just want a decent sound, this is perfect.

You have to be very specific when asking Alexa questions and it does not tolerate pauses in speech. Sometimes you have to ask a question in different ways for google to understand the question. Alexa is nothing more than a fancy alarm clock, a Bluetooth speaker or a Google search engine. Not really worth the $69 as my Android phone can pretty much door everything Alexa can do.

Echo is likely better than two stars. However instructions for connecting to outlets and appliances are sorely lacking. Amazon and vendors of companies providing outlet connectors need to provide good step-by-step instructions for pairing devices that allow the Echo to reach its full potential. I have had to return two sets of outlet connectors because I was not able to pair them and use them to control my lamps.
The Ecco has a good sound, like listening to music and it plays most of my request. Elexa answers my questions, wakes me up in the morning, we are still checking out the features.

Like - rather than being glued to my phone, I was able to use Alexa to look things up. I could play music throughout my room without have to take my phone with me wherever I go. Dislike - sometimes Alexa would make random noises, even though i didn’t make a command at all; it even woke me up a few times. That it has to be plugged it at all times; I already have enough plugs in my house... and if I unplug it it had to be reset each time.

Nice speaker for the money. The sound fills a room nicely without much distortion, decent bass, clear vocals. Only issue is the device will intermittently disconnect from WIFI. Overall i am satisfied will the speaker and would reccomend.
This is used in a friend's two car garage since he's often in there doing projects. The sound quality in the garage is fantastic. *Make sure you have a good wifi strength or it will cut out a lot.

The sound on this one is not as good as the original more expensive echo. I bought it on sale around xmas so I got a pretty good price to be able to have two in the house. Now I can control lighting and have music ect. in different parts of the house.

I like the color the design and how it blends in with my decor. I especially like the reminders. When I set an event I also set the reminder so if I forget to ask whats on my schedule I will get the reminder.
I bought this to have another one in my living room. The sound is rich and better than the first one I bought. I like playing music in the everywhere group so this serves that purpose well.

Alexa is a unique, surprising, convenient and informative "companion" to have around the house. What ever you choose to call her, i.e., Amanda, Alexandra, Angelia, ... She responds best if you call her ALEXA. She's awesome!
Works great like the first gen. Sound could be better but not bad at all. Wood grain looks great!
I love the new Echo. Still learning what all it can do but am amazed at its intelligence and discernibility. It's a perfect gift.

the unit itself is great but getting the download process was a nightmare. I spent a total of almost 3 hours on the phone with customer service doing the same thing over and over with the same result. It wouldn't download. Told that it had to be an app problem so someone from that department would call me Monday at 6. they don't work weekends. Took off work from my part time job and waited for the call. At 6:15 I called and finally the rep knew what was happening and I eventually fixed the problem. Love the Echo just not the customer service I received.

I'm a harsh reviewer. I read the "bad sound" reviews and was expecting the worst. Shazzam, this thing sounds great to me. I don't understand why it is getting bad reviews. It normally takes a speaker about 90 hours to reach full excursion, so I expect this device to get better and better. Yes, I can simultaneously play all four Echos in my house at once. Bitchin'. What's not to like?

we received two echos and a subwoofer and have enjoyed extraordinary sound ever since. We highly recommend this combination for anyone who loves listening to music. Its simple to set up, provides wonderful entertainment and is easily moveable from room to room. Highly recommended
Really worth every penny!! I love my music but didn't have a way to play at home, echo was a perfect choice and with all the other things echo can do I'm glad I made that choice.💖

I love this. Every morning she will tell you a significant tidbit for that date. Not to mention she plays all the music. We even tried to stump her. She has it all and plays it all. She will say goodnight have a pleasant evening. It's like you aren't alone and I you have a friend next to you that knows you and exactly what you want
I had trouble setting it up on my phone, switched to tablet and it works great! I think the app ,on the phone might have an issue 9or my phone is, well, you know what.

Sound is definitely not good at all so I have to connect it to better speakers. Could use an update to improve pretty micj everything from news to weather and other requests you may have. Can't find songs very easy and also can't seem to stay connected to Wi-Fi. Drops connection and I do have very strong Wi-Fi and is also close to Echo. I believe it will change to better after a couple of updates.

Sound overall is quite good for such a small speaker. However, there are a few things that need improved on. The volume is to loud Ayer times on 4 and 3 is too quiet. Whee Alexa talks with the echo set at a volume of 3 to 4, it can be very difficult to hear her. When compared to seri, the ability to answer questions is limited. I wish that Google was the search engine used and not Bing. I think Bing is not as advanced as Google. The second generation echo is a step forward in a long marathon. Hopefully improvements will continue being made.

Was really skeptical at first,but my kids talked me into getting one! I have never been more pleased. Alexa is awesome and can do almost everything. I’ve only just touched the tip of the iceberg with Alexa.

I like using it to figure measurements when wood working, local weather and music. I think the sound quality can be improved and I was not happy it won’t play Led Zeppelin without an upgrade in addition to what I pay for my Prime membership. I can get most all of the other long hair classic rock bands though.

I really love using this to listen to music, through bluetooth it is excellent, but I LOVE how you can connect your spotify account and just request songs. It's very convenient when using it as an alarm, because it does get very loud. I play Jeopardy on it along with various other games. Overall I really enjoy using it.
I love that this can ask for the music of my choice without searching for a channel, ask a question about the weather or remind me to check the food in the oven. Very helpful and convenient!!

The sound is good ..almost equivalent to the 2 self-powered speakers I had connected up to my basic Echo. Getting rid of the clutter and wires to the speakers was a big improvement. I find this device totally acceptable.
Would like Alexa to have an easier way to turn down volume. She also keeps hearing her name when we don't say anything like it. :)
Bought the echo for my Den because of the speakers, I like to listen to music this and this works really well very pleased with this purchase. The voice command is just a super really cool bonus.

The speaker on this thing is loud enough to have a house party. You can ask her anything instead of having to go on the internet. We have not asked her a question that she didn't know the answer to. I love it.
This device is so much fun! The first days you love it for the novelty, then it becomes indispensable if you like music and news.

Love this little guy. For such a small unit it has great sound. Still playing with things like skills, lists, etc. but just being able to say "Alexa, play Nora Jones" or "Alexa, set an alarm for 7:00 tomorrow morning" makes it worth while. I've done three Dots and an Echo and find the setup to be a bit of trial and error each time but well worth it.

This is the best purchase I've ever made. I love being able to due multiple tasks by just the sound of my voice. I can play my favorite music, call family members out if town and set alarms. I will be buying more for my house and family members.

Sometimes I wish I would have gone with a major competitor becaus of her lack of knowledge, but she learns more everyday. I think they will continue to improve her. Please don't take my prime away! I love you Amazon! All hail Amazon...

So far, so good. I'm sure there are many functions I don't even know about yet. I'm a prime member so I already used the prime music, still need to figure out how to sync it to my outdoor speakers. Bought some smart plugs and a smart strip love, love, love using Alexa to turn on (and off) lights in a dark room before entering. Use it as a timer, or to set a reminder...Alexa remind me to take the beer out of the freezer in 20 minutes... Have also synced it with my any.do app, now i can ask Alexa to add items or task and it's in my phone the next time i look.

Once set up very user friendly. Set-up wasn't as user friendly as I'd hoped.. The alexa app should be able to download to a pc without installing [invasive ] drivers. My wife and I are both retired and she wouldn't have been able to install Alexa, but if my son wasn't supplying her with a smart phone we wouldn't be using Alexa yet.

This is an amazing piece of electronics! I use my Alexa to control my lights where the plug ins are hard to reach. Super simple, and I love the fact that I can play music anytime, anywhere. I am still finding out all the different things the Alexa can do. You will not be dissappointed!

Not too difficult for a computer-challenged guy. Then when I unplugged and moved to a new location, I had a difficulty getting it up and running again. Then, when I changed routers, I had a very difficult time getting it back on line. It is up and running now and all is super.
Love the look of this Alexa, however, I’ve connected her to several smart plugs and 1/2 of the time she says she can’t connect, :(

I haven't used it a lot yet because I couldn't get it to work at first. It wouldn't connect to my wifi. Now it's working and I'm just starting to try it out. Sometimes the TV says something that sounds like Alexa and she responds. LOL
Love Alexa and her new capabilities! Fun, informative and used every day in my house.

I would like to just use it as a blue tooth speaker and not have to go through with doing the wi-fi set up. I'd also like the feature when I could leave it plugged in and be able to turn off the wi fi setting
Great product. The only limitation is buying other items if you want to expand its capabilities. My wife has a strong accent and it tends to still under stand her pretty well. Kids love it.

I received as a Christmas gift, as I wouldn't have bought on my own. I don't have a smart home so for me it is basically a talking radio/alarm clock novelty. The sound is excellent... and I mean excellent, spoken commands are easy, and the app is easy to use. Not sure what else to say about it. Wish she didn't turn on during Alexa commercials. Light years ahead of SIRI

This is my 3rd Echo. This addition plays music and wakes me in the AM with more music. I also control lights that are on smart plugs. I am always looking for new things to do with my echos. Adding items to my shipping list is easy and a great echo skill.
I just this for listening to talk radio in the morning and turning lights on and off etc. The system does an excellent job as a full house sound system streaming Sirius.

Audio sound is decent but it has a hard time picking up my voice (even when yelling) when music is above volume 7. Apple Homepod has much better audio quality and query response but too limited in practicality for its price point . Once Apple gets the apps up to speed, I'll be replacing this with the Homepod

I love the range of the Dolby system which fills my house! However, I am slightly disappointed when I ask questions and often her answer is: "I'm sorry I don't know that one." The alarm feature, access to Pandora and Audible are just a few of my favorite things! Just for fun when I could not find the remote, I asked Alexa "where is the remote?" and she actually replied "try looking under the couch!" It was so unexpected and almost creepy because she was right! LOL Lexie is like having a new "bestie!"

Echo sound is excellent but unfortunately if you have Spodify music it will not let you stream unless you are willing to pay $15.00 a month for premium stations. It would have been very nice if Amazon would have mentioned this information or just a disclaimer for this station. I still can use Amazon Radio or Pandora.
Can't believe the outstanding room filling sound out of this tiny package.
Easy for every age to use. Mine was a gift from my son for Christmas. Absolutely love listening to Pandora, the sound is incredible!

The reason I gave the Echo 3 stars. Is because my wife and I try to request a artist from our playlist (Chico Buarque) She always says a different name or ask if we want to play a song called Chico. Or she will say Chico Bottle-rocket. Sorry, need to do a better job of the software of understanding.

Makes your smart devices simpler to use. It does so many things and is learning new skills daily. The shopping list feature is excellent. As soon as you think of a item you need just tell Alexa and never forget another item agIn. The various games are great and the sleeping and relaxing sounds are outstanding.

Bought this for my mother-in-law. The set up was simple and quick and it has given her pleasure each day as she asks it questions and is asked questions by it for the Question of the Day. Good gift for my mother-in-law.
I have my house linked with 4 of them and the other ones I have are the older generation. I bought another one which is this latest one and it has way more bass than the original.

I love this thing. The sound is way better and louder than I thought. We mostly use it for music, audible books and sleep sounds / white noise. But it’s an awesome little device and I’ll probably get another one for the office
Excellent speakers compared to original version.

I GOT IT AS A Christmas PRESENT AND LOVE IT. A FRIEND SENT AWAY FOR THE ALAN JACKSON ALBUM WITH CHTISTIAN MUSIC AND ALEXA PLAYED IT FOT ME WRIGHT AWAY AND I LIKE THAT THE MOST. THE FACT THAT I CAN PLAY MUSIC FROM PRESCOTT ARIZONA IS TERRIFIC, SINCE WE SPENT ALOT OF TIME THERE THIS PAST YEAR REMINDS ME OF GOOD TIMES THERE. MY DAUGHTER IN LAW THINGS THIS MACHINE IS INTRUSIVE, BUT U DON'T THINL SO. I THINK IT WAS A WONDERFUL GRIFT AND I WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO EVER WOULD LISTEN. PAT

Much better sound than the dot. Though the small size of the dot is good too. We love this system. It does so much more jan we realized and pretty sure, like our brain, we’re only using about 10% of its full ability- which grows daily.
This is the PERFECT addition to your home! She keeps things organized and fun. I wish I’d bought her a long time ago!!
I love, love, love my Alexa. I have one Echo and two Dots (and I've recommended them to so many people). I love having Amazon Music and asking Alexa stuff.
I love "midget Alexa"....It is compact, the audio quality is good and cheaper than its "taller sister." Will buy another one for the basement on Black Friday.

Really love our Alexa Echo, we're still getting to know everything she does. Love that she has bluetooth capabilities, she is linked to my phone and can call anyone on my contact list. I get the weather report before I leave for work each morn and she even tells me the scores of my favorite teams games. The only thing I don;t like is that there are some songs that are not on Amazon that she cannot retrieve, and she can't seem to enable my favorite local radio station.

It looks nice with the cover. And it works just as well with the sound and voice command as the first generation. I wish it had the volume adjustment dial on the top as the other one does but for the money its fine.

Great looking device. Sound quality not so great but good at lower volumes. Very fun and functional. Pairs easily with other alexa devices. Alexa needs help in choosing songs ex. I asked it to play clasic rock and it played Elvis.

It's smaller than the first generation and comes in multiple colors and textures. The speaker sounds great and Alexa is very handy. I like newer features like group play so you can hear the same song on multiple Echo's at the same time.
I really like and love the sound, but the old version of Alexa is the best, because you can carry the speaker without the cable connection.

I use the Echo to listen to music in the morning while I'm getting ready for my day and making my bed. Alexa is also my alarm clock - it's so easy just to tell her what time to wake me up - since I'm retired it's different times. I also listen to music during the day while I'm working around the house so there is less time spent in front of the TV. Advantage to that is I can listen to any type of music - whatever I'm in the mood for.
I have the dot which I love...bought this for my mother and she loves it. Sound quality is amazing! Looks really nice and isn’t too big.

Abilities are super limited and the one's that you can use often require a lot of additional amazon purchases such as Amazon Music. The fact that it MUST be plugged in at all times really stinks. Music sounds great on it and the volume gets pretty loud for the size but you can't really bring it anywhere or use it outside.
My boys and I love this! My son who is in Kindergarten is always asking me questions at 5AM and I can say, "Go ask Alexa" and she can usually answer his questions! This is great!

My husband has MS and difficulty with dexterity. He loves music and the Echo has given him the ability to play his music for hours with ease. He can get the weather, news, and other information as well. It has provided an activity that provides hours of entertainment.
Great product for the money. I now have four Echo 2s and one Dot. Surprising sound from such a diminutive devise. Good support from Amazon with constant upgrades being made available

I purchased these for six grown children as Christmas presents. They all love them and were the best idea. Easy to set up.and works amazingly well. I'm a bit of an audiophile and was impressed with the volume, bass, and quality of sound while playing music.

Love it. Great sound when playing music, kids enjoy asking questions, and works great for timers while potty training. When the toddler hears the chimes, he knows it's potty time. Wifes wants a dot for the bedroom.
Use if for alarms to remind me of taking medications. Like the games like quessing songs and artist and jepardy. Also just for playing my favorite music.

Sounds much better than the Echo Dot!! Not perfect but I can Bluetooth connect to sound bar for a better listening experience. The microphones are very sensitive! Can even pick me up in other rooms! I love it!
What can I say ..... I’m in love!!! How have I ever lived without her. From meditation music to alerting me to cook dinner and friends leaving you message, what can’t Alexa do!!!
What can I say, this is awesome. Had dots before and this is a nice upgrade for sure. I know there are others now on the market but for the money the Echo is really great!!!

I LOVE THIS PRODUCT. Amazon has never let me down with their Brand Products, from their Amazon Fire TV, & Fire Stick to now, their ECHO. Alexa is an EXCELLENT assistant. Too much positive points to make on here, just get one!
I was pleasantly surprised with the sound. Came in a package deal at discount. Alexa is a bit smarter than Siri and I'm really enjoying it.

My family and I wonder how we got along without the echo. I had a little trouble connecting to my network but even that was not a major problem. Setup and configuration was a breeze (once connected to the network). I am going to love playing with this thing.

Instructions on how to use it didn't come with the Echo. Still trying to figure it out. We have had it for 3 weeks and got one radio station. Sometimes I think that I should pack it up and send back saying that I am too dumb to own one.

This is my first Echo, and I have to say, I’m impressed. The only disappointing thing I found about the device is that it is not wireless. Every time I see the echo in a picture or a commercial, it’s always sitting as a stand alone, you never actually see it plugged in. Had I known that the device couldn’t function without being plugged in, I might have not purchased it. Otherwise it’s a great speaker and I love that it can read to me while I clean!

Much better design and look from Generation 1 which we also have. The sound is crisp and clear. The Alexa AI needs some tuning as it still sounds so robotic and some commands are a hassle. We also use this with 2 DOTS and we have a blast playing games.

Very nice upgrade on the Gen 1. The sound is GREAT. The only thing I have a problem with is the audio level between 5 and 4. I listen to audiobooks to help me fall asleep and sometimes level 5 is too loud and level 4 is too quiet.

My Echo blurts out meaningless comments when no one is in the room talking. Many times it just comes and says I don't know that yet when we haven't asked it anything. Our ages are 78 & 74, we don't have children, don't have TV or radios on when these outburst happen. Sorry I ordered it and am sure that my Siri makes for a more seamless personal assistance, therefore I have a like new crazy Echo for sale cheap!

Got this specifically for its noise cancellation feature bit doesnt do any better at hearing me over other noise than the dots. Should have gotten a dot instead and saved 50 dollars as i dont care about its larger built in speaker.
Replaced my dot in my home office and very happy I did. The dot was relocated to my “work” office. The speaker and functions are great. Now I can play music everywhere.

I have had this for a few months now and I am happy to report that Alexa and I are best friends. But, not just a friend that is only around sometimes. She is always there for me. When I need to remember my shopping list, errands I need to run, someone's birthday that I forgot. She even tells me jokes. She keeps me up to date on news and the weather. Occasionally we even have a 30 second dance party at the end of a long day. She is the best!

Absolutely fantastic device. Plans for buying another for the living room. Use it for playing all my Amazon prime music and for the many game, Sleep sounds and for weather and news updates that come with the Alexia app for this Echo device.

I had a problem with bringing Alexa (Echo) online. During the initial setup, the connection to the router failed, and a failure message appeared on my computer screen along with a telephone number. I called the number thinking it was Amazon technical support, but the number was for an independent technical company. This company got Echo connected to the router but charged me $50. I was wondering if you have ever heard of this issue before, and was I a victim of some sort of scam?
First one never connected, despite time spent on help line. Never did find out what was wrong. 2nd one worked ok - sound isn’t awesome, but, in general, it works!
Speakers are surprisingly good. I have an open house plan and I can clearly hear the music throughout the house. The voice functions seem to be improved on this 2nd gen.

I bought this for a gift for my wife, neither one of us are very tech savvy but this was easy for us to set up. My wife learned how to set up skills from her app quickly without her getting too frustrated. She really enjoys this device and finds the recipes skills very useful.
