Deeper sound and visually pleasing for any decor with multiple options to change covers. Enjoy the convenience and updating that continues to enhance enjoyment from Amazon products. Excellent!!!!!
Awesome with my ne hue lights. Just wish it supported multiple commands. Kind of annoying to have to say Alexa everyone you issue a command. But still great
The easy customization and handling of vocal commands are phenomenal. There is a delay when connecting via Bluetooth. Overall, this is a game changer.

The Echo (2nd gen) is just an incredible device. There isn’t a day that goes by that I don’t “use” it in some way. Music, alarm, directions, questions, shopping, etc. I’m sure the Echo will only get better so I’m looking forward to updates.

Overall I really love the Exho. Sound quality is good and for the most part it understands my commands and responds accordingly. The one problem I have had with it is getting it to play a song repeatedly but that may be due more to how I pose the command than the Echo itself.
Have not had this long enough to give an in depth review, but so far it has been amazing and fun. I very much like the variety of music and how quickly Alexa responds. Still learning!
Fun to play with. have to get used to what I can ask her. and, yes, she only answers to Alexa! I had an SNL Senior moment with her name. Watch the video on SNL!!
My old Alexa stopped working after several years. The sound on this one is superior, smaller unit size, no twist top volume control. I really like her!
So far I’m loving my Alexa. It’s very helpful and learns simple things. It also works well with Ecobee.

I am sure that if you have a number of devices connected, this item might be useful, but we don't. There is only a mild entertainment value to asking Alexa questions and getting her sometimes informative and sometimes humorous responses.
Love the convenience of adding things to shopping list. Would really appreciate the ability to put list items into ‘groups’ for easier reference when shopping.

Echo is a very limited device. It’s strengths are playing music, anouncing the weather, playing short clips of new or NPR. It lacks the ability understand the same range of commands as Siri. The hands free aspect is nice, but it hasn’t really made anything in our life more efficient.

I like that it’s hands-free and I can give it a command from any place in the house but I don’t like is it doesn’t recognize a lot of music that I would like for it to play Four instance if I ask Alexa play American Indian flute and drum music she doesn’t know what that is

It has really good sound and lives up to my expectations of what Alexa can do. It's very convenient to be able to ask Alexa questions, to play certain music, and it is absolutely awesome to be able to continue reading my Kindle books by having them read aloud by her!

Nice little gadget. Nice sound for its size to the average ear. Listen to music quite often, enjoy most selections available. Information requests are usually accurate and inquiries mostly acknowledged. Recommended to friends and family.
Great sound for a smaller echo. Love the multi-room capability with all my Echos. Works great with many smart home devices. I still have much to learn.
Seems to work well and we enjoy it, but it is one more thing that allows intrusion into your life and who or when they intrude seems to be an unknown.

I've been an early adopter of every Echo. The latest one is quite sexy, but I think the voice reception is a little worse than the 1st gen. Perhaps it's the cloth cover? Either way I love Echo...Alexa manages my whole house!
I love the dynamic sound very good I would recommend this product. The change I didn't care for was the push button volume control. I prefer the ring adjust volume control.
Wonderful! So fun! Plays any music you want to hear. Plus jokes, weather report, and much more! Great speakers and sound quality!
If you like resetting, and fiddling with this glitchy device, then this is for you. Wayyyyy overrated.
Great speakers and Alexa never has a problem hearing you. $49.99 on Prime Day through Amazon Warehouse Deals! I would definitely purchase again!

I LOVE this thing! We got this with the dot and smart outlets. I am so excited about all of it. Fairly easy to set up and I love that everything connects to each other. We actually gifted quite a few of these for Christmas. I would most definitely purchase again!
Love this item.Use it a lot.
Music....love this for any type of music I happen to feel like...the so uh no is unbelievable. Can't ask for any more.
We have about 5 Echo devices now, and bought this one because of the improved sound. I love that it is a progressively more feature rich device that my wife and I use all the time.

This is a great product especially for those who enjoy listening to music. Of course without purchasing the music plan choices are limited. Voice recognition rarely a problem and not too many questions that Alexa could not answer. Wish there was a wireless version. I’ll wait for that to purchase a second Alexa for second floor. Buy it and I’m confident you will be as pleased as I am.

I absolutely love the anazin echo, alexa has her own spot among the household. I only hope they keep innovating this product into more mobile ways, I would love to have like a small personal headset or like a bluetooth phone that has alexa integrated into it, pair it with my phone for data and have alexa on the go to review our grocery list while at the store, or quickly make a reminder while I have my hands full driving.
Third one we have purchased enjoying the ease of turning lights on and off using tp-link products found on Amazon.
Looks nice but the audio is much worse than original or even Tap. Very disappointing.
Alexa doesn't work as well as I thought it would. I only use this to listen to pandora... not impressed. Great speaker tho
I like this product. It does a lot.
Love this design and after reading reviews I was afraid that the sound was going to be crappy but this little thing puts out some nice sound, am very happy with this product
Alexa is amazing! I listen to music again all of the time! It is so convenient to just ask Alexa the weather and news each morning while I am getting ready. Best $80 I ever spent!
I have a 1st gen and love it. This new version just made alexa a more accessible part of daily life.
This thing will do it all. Helpful with just about anything. Get one for your students to get the homework done.

I have the Dot that I like so decided to try the Echo 2. I was hoping to get better sound for my music. This Echo definitely delivers very good sound. I am very happy with it. I am still learning to connect the two.
Alexa is a great tool to have. It's getting for a fast pace life or to entertain guest. She places music and it has great and loud sounds.
I love the new look and the sound quality is great. This is my second Echo and fits perfectly with the decor in our nursery.
Works flawlessly, easy set up, and quite decent audio. Amazed at range of skills Alexa displays. Buy one, you will not be disappointed!

Our family loves this device. It has brought a lot of entertainment and ease of use for all of us. The only area of improvement would be to make the speaker sound quality closer to the quality of a bose or sonos. Otherwise, extremely intuitive.

This is my 2nd Echo. I got this one for my office. It woks well. As with my other Echo, it seems to have trouble understanding at times, but you just need to repeat the request and it seems to get it. Would have given it 5 stars but for this having to repeat the request some times.

I finallyngot it from stopping the constant disconnects, however overall I find Alexa favorite response to be "I'm sorry, I don't know that". Even when asking things that you guys send to me as suggestions. Fun device but really in its infancy.
I like this thing. I listen to the news everyday and ask what the weather is going to be like for the next day. If I don't know what's in a recipe Alexa tells me when I ask. It's great.

Love the echo. The only issue we have is sometimes Alexa doesn’t compute what we ask her. If volume is turned up, it’s a challenge to turn down during a song. We love that not only can it tells us the weather, play our favorite songs, it can even call family members! Really happy with this purchase.
The only difference I found between this and my prior Echo was the output jack for external speaker playback, the unit it self doesn't sound any different than the original model.
Enjoy the improved bass - first generation was too treble. Wish there was an equalizer feature in Alexa

I am just getting started with my Echo but I am satisfied with it so far. I like the sound very well. I also like the wit the software package has. What I do not like is that when you open the device with the word Alexa it closes after the slightest pause in your command and you have to reissue the command again. Difficult to compose or add more than one item to a list. other than that, I am very satisfied.

I have purchased 3 dots and a first generation echo and now the 2nd generation echo. I was satisfied with my first echo, but Amazon has not lived up to its quality in sound. You dressed it nice with the cloth veneer but I rather have better sound. I am now wondering if I should even bother about buying the echo show. I would hate to invest that much money and be disappointed. Overall I think Alexa is great but you got to deliver what you promise!
Awesome sound! I got a discount on purchasing two speakers. So, I gave one to my sister. She loves the Echo! Also, set up was easy. I’m very happy with my purchase! Watch out Bose. :)
Alexa does not hear as well as the 1st generation. I also like the volume adjustment ring better on 1st generation. Otherwise same as older version
Alexa is my new best friend. Sets my alarms, plays my music, turns my lights on and off...she is like a personal assistant. Highly recommend!
My daughter and son-in-law got this for us for Christmas. I love it!. I use it a lot for a timer and to play music and get the weather. I wouldn't be with out it now.
I use my Echo for basics: Time, playing music, news, resources I have not purchased the lights, etc. due to costs
Luv it she does everything! Sound is so.much.better than the Echo dot.
We gave our daughter, in college, an echo for Christmas and decided we needed one for our house too. Very nice design and works great.
Having some issues with proximity to echo Dot. Dot answered before Echo main unit which is much closer than Dot.!

echo was good but the app is a "p.o.s." two weeks in and the app music feature so I can stop or turn down the volume is gone. I got this for my senior parent to listen to music to go to sleep and not wake her buy going in to her room and tell the thing to turn down or shut off. worked great for 2 weeks and now all it has on that screen is what you can tell it to do.
I am just getting to use it and it is fun to use. The negative is that there is a learning curve as in many electronic devices.
The Echo's ability to respond to voice requests, and audio sound is great for a speaker of it's size. If it had Google's access to global information it would be excellent.

the product is flawed. now i've wasted away an hour of my life trying to get it replaced... this particular alexa is flawed and on other occasions i've found amazon is impossible to get through and keep your sanity

I have a love affair with Alexa. Echo is downstairs, controlling my smart bulbs and door locks, and playing music and podcasts. My Dot is upstairs lulling me to sleep and waking me up in the morning. So easy to install and control by either voice or the Alexa App. I am finally embracing technology
Wish I would have purchased a long time ago. Linked all my WiFi bulbs and outlet to it. I feel myself getting lazier with every command :)

Pretty cool but pretty pointless.. I mainly bought it for music but in order to play a specific song you must purchase Amazon's music service. I went ahead and did so but Alexia constantly does not recognize the song I am looking for. I do like the sound quality but that's about it. I still find myself using Google assist from my phone and think my money would of been better spent on a nice Bluetooth speaker.

Met all my expectations, sound is great and the microphones are great. It was really easy to set for the first time with the Alexa app. Setting up smart plugs and fire devices to it was simple. Would recommend to anyone looking to set up a smart home or that would like a hands free speaker. I feel that as time goes on you will see more integration with more apps and services.

Excellent device, easy setup, loads of useable helpful skills, great sounding speaker, and alexa is just plain fun to use. The speech recognition is amazingly accurate. I have yet to request a song or an album that Alexa hasn't immediately found.

ordered as a gift loved it so much I order one for myseld.

I have two echo dots and adore them. My only complaint was the lack of volume if I wanted to listen to music or my audible books. I ordered this because of the positive reviews regarding the volume and sound quality.. I have not been disappointed!!! Love my Echo (2nd generation) and will definitely be purchasing another for my family and also keep it in mind for gifts!

I have been listening amazon echo 2nd generation for last two days to satisfy myself that I have purchased a superior product, say a speaker powered by dolby as claimed by amazon! Is it true? Being a customer, you would always like to have the quality you have purchased should be at par with contemporary speakers available at $100 like JBL flip 4, Ue boom 2 etc. But, however, the quality of 2nd echo generation is not good enough though after recent firmware update the quality of sound bit improved especially vocals. I don't know how software updates could help improve sound of echo (2nd generation) further marred by hardware limitations.The lows and highs lacks definition and bass. I wonder why a company like amazon ( a big big company) has to fix problem by releasing software updates just after the echo launched. Its very unfortunate when company consistently promise to deliver by saying big words like true immersive 360 degree room filing sound on next generation speaker, but actually its not. If, you are a music lover, you may not experience immersive sound quality with detail, however, music ith prominent vocal, podcast, radio etc. are very good. Actually, my expectations were high from amazon. Totally disappoint.Planning to return it.

This is not very smart AI. I've asked it a lot of questions and the only two it could answer were simple math questions and a very generalized prediction of the weather. It doesn't seem to learn or give consistent answers either. In case I didn't enunciate well enough or word my questions in a way that AI couldn't determine what I wanted, I asked the same questions to my google phone app, and it has answered every one correctly. For example, what I thought would be an easy one for an Amazon related AI was "What is the title of some of the books written by Adelle Davis?" The first time I asked, Alexa answered with something totally unrelated. The second time, a few days later, she said she couldn't answer that one. The third time she said "If you want to see the books on your kindle touch the book tab and then touch show all books". Google listed three of her most sold books and indicated she had written others as well. I asked Alexa "Which President of the United States was a geologist" and she didn't know, but the google app on my phone not only answered correctly, it gave me links describing his geology career, when he worked in gold mines in Australia, China, etc. I've asked Alexa if a local store was open on Sunday and she gave me today's (Saturday's) hours. My phone app will tell me hour by hour when rain is likely to start, so it might indicate low probability until 11AM so I know I can go for an early morning walk with out worry. Alexa will just say something like "there is a 50% chance of rain today". I am guessing this is mainly designed to place orders on Amazon and useful for little else, but there is no way I would trust it to do that. I would be afraid I would ask for rolls of toilet paper and end up with a Rolls Royce delivered instead. I sure hope it learns and gets better with time.
Nice upgrades. Like that I can connect to my house sound system, although it has a nice sound with it’s internal speaker
I absolutely love this echo. The sound is fantastic! I tell everyone I know with an echo dot to get this echo if they like playing music. The sound is better than my Bose speaker!

I like that I can speak to Alexa and she does what I ask.......sometimes. sometimes. Even though I clearly say her name and clearly make my requests, she does not respond. For example, I am having a lot of trouble getting her to turn off around 6am in the morning after she has been on for about 15 minutes. She ignores me. When I try to turn her off manually that does not work either. Finally I have to just unplug her. These problems are the downside for me with Alexa.
I use it for everything from music, to questions I would normally google. I use it for cooking times and all. I've just bought a new one to add to my basement.

I hate to be negative about these Echos... I have Five (two shows a first gen Echo, Dot, and the new second gen Echo ) and I could *love* them. They go great for a bit and then all of sudden they can't understand commands they get right 200 times before that. Very frustrating. For home automation, I run the first gen Hook Smart Home Hub and the second gen Samsung SmartThings Smart Hub with a bunch of Sengled Element Programmable LED Smart Bulbs. The hook never misses a command but the Samsung has issues from time to time. It's super frustrating to be standing in the dark with a bag of groceries fighting with Alexa over the lights. I really wish the companies would get this crap right. It's just Z-Wave people. I wish the Alexa app was better written. It's slow, sloppily designed and details are missing. As a software guy... the flaws drive me crazy. It's just lazy programming. I'd love to get a refund on the first gen Echo as it's never worked right and every time I turn it on, it makes all the second gen devices stupid in my house. You can't fix it. There are moments I want to send everything back to Amazon. 3 Stars. Could be 5.

I used to have bluetooth speaker each room. After i have echo, i want to replace all my bluetooth speaker. I now don't need to use my phone to search for music, and don't need to walk to my bed in the dark after I turn off my light. Alexa do that for me.

This is an awesome device. The sound is very clear and the Microphones catch my voice from the adjacent room. A must have device for every home..!!
I thought Alexa was going to be smart. She constantly Says i dont know to my questions. All she is really good for is to play music and smart key if you hook it up.

I have three Echo's in my home, put in some smart plugs in several rooms for lights. Now I don't have to find kill myself going into a room in the dark. And being to play music... wow.. and stereo using all three. Alexa wakes me up, each day I find more stuff to ask.
It does everything I thought it would do. It makes it much easier to add items, and play different types of music. I’m trying to add my calendar,but I’m having problems. I’ll call support!

Love this item! I get the weather, news, music and so much more before I even step out of bed. It helps me when I need information. It can give me drive times. It just helps me in so many ways...even in the kitchen!
I really like this thing. Has great sound. Would be nice to have her start out a bit quieter, but that's not a big problem. Easy to use.
Great sound for its size. The mic works as advertised. You don’t gave to yell for Alexa to hear your request. Good bass and clear high end. We like it.
Every Echo/Alexa product that I have purchased deserves twenty stars. They are just THAT cool and work that well.

Sounds it good n crisp but for that price range i would of liked a more portable speaker. I like the design but what i didnt like is there is a rubber peice that blocks the AUX port and i find it kinda hard plugging in a AUX cord in becuase of it. That rubber peice is not nesscary to be there.
I don't have to move a finger to have Echo to deliver an outstanding sound quality.
This sounds great and works great! I bought a battery base with it to take it out to my back deck and it sounds great there too.
This is my 3rd echo i love them all, great sound and looks great, also very responsive and fun to use
This was a Christmas gift for my sister. She and her husband loved it so much, they bought two more! One for the oldest sons room and the screen version for their room! lol

Unable to link phone to echo. I havr seen many reviews about this and all had different phones from multiple manufacturers. Nothing has been done by Amazon. I would give you a 5 star review but this is a big short coming. I would like this feature to work but the icon to link phone on your app doesn't show up. Your Echo mentioned nothing about which phones would work or wouldn't. All phones should work. I feel kind of ripped off.

Love it! Sounds great and actually has some nice balanced bass output. Pretty impressed!
Somewhat limited on basic music. Seems like every thing we like has to be on a special music purchase that costs extra every month.

The music sounds great on this. Very loud full and and clear, not tinny like some music players. My voice picks up well from almost every angle in the room, I don't have to yell even if the music playing. The timer is handy and so is the drop in feature.
Like it quite a bit. She does get a bit argumentative and stubborn.

I’ve enjoyed Echo for setting reminders and playing music, but overall seems to be very buggy. I have to repeat myself multiple times before it either ignores me or responds incorrectly. Amazon has awesome products but the echo and dot are just okay.
Same great Alexa that we know and love. I have an older one too and this new one is smaller, sounds better and looks classier. Very Happy!
This device exceeded my expectations. This is the wave of future. It is a must have in every household. Very pleased I purchased Echo.
This is my second Echo and I like it. For me, it has nice sound quality. It is perfect for my needs in my small house.
Much better sound than my Echo Dot's. But all of my alexa devices work well together.
We love this! We listen to all types of music on this. We especially love it when we ask for silly jokes. Very easy to use. I'm glad we bought one!

My solution to listening to any genre music and asking for word definitions while I'm reading..

I purchased this item and could not get it to connect to the weii-fy, but the dolby speaker sounded really good, amazon fixed the problem and offered me a credit so that I could purchase a new one, thanks amazon!!!
So far I like it, I wish it would play all my music not just the Amazon that and requires a subscription to a lot of things to get it to play on my echo

Very fun to play with. Makes me feel fancy turning off and on the lights with a voice command. Great with Amazon music. It can actually make phone calls without the use of your cell phone. Send voice messages to your friends who have one also. Alexa is dumb as rocks and often mis-understands your commands, often to a comedic level.
Love my Echo. Still learning all the things it will do. Wasn’t able to follow instructions included in the package, but found a great one on U-Tube.
Bought on a whim, ended up buying 4 more. Use them every day!
They are the perfect gifts. I have 2 myself. I can’t wait to give them for Xmas.

I love it!!! Answers a lot of questions like what will the weather be today but so much more and Alexa is getting smarter as time goes by. Also plays music which sounds incredible, makes lists, calls to your contacts the list goes on and on.

This is everything that is good about Echo 1 and Dot except that the sound is stronger. I really like that the covers can be changed. If you can get only one, I recommend the Echo 2. It's the best of the three.
It's an amazing device, although it's yet another step towards total laziness...get all the information and music you want without ever getting out of your chair.
Placed this one in the kitchen, can talked to wife if in the living room though the echo's now. Music sounds surprisingly great through this one. Has a good bass sound.
LOVE it! If you have PRIME all you need to do is ask it to play whichever artist's music and voila! Clean the house while rocking out.

Love this thing! I think the sound quality is perfect (I'm not looking to blow my neighbors out of their houses with my music). Very satisfied with my purchase and would definitely recommend!

Second one we've bought. Great speaker. Excellent sound. The Alexa assistant definitely leave something to be desired, however. You can spell out songs for it to play and it won't recognize them no matter what you say, even though they are on Amazon music. So that can be frustrating. I assume the AI is improving every day. Looking forward to it being seamless.

I do really like the concept, and I subscribed to Amazon Music Unlimited. What I don't care for is Alexa's voice. It is very "bass", which makes her a bit hard to understand. I hope there will be some kind of "fix" for this in the future. The voice on a friend's Google Home unit is much clearer.

It is unpredictable as to working even with a very strong internet signal. Alexa has demencia. One minute you ask for the time and she is fine you can ask her 2 minutes later and she is 'not sure'. Help/support says it is my weak signal. I am two floors above and directly across the street from the tower!
I got one of these and liked it so much I bought one for my son-in-law and he loves it, too. Pretty good sound for music.

I received this for Christmas. I absolutely loved it for three days, then for no apparent reason, it lost its connection to WiFi. I have spent hours, trying everything Amazon suggested. In desperation I called the customer help number. The tech I spoke to was very nice, but I the end she had me repeat the same things I had tried already, with the same result. Now I am supposed to contact my internet provider and have them check out some settings on my modem and router. WTF? And she was unable to explain to me why it worked fine for three days. Since I received it as a gift, I can’t even return it.

If you do not have unlimited internet data, do not use Alexa, in 8 days she used over 25 Gigs of data, I did have it on music and news alot, but holy cow. I only get 20 gigs per month, and again she used a bit over 25 gigs in 8 days........I had to send her back, but did love her while I had her.
Bought it as a gift. My mom likes her 1st gen one but we decided to upgrade her to the next one.

love the many features of the Echo...music is great while I cook , the grandson loves asking it questions, perfect size for the counter, love the grocery list option ---now I have my list where ever I go!
Great little unit! The sound quality is excellent. Love this for playing in a large room. Connects easily and us ready to use almost right out of the box.
Great, much richer and room filling sound than my first echo. Looks so much better and feels more homely that the first also. Really pleased with this
I love my.Echo. The sound is impressive and Alexa plays whatever music I ask.
Alexa works while you're unaware of the motions and sounds , which are produced around you with Family and friends enjoying a cook-0ut, out Keep

It was working 100% fine until a few days ago when both left and right Echos completely stopped working? I have tried unplugging them over night, pressing the microphone & the on buttons simultaneously for 15 seconds, and nothing brings them back. Unless there is something else to try, I guess I will start processing a return.

Sound is excellent but I’m disappointed that I have to connect via Bluetooth every time I want to play music from my phone. Also bummed you have to have certain premium music subscriptions in order for it to play certain songs.

I love the 1st generation Echo, and love the 2nd gen even more. Not as tall as the gen 1, but the sound is more rich and it has better bass tones.
Easy to use. Fast setup. Hands free. Good speakers. Only down side is it doesnt have a battery so it's not portable.
This is my second Echo and I love how it helps me in the kitchen. I can set timers, listen to the news, prepare grocery lists, and get great music.
The sound is amazing for such a small device. We should of bought the deal for 2 so we could have one in another area in our home.
I bought this for my son for Christmas. I cannot say much about it to date. I just hope it works well for him.

not that smart. I speak fluent english and constantly have to repeat myself only to hear "i'm sorry..."

Such a great tool for the home. Love it for shopping lists timers reminders and controlling my redone smart home.

Not sure.It was a gift and my son's phone doesn't work with it very good. Needs a a new phone.
My 2nd one. I really enjoy them. I thought I would be able to Synchronize them but I guess they don't
I cant get it to connect to Wi-Fi - I tried at my office and at home. I am super disappointed. I got an Echo Show for my son and that works great. I am going to be returning my Echo. Boo.
Fun device. We use it mostly for music. Alexa seems to not have the latest sports scores which can be annoying but otherwise the info is good.

i liked the sound . what is troubling is that I paid extra money to have access to a million more songs. Sometimes it doesn't work. Ex. Alexa play Italian songs" .don't have or don" t understand. or play the opera Tosca, response "sorry I don"t have that.

The sound is great,BUT I am having issues because she constantly is telling me she doesn't have the answer to that question or she can't ever find music by whom ever. We have one at the office and it has much more information to give and can find just about everything asked of it. Not as excited as I thought I would be because I get more from asking google. Why can she answer the same question at the office but not at home?

When I first purchased this unit, it did not sound that great. It had too much bass and sounded poor at a low volume. Once I received firmware 599473720, it sounded a little better but it still needs some tweaking. I think it is still missing the mids and the bass needs to be reduced slightly. I think Amazon is getting better at tweaking this thing, however it still has some tinkering to go. The first generation unit was perfect in audio quality. Amazon should have never advertised this Gen 2 device as having better sound then Gen 1. That is a poor business practice that can ruin a company. I bought two gen 2 units and sold my first generation units because I bought into the hype of that statement. After getting the second generation units, I felt duped. Keep the updates coming. Just recieved update 601480920. Seems like it needs more treble. Audio is just not on par with Gen 1 unit.
My main problem is that Alexa cannot answer anywhere near as many questions as the google home can. The sound is great.

Ok...I'm confused. I've always considered myself somewhat of an audiophile. I've been listening to music for all of my 62 years, and have always been picky picky picky when it comes to the quality of what I'm hearing. I'm often told how picky I am. So....after reading the many many reviews of how 'terrible' the sound is on the Echo 2nd gen, well....I just have to sit back and scratch my head. I don't get it. Look....this isn't some high end Bose or Klipsh speaker here. I'm not expecting to sit here and marvel at the superb sound that some seem to think they should be getting. I listened to several songs from different decades, and songs that I know well, meaning the instruments and what I should be hearing, and how I should be hearing them. One song I tested was 'Crystal Blue Persuasion' by Tommy James. Again....I sat back and scratched my head. Asking myself 'what are they talking about. I did this several more times, and even got silly with 'Inna-Godda-Da-Vida' by Iron Butterfly. And then Jazz...swing...blues...etc, etc, etc. either I'm suddenly kidding myself...or many of you don't know what 'good sound is'. There is nothing wrong with this version of Echo. And yes...I have the latest firmware. For a 2.5 inch sub, and a smaller up firing tweeter, this is AWESOME!!! I wouldn't consider sending this back for any reason. Next...I'm gonna get the Dot for another room so I don't miss anything when I'm listening to my talk radio.
I love this! I wasn't sure at first, but it is great.
Speaker sounds good, doesn't require me to speak loud to hear my commands. Super easy to set up. Looking forward to seeing what else it can do
I like it. fairly east to setup except the calling and app. you need at least android 5.0 to make calls and was disappointed it does not access my email
I like how quick it is to respond and how it can hear you from other rooms in the house. It is also so convenient to have such a wealth of knowledge at your fingertips.
I love Alexa. It is nice not to have to stop what I am doing to turn on music.

It is working but not that smart. It can not serch much and hard to find free p songs on the web

I purchased this for my husband for Christmas, he has set up all the lights in the house, tv, computers, etc. and uses it for shopping lists. Sounds good, it has surprising bass for this size speaker. Well constructed and easy to set up with my wi-fi.

Love love love the Amazon Echo generation 2 it is now my calendar my news I have been very happy with the Amazon Echo and as far as people believing it works for the CIA well then I guess you better start living right no matter if you have an echo or not LOL

Great product, but don't give it someone named Alexa :) Someone told me that you could change name, but didn't need to as no one named Alexa.
Still learning about all the things the Echo can do, but so far it's great. The sound quality is very good and it is very responsive to voice commands.
Totally love my echo! Everyday I’m finding new things that Alexa can do to assist me with my daily living. Highly recommend echo!
I love this!! Alexa helps ,answers questions, and even tells me when something is wrong and where to look for help to fix the problem
Bought 3 as Christmas presents... all work great! Nine months later all units still working well and used many times every day.

Love it and I will say that I am VERY HAPPY that I didn't listen to those negative reviews. Some people are just so negative and picky. Also keep in mind that these are NOT $500 perfect speakers. These are VERY GOOD speakers that are splendid and do an excellent job for what they are meant to do. If you want to run expensive speakers then buy the dot and bluetooth connect them. If you want to save money and absolutely enjoy a solid speaker then these new 2nd gen speakers are excellent, especially if you buy a 3 pack (while the special is still running). And yes, I do own an extreme sound system for my music and movies that has around 3000 watts, 3 (800 watt subs), a 1500 watt center speaker, 4 rear speakers and 2 tower speakers. Complete overkill. So..., do I know good sound?! Yes! That is why I rate these small cylinder speakers excellent for what they do, which is a lot! The music is clear and concise, meaning not muddled, and Alexa's voice is strong but not overbearing, but very pleasant. Most times I am asking for the volume down as I do not need it any louder. We mostly use Alexa for instant information, room filling music, news, and book reading. We have these around the house for instant exercise music, relaxation music and we use the room to room speakers for an intercom system which works excellent!!! We also love making Group of speakers play the same thing in a certain area which sounds awesome! We use it for recipes too! And we love how quick Alexa is! Even on loud volume everything is clear, including using the Drop In intercom system and when someone is talking too loud it does not disrupt the speaker. It is absolutely clear. Our teenage daughter has an issue with shouting into the mic. Uh we hear you sweetie. Lol All in all, again it is sad that there are so many negative people that love to be negative. On a scale of 1-10, for the money, these are around a 9 with 10 being perfect and there are not many perfect things in this world except the perception of perfection, which Amazon has done a darn good close replica of that word!!!! Thank you Amazon!!! And yes, I paid with my own money for all of the speakers, Amazon did not give me any money or deals to write this. I honestly was just mad at the negative reviews. ;-) Enjoy!!!

I had not used Alexa before. It was difficult and frustrating trying to connect it to the home network. I never did get it to connect with the phone app. I had to go to https://alexa.amazon.com/ on a computer. The commands are straightforward, just use the Google commands such as Convert, Translate, define, etc. You can also ask it about the time, about the temperature outside. I suppose some people may find that discovering all the commands would be an adventure. I just wish they'd put them in the help section. Speaking of setup, if you want to find the serial number of your device, get a microscope or magnifying glass. It's in tiny tiny numbers and letters on the bottom of the box. If you have more than one to set up, you'll have to know the serial number so you know which one you're working with. But the biggest problem I have with it is the nonadjustable bass. After some finagling, I got it to play my Amazon music library (although I don't have all the kinks worked out of that yet). There's tons of bass, and there's no way to reduce it. I've tried all kinds of commands and requests, but Alexa just doesn't understand. I think it's probably a good speaker setup (tweeter and woofer), but there's no way to tell because of all the bass. Amazon should put an EQ control in the app or a knob for EQ adjustment on the Echo. I'm really tempted to send it back because of this.
They really need to allow you to adjust the Treble and the Bass on this.

I bought this two months ago to go with my echo dots. Amazon replaced the one that I bought because of all the issues I had with it. However, the replacement one is not any better than the one I bought. In fact, it may be worse. My issues are: - I ask "give me a weather report" and 85% of the time it either doesn't go into the spinning light or it goes into the spinning light and there is no audio answer. I check the app and it shows the answer multiple times. - I ask "set a reminder" and it responds 80% of the time that it's "having trouble understanding right now". - 30% of the time when it does respond, it cuts off in mid-sentence. - Asking it to play a song or my Amazon playlist is like pulling teeth. It either just doesn't respond or it can't understand. - I only use my echo dot to get the 'question of the day' because I can't rely on my Echo to not drop out of the program. - Even when it does respond correctly, I find myself having to use a very loud voice to get that response. I was excited to try this product, but now I have to say it is primarily a waste of money. I find myself trying to use it less and less. In fact, I have even resorted to just using my smart home app to turn on my lights instead of fighting with the Echo to get the job done. I am constantly sending feedback to Amazon, but there doesn't seem to be any improvement making this product not worth the hassle. I just wanted to get answers to simple questions and to play some music ever once in a while. I would not recommend this product.

12/3 I was so excited to receive this but I have been unable to get it working. First it sputtered over setting up correctly but after a few tries it finally worked (I am not a novice - I have two Echo Dots which I have set up without any issues). Then it refused to play any music - whether that is from the radio, prime music or any other source. It was acknowledge what I was asking for (demonstrating that it understood and was connected to the internet) but then would do absolutely nothing. Amazon email customer support said they were aware of the issue and that the engineering team would solve it soon. As I looked for other reviews and forum postings noting the same issue, I realized that what Amazon customer service was telling me was pure fiction because I couldn't find anyone with the same issue. Unplugging and re-plugging in would cause it to work but only temporarily so I wrote back to customer support who asked for me to call them. They got me to restore to factory settings and after this it worked for a while. But then it stopped working altogether - dead. Completely dead. I un/re-plugged in and it started up but now I couldn't connect to wifi. I called customer support and two tech folks later they agreed to replace. I then got an email from Amazon stating that I should both return the defective unit to them AND dispose of it. I have absolute faith that Amazon would do the right thing and indeed they are but boy....it took too many phone calls, too many questions to determine what I always knew - that the unit was defective and even then customer service's response was contradictory and confusing (I still dont know whether I have to return the defective unit!?!). I really hope the replacement is better as it seems much nicer in so many ways to the Echo Dot. I will update this review when I get it up and running but I want to post this so that anyone else that has the same issue knows they are not alone.

UPDATE: I had set up my Echo using my Kindle Fire. My Kindle Fire did not have all the updated software and apps it needed which made my Echo buggy. Just like when my batteries are low in the remote for my Smart TV my TV starts to act glitchy. I change the batteries in the remote and my TV works perfectly again. Whatever device you use to set up your Echo (or alexa device) be sure the software and apps are fully updated. Now it works as well as my Tap and Echo Dot. Simple fix and you would think Amazon would suggest this! Now the sound quality seems fine but I am not an audiophile nor would I expect Bose quality sound out of this. If your Echo is having trouble understanding you then use the feature to help it learn. The information provided about what this will and won't do is all available online so be sure you know what you're getting before you buy. If Amazon doesn’t update it very soon with a fix to tone it down I will definately have to return it for refund — I’m better off without it. I was much happier with the original 1st gen Echo’s sound and even the Dot did a reasonable job at its price point & size category. I really hate it when products overblow bass, especially when they can’t even produce a full bass range. There is a place for a cheap boom-box but it isn’t in my Echo.
